Summary: I stayed here for over a month due to a long business trip and I had to move my room twice.. I had the worst bed bug problems. I stayed in room 243 first and asked them to move me after countless bites all over my body. Then in room 211, it seemed the bugs got on to my carrier and got bitten again. I talked to the manager and she stated bed bug bites do not appear visible until two weeks later and that I brought it from my previous hotel. Ridiculous! She was confident her rooms were clean after she had a third party come out and do an inspection. I got a copy of the inspection and the third party checked my first room while checking for roach problems in another room. Since she was so confident her room was clean, I asked her to have someone stay in room 211 after I move again,
Manager Response: Dear TripAdvisor’s Reader,     Thank you for being interested in our property and for spending the time to read our hotel’s reviews.  Please allow us to shed some light on this review by sharing some of the information from the property’s side.  During the guest’s stay we received a claim that the guest is experiencing some sort of bites or an allergic reaction that caused a rash. The guest was immediately moved to a different room.  An urgent request- to a well-known pest control company- was placed to conduct an inspection (a 3rd party company as mentioned in the guest’s review)  The inspection stated that our rooms are free of any type of insects, and copy of the report was presented to the guest.  As mentioned in the guest review, I’m confident we don’t have this type of issue and that we explained to the guest that we do everything in our ability to protect our property from having such problem brought in. We have daily inspections by our trained housekeeping staff and a bi-weekly service to act as a protective shield from any possible bug infestation that may occur.  Without going into more details about the exact conversation with the guest, I would like to assure you that we take those claims very seriously and because we don’t have anything to hide: the guest was provided with the detailed report; however, he still didn’t accept the fact that our rooms were not the reason behind his rash. I also would like to advise you that we already completed a pro-active preventive treatment to all of our guest rooms.     Thank you for giving us a chance to provide this clarification and we hope to see you soon.  Rania and the team

Manager Response: Good day, Ari T. Thank you very much for leaving us review of your stay. We sincerely apologize for your inconvenience and your comment will be reviewed by the management and team members. It is always very restrictive when guests book through third party websites since third party websites have different policy than the reservations booked directly by property or Best Western central reservations. Again, we definitely will take an action of what we can improve on so our next customers don't experience something similar. We really hope you give us another chance to earn your business in the future. Thank you very much,

Summary: Hotel served its purpose as a base of travelling around the west coast but not for me as a hotel, I think more people live their than holiday their, staff friendly and helpful breakfast is a joke it's shocking but you get what you pay for, it was cheap so should take this into consideration, p.s if you doing universal etc do not stop in Anaheim we did both Disney parks over two days other than that stop up by Hollywood or Venice beach area as the traffic is horrendous no point in stopping at anahiem as everything else is north west l.a.
Manager Response: Hello, kencrowley. We really appreciate your review and your review has been well reviewed by our management team. Universal studio is definitely not close by, ~38 miles away. Any hotels near Hollywood, Santa Monica will be almost three to four times more expensive than we are. However, within 5 mile range, there are Disney Land, Downtown Disney, Orange Outlet, Angel's Stadium and South Coast Plaza Mall. I hope you utilized the shuttle service during your stay because it's very convenient for many of our guests going to Disney Land. We apologize for any aspects that didn't meet your expectation; however, we will do our best to be better next time! We hope you have a great trip!

Summary: To start if I could give no stars I would!  this hotel was the worst experience of my life.  we originally booked with them back in February 2015 to take my daughter to Disneyland for her 1st bday, shortly after we booked the measle outbreak took place and we had to cancel are trip per her physician. The hotel manager told me we would have a hotel credit to use within one year.  I called to use my credit june 8 2015 I booked the hotel for the weekend of august 21st, having a strongman competition at the arena I figured would be perfect with the location. On are way to CA the hotel calls my phone and says they are not going to honor the credit and will not refund the credit, tells me we do not have a room at that hotel. and hangs up. I have contacted corporate since who tells me
Manager Response: Dear TripAdvisor’s Reader,  Thank you for being interested in our property and for spending the time to read our hotel’s reviews.  As a member of the hotel’s management team, I would like to clarify the reason that prevented our property from applying any courtesy credit to this guest’s reservation as referenced in this review.  The guest’s original non-refundable reservation for February of 2015 was considered a no-show because the guest didn’t show up due to a family emergency. As a courtesy, we agreed to apply the amount as a credit on the guest’s future stay. Unfortunately, a few weeks later we received a dispute file from our merchant services. The file stated that the guest is in fact disputing the credit card transaction and accusing the property of placing an unauthorized charge on their account.  Due to that action, the guest lost the courtesy credit and was advised that we will continue to hold their reservation; however, they will be responsible for the payment associated with the room cost…. At that point, the guest decided to cancel.     We hope this clarifies our property’s side of the story….. And thank you again for taking the time to read our response.  We hope to see you soon,  Rania

Summary Heading: Best Western Meridian Inn and Suites
Summary: Very nice one bedroom suite with king sized bed and a living room . Lots of space. Good value for the price. Good breakfast. Free parking, free internet. Not too far from Disneyland, about 3 miles away.  Close to the freeway and close to the Outlets at Orange.
Manager Response: Hello, Gregory T! First of all, we really appreciate for sparing time to write a review of Best Western Plus Meridian Inn and Suites, Orange, CA. As you mentioned, the property is very centrally located with lots of places nearby. Being in Orange County, nice weather throughout the year is a plus! We are currently planning for major renovation for public areas so please check it out when it's finished! Thank you again and we hope to see you next time!

Summary: From checking in to checking out our experience was great.  The staff were always available to assist.  We will be staying there in the future.  The breakfast  was great.  The Breakfast Staff were always smiling and ready to assist with anything.
Manager Response: Good day, erimax! Thank you very much for sharing your experience at Best Western Plus Meridian Inn & Suites, Orange, CA! We are so glad that we were able to assist with your hotel experience. We strive our best to meet every customer's expectation. I hope you had a chance to look around the Outlet Mall and Angel's stadium nearby within 5 min drive! Thank you very much again and see you next time!

Summary: very nice hotel, served us well for the purpose of our stay. very close to the angels stadium and disneyland. there was a shuttle service that picks up at this hotel and takes you to disneyland and downtown disney. staff was very friendly and had a lot of good advice for getting around town to site see. great experience, would recommend staying
Manager Response: Good day, Brian J. First of all, thank you so much for sparing your time to leave us a review. We are glad that we could provide service that you expected! We are only five minutes away from Angels stadium and about ten minutes away from Disney Land as you mentioned. I hope you had a chance to stop by the Orange outlet mall which is just right next to our property! We hope to see you again next time you visit Orange County area! Thank you very much and have a great day!  Management

Summary Heading: Free Breakfast, Free Parking, close to everything!!!!
Summary: We just came back from a trip to California August 2, 2015-August 9, 2015 staying at the Best Western PLUS Meridian Inn & Suites.  This hotel is about 3.1 miles from Disneyland and right off the main road that takes you to the beach area.  Newport Beach 11 miles etc.  This hotel had everything we were looking for a hot free breakfast and free parking and adding on top of that the room is a suite.  We had two separate rooms with couches, comfortable chairs and tables, an eating area with a coffee maker, refridgerator, and a microwave.  The living room also had a flat screen TV.  The bedroom had a flat screen TV mounted on the wall and 2 queen beds that were very comfortable to sleep on for a week.  There was ample furniture to store our family of fours clothes for the week and a
Manager Response: Dear michaelmH4152AC. We highly appreciate your detailed review! It is definitely one of the most detailed review we have ever seen so far!! We will share your review with our staff members. It encourages us to do better job for our future guests and yourself if you are returning next time! We will go under some major renovation very soon so please come back to check it out once it's done! Thank you very much again for your awesome review and see you next time!  Management

Summary Heading: Pictures and good reviews are deceiving!!!!!
Summary: I don't understand the great reviews! The only explanation is employees or friends are leaving them.  I'll start with the unfriendly reception by front desk clerk Evan. I would think that a pleasant happy face should be greeting guests at any establishment. The flight arrived at 8:30 at LAX. We waited for luggage, a rental car shuttle and car rental. The drive to this hotel was about an hour so we arrived way before check-in around 11:30 am. I had asked for early check and gladly would of paid extra to be able to check in shower and rest. Instead this front desk clerk was less than accommodating. He told me the earliest we could check in was1:00. We went exploring the area, shopped and had lunch. We get back I asked for a room with 2 queen beds which he accommodate for an extra
Manager Response: Dear mariu59. Thank you so much for completing review on your stay and we deeply apologize for inconvenience you experienced during your stay. We definitely strive your best to provide best customer service but it seems we have not met your expectations. LA/OC area is very busy during the summer vacation time and all hotels in the area run very high occupancy. Many guests check our around 11AM-Noon so we need some time to clean, make up  and inspect the room for the best quality. If the rooms are ready, we definitely do our best to accommodate; however, early check ins are always taking chances. Our property will be conducting major public area renovations including, hallways, lobby, front desk, and breakfast rooms very soon. It will be definitely refreshed once it's done and we hope we could have a chance to provide you a better service with a better product at the time. Please do not hesitate to contact us for anything we can do to earn your business back. Again, we apologize for your inconvenience. Thank you,  Management

Summary Heading: lots of room for the price
Summary: Big room to spread out for the price. Pool area is very nice and clean - front desk was out of pool towels regularly during out stay though. Breakfast offers enough choices for everyone to find something they like - waffles were great. Staff was friendly and helpful.
Manager Response: Hello, Lauran P! Thank you very much for submitting your experience with our hotel, Best Western Plus Meridian Inn and Suites in Orange, CA! As you noticed, we are 90% suites with one separate bed room, measuring up to 500 sq/ft!! It is very unusual size to be this big and hard to find a hotel room with this much of space at very reasonable price! We are very happy to hear that you had a good time staying at our hotel! We will have more variety of choice for breakfast once we renovate our breakfast area by end of this year. Please come back and stay with us and we will do our best to accommodate you and your family again! I hope you have a great day! Thank you,   Management

Summary Heading: Dirty rooms, poor customer service and unsatisfied rewards program
Summary: When booking a hotel there are 5 requirements, cleanliness, location, value, customer service and rewards. Out of the of the 5 only 2 were met. As a former hotel manager of a different Best Western I generally do not write bad hotel reviews because I understand all the work that goes into maintaining a property. But with that being said I am a loyal customer of Best Westerns because I take pride in the brand. Unfortunately due to a series of events with the brand I have come to write this review 3 months after our stay.  This was a family vacation to Disneyland with our 2 toddlers. We had just driven 8hrs to get to the hotel and the kids were anxious to finally get out of the car. We entered into a nice mini suite that had a separate sitting room and kitchenette, it was a nice
Manager Response: Dear hoteltraveler2015, First of all, thank you very much for sharing your experience of stay. We apologize we didn't meet your expectations. Your comment will be shared and we will do our best to fix deficiencies. The Best Western International will be going through brand relaunch very soon and we hope some of your concerns get resolved with it. Also, at property level, we will be doing some major renovations for public areas. Once everything is in place, we promise everything will be so much better. Again, we are so sorry and hope to earn your business back in the near future. Thank you very much,  Management

Summary: Room was clean, expect we found ants in the bathroom on the last 2 days. Kitchenette had a single cup coffee maker, microwave oven and sink, nothing else. Breakfast was fine, nothing special. Nice hotel, a bit far from Disneyland. Shuttle service good, expect it was only once per hour.
Manager Response: Dear W4230SFdonnad. Thank you very much for your great review of BEST WESTERN Plus Meridian Inn & Suites, Anaheim-Orange ! We are so glad that we were able to provide you with excellent service. BEST WESTERN Plus Meridian Inn & Suites is located just about ten minutes away from Disney Land and is considered Disney Land area. Unlike hotels right in the front, our property does NOT charge resort fee or any sorts of fees including parking and wireless if booked directly through hotel. This is a good value since you are getting almost twice big of room than anywhere else! We hope to see you next time again for your Disney Land trip and thank you so much for your review!  Management

Summary: Beautiful hotel ! Fast, easy check-in by friendly staff. Full hot breakfast (eggs, bacon,sausage and waffles) as well as the usual fare. Right next to a Denny's. Room was not overly large but clean and modern. Large bathroom. If you care about the view you will be disappointed. Close to the freeway. Very comfortable tables and chairs out front (covered from the rain we had for our whole trip). Overall, very nice!

Enjoyed this experience. No major problems. Staff was courteous and helpful. Worth the money. Hotel needs to purchase more supplies for the busier seasons like summer. Ran out of towels in the hotel a few times and had to wait for laundry.

After 3.5 hours in LA traffic (Malibu to Orange) we arrived at the hotel. Easy check-in. Nice pool/hot tub. Our room was 135, right next to the pool. I was worried about the noise, but it quieted down at 10pm and we were able to get a great night's sleep.  The room was large: living room/kitchenette and separate king bedroom and bathroom.  Our king bed was incredibly comfortable.  Breakfast was good; plenty of food and very strong coffee! Restaurants and shops are about 5-10 min away from hotel.

They do not try to get you a room you requested even if you already gave them a request. They make you wait past check in. They don't replenish food too often. They don't replace broken items in a timely manner. They don't care if you request a certain room even though you had a reservation for months and asked way in advanced. They don't care if you pregnant or not

During my stay I have never experienced such bad customer service. Female Hispanic desk clerk and male black clerk were ridiculing guests behind their back. Room was nice with a two room suite but have never seen such bad customer service from a hotel. Breakfast was good with a good variety including eggs, waffles and meat along with the usual breads and pastries. Wish the pool had been not been down for repair without notice.

I felt this hotel was a really good value.  Convenient to Disneyland and other attractions in Orange County, spacious two room suites, clean, friendly staff, free parking. The shuttle to DL is not free....$5.00/person RT.  Appreciated free breakfast, but menu did not change the whole time we were there. And coffee was not great, but Starbucks close by. Kitchenette was a plus.  Were in a courtyard room facing the pool but since we were up early anyway, the noise from the courtyard did not really bother us and was quiet when we returned from DL late and tired. Only time noise was a bother was from birds squawking in the trees early in the morning.  That only happened once. Located in a business park but did not feel unsafe. Good stay for us.

Summary Heading: Nice Hotel suite near Disney Land and the L.A. Angles
Summary: I was helping my Son move in and we arrived a few days before his lease started.  (This was the weekend of June 12-14) Since we both big baseball fans we choose this hotel because its less than five minutes from  L.A. Angles stadium. (We noticed many of the guest staying their were going to Disney land which the Hotel provided a free shuttle) The rooms are a large two room suite with a TV's in both rooms. The pool area was nice and the free breakfast was fine. We ate in courtyard by the pool. All the staff were helpful and very pleasant, which made for a nice stay.

We have held 4 Marriage Retreats here at this location. The entire staff is VERY professional. The Manager, Rania is so VERY helpful, very kind and so VERY professional. We will be back for additional weekend Marriage Retreats.

Nice large rooms, very clean and good beds. Breakfast was you would expect and I would suggest eating outside in the courtyard. We had a problem with not being able to turn off the shower. We called and the owner was up in minutes and fixed it until the Plummer came. It was fixed by the time we came back for our afternoon naps from the park. the pool and courtyard area is so pretty and well kept.

This hotel has wonderful two-room suites for a great price. The bathrooms were a little old, but overall the rooms were clean and large. You didn't feel cramped. There were two televisions so you could relax in either room. The breakfast bar is satisfactory and the pool area is genuinely beautiful. If you're looking to have your cake and eat it too, this is a great hotel.

Excellent hotel. Very clean and quiet, private. It's our home away from home. We drive down just to relax and enjoy the king room suite. Very comfortable bed. Nice living room area, although the sofa I think is a bit old and needs to be replaced, otherwise great decor. Very private. Jacuzzi in room is a plus. Staff at check in and check out are so nice. Breakfast was good.

As some people mentioned during the card access outage, they had to get the maintenance people to open our room.  A bit inconvenience but we were okay with it.    Other minor issues: Our room was not ready when they told us to go our room and we had to wait almost half an hour in the halfway. AC stopped working one day but they sent a gentleman up to fix it after we called.  Pros: Everyone really worked hard here.  We saw the manager(?) working in the breakfast area early in the morning till 7 or 8 in the evening. Kids loved the pool Clean and comfortable room.  We had a suite on the 3rd floor and the room was really big with a fridge, microwave...  Less than 5 minutes driving to the Orange Outlet.

This hotel has excellent beds with roomy livingroom area and wet bar but unfortunately falls short due to the aging building and lack of cleanliness in the eating areas. I would actually recommend this hotel due to location and variety of breakfast items but you would need to overlook the sloppiness of the breakfast area and the same breakfast choices. Sausages, scrambled eggs, hot waffles, oatmeal, cereals, breads and yogurt with granola. It does feel private and is located in a business area with great shopping locally. The building is secure and no one can enter the premises unless they have a key. Pool and jacuzzi are outdoor in the middle of the hotel.

While this hotel is very close to where I need to be for frequent business meetings, the coffee is absolutely horrible.  That's the one thing I need right as I wake up and the cafeteria has a machine that heats up the coffee, actually burning it.  It has been thick at times and the staff constantly tells me that the machine was just serviced or repaired again.  They are complacent about it and shrug their shoulders.  I'm obviously not the only one complaining so please get another coffee maker already!!!!

Excellent accommodation. Met our expectations. Clean, comfortable room. Nice patio and pool area. Very close to Orange county attractions. As other reviewers have said, the internet service here is totally bad. The front desk said "it is getting fixed soon" but this appears to have been a problem for a long time, according to past reviews.

Overall this hotel is tired and worn. Quest services especially housekeeing and front desk staff fall short of expectations. Calls to front desk were handled with an unprofessional manner. Location of hotel was a plus with easy access to travel routes (freeways). Nearby outet mall was a plus also.

[1] Great location:       - to the Outlets at Orange for shopping and dining;       - to Disneyland;       - to Angel Stadium [2] Kind and really helpful staff  [3] Good breakfast by the swimming pool [4] Comfort bed [5] Not bad free internet (It would be better if it keep stable all the time.) [6] Enough Space of the 2 queen beds suite for family

Great place to get away from the hustle of the Disney strip. Quiet location, easy to find. Close to the Angels stadium with easy access to I5 and other highways. The enclosed courtyard makes security for younger children to play at the pool.

Stayed here 5 nights while taking Family to Disneyland. There is a shuttle bus here that comes every hour, but did not use it and unknown if there is a fee or not with it. We decided to drive there (well, to their parking lot anyhow). Room was clean. Mattresses were very comfortable. Four pillows per bed, 2 soft, 2 hard. A/C worked great. Refridgerator had ample room but did not have a separate freezer section (my only complaint about the room). Breakfast was better than average (than other Best Westerns.) Pool and pool area looked great but were too busy to ever try it. What impressed me the most was how extremely courteous the desk staff and breakfast staff were at this motel. Certainly would stay here again.

Amazing hotel, fantastic staff. We were shocked at how gorgeous the hotel was for the small price we paid. The staff, from front desk to breakfast crew, went above and beyond their duties. We will be back!

Pros-  1) Lovely, well appointed, spacious room 2) VERY comfortable bed, fridge, microwave.   3) Helpful staff Cons- 1) VERY loud upstairs neighbors 2) ART transit bus only came hourly (no hotel shuttle) 3) The same breakfast daily for 5 days 4) The trees dumped leaves, etc into the pool, and should have been cleaned out    more often throughout the day. 5) Only ONE coin op washer/dryer for the entire hotel.   We will choose a different hotel next time.

This is an average motel, and as long as you'll be out a Disney for much of the day, it's decent.  Room included a refrigerator which was a surprise.  The breakfast is fine, sometimes very crowded.  I like that there are hot option available including eggs, sausage and waffles.  Coffee not good though, in the room or at breakfast.   During one night of our stay, the fire alarm went off at least 10 times in a 15 minute period starting at 5 AM.  We're still not sure what happened, but no one came around to tell us it was a false alarm, so we waited in courtyard for the duration, then went back to bed once we realized it must be false alarm or smoking guest.  Also, it's not a quiet motel at night because you can always hear something going on.  I wore earplugs.   We arrived early

The hotel is well located, very friendly staff. Always a good value. I have stayed there six times and really enjoyed each stay. The hotel is close to disneyland and beaches. It is the only hotel for my family, and or when I travel alone.

The location is good, very close to freeways. Rooms are spacious and can easily fit a family of 4. Pool is big, jacuzzi could cool down a little bit. Breakfast is adequate. Staff are friendly. The guy named "Nagy" worked from early morning serving breakfast till late evening replacing trash bags in the pool area. He was friendly to guests. Our whole family like him a lot.   Now the negatives. You can hear a lot of noise when your neighbors are taking a shower. If they decide to take showers in the early morning or late night, your sleep could be distrupted. But I think most inns at this price range have this kind of issue.   The worst part is the internet. I had trouble during my entire stay using the wi-fi. I was able to connect but it kept dropping every once a while. I tried

The internet did not work at all. We called front desk and they said they would try and reboot the system but still no internet. The room was not all that clean with the remains of someone shaving in the sink. Not what you would expect for $170 a night.

Great location, very nice pool area and comfortable rooms. I have stayed at other hotels in the area and have found this one to be better located for my needs.  The rooms are much larger and more comfortable.

The room was beautiful - a suite which had a bedroom w/TV plus living room/kitchen with TV.  Nice size bathroom.  Only one tiny problem: no freezer in fridge.   Linens were fresh and soft.  Also large enough.  Pool looked great, didn't have time to use it.

Summary Heading: Nice place to stay for Disneyland or leisure.
Summary: The hotel was very quiet and very clean.  Close to a big  shopping mall and restaurants.  Only a few miles from Disneyland and close to freeways.  Shuttle service to Disneyland is available.  Staff was friendly and helpful.  Breakfast was good, a little above your standard hotel. A lovely courtyard was outside of the breakfast room.  There is a little difficulty finding the way to get out of the hotel but it was a minor problem. I would stay there again.

Summary Heading: Beware of the Princeline Resort Fee
Summary: I am not happy at all the resort fee....Booooooooo....A big Bronx Cheer for this place...If you wish to avoid this fee stay  more than 5mi away from Disneyland...The stay was average...I have stayed a worse (John Milton Inn Syracuse, NY worst motel on the planet).  I have stayed at better Courtyard Santa Ana McArthur Place...Just be aware of the Resort Fee when bidding on Priceline.

I have stayed at many of the hotels (Best Western and others) in the area. There are many choices, but for the price and quality, Meridian Inn & Suites takes the cake!   We had a great experience from check-in to our first impression of the room, through our entire stay. The location looks safe, a lot of shopping and restaurants nearby.   They have a full breakfast buffet with eggs, sausage, waffles, and a few different fruits and drinks.  We didn't utilize their shuttle but they have one for Disneyland- $5/ person per day (round trip). It is about 1 mile off the 5, only 1 exit South of Katella, and 3 from Disneyland. From the Parking structure to the hotel took about 10 minutes.  I would absolutely recommend this hotel to anyone.

Things Wrong! Zero Stars!  1. Called to ask questions about reservation, got put on hold, waited 20 minutes and no one ever came back.  2. If I could post pictures I would, carpets turned my babies knees and feet black who is 10 months old, and my feet.  3. Unsatisfactory breakfast. 4. Fridge wasn't working right and spoiled all my baby food.  5. Rude staff.  6. Check in person got rude cause I wanted to read what I was signing. Rediculous right! Why would I want to read that?  7. Elevator door closed on my husband, and then a second time closed on my baby stroller nearly smushing his fingures. 8. Wet carpets.  The first night, asked for a manager to get a refund and leave. As it was a refund I wanted, and the staff were rude, I wanted a manager. No manager apparently. Was told

Summary Heading: Comfortable Stay, but Rough Around the Edges
Summary: Let me start by saying that I travel quite a bit for work and, given my preference, I stay with either Holiday Inn or Best Western. As far as Best Westerns go, the Meridian Inn & Suites is on the lower end of the scale for me.  The Good: In terms of overall comfort levels, they did a good job. We were upgraded at check-in to a "VIP" suite, which includes an entire dining room table with 4 chairs and kitchenette. The bed was comfy, the lighting in the room was kind of cool and dramatic, and the temperature control was great. The pool area is also pretty impressive, with lots of landscaping and a beautiful fountain. We also enjoyed the free breakfast, which had sausages (!!),  eggs, and fresh waffles! The location is also fantastic... 10 minutes from Disney, the Angels, and the

I stayed at this hotel in approximately 5 different rooms for 8 weeks for business and my stay was very comfortable and exactly what I needed.  The hotel was overly accommodating, allowing to switch rooms at one point, and to allow me to reserve a conference room at the last minute.  The rooms are large and the beds are comfortable.  I even worked out in the gym and did laundry here.  The rooms were very fitting for my stay and adequately provided.    I want to thank Kimberly at the front desk, who was the sweetest and most welcoming representative I have ever met at a hotel.  You can tell she takes her job seriously and was so incredibly accommodating to me.  She would greet me by my name every time I saw her, which made me feel extremely welcomed.  She was there to get

The price was right, the one bedroom King Suite was very spacious, it was clean and comfortable, the kitchenette had nothing but a sink, fridge and microwave, bring your own utensils...The bedroom TV worked sometimes, it was reported but we were there for 5 nights and nothing was done. Our room was tired, in much need of refurbishment, the paint colours were very dark, furniture was worn... As I said it was clean...The free breakfast was a shambles, the room far too small for the number of people in attendance, the food was your average Best Western fare, it is included so if you can enjoy it, it is okay...Ample parking and elevators... Once again a property with a lot of potential...

Summary Heading: Be aware of resort fee when bidding on priceline
Summary: It comes as a surprise when I "name your price" and "win", but find that extra $60 resort fee I have to pay (to the hotel) and the bill has already been charged.  The carpet does not look clean. The curtains cannot cover all the lights from outside during the night. The staff members are friendly. They help us find our missing glass cup.

This is a very nice hotel in an excellent location. I have stayed here before on business trips. There are restaurants and shopping close by. The hotel is very clean and somewhat updated with a nice pool, exercise room and breakfast

We had found this hotel after a bad stay in Anaheim. Luckily there was a room available. This hotel is clean and the staff are great! We got a great rate too! Upon Check-in we found our room was near the pool and we had good access to parking. We had a separate living area. The beds were comfortable.

Spacious suite, good breakfast, pleasant, helpful staff. Convenient location near Chapman University, restaurants, Disneyland and other choice places to visit. Able to visit LA, San Diego, beaches, local breweries, historic districts with a rental car.  Best deal for the money!

CLEAN Great for us as I am an earlier riser.  So...I  can watch tv have my coffee use the internet etc without disturbing my husband. Ideal for a family as sofa makes out into bed Nice pool, laundry facillties if you need them. small excercise room, tables outside for breakfast if the morning weather permits .  Breakfast served w nice selection.  Coffee way better than most!!

We have stayed at this hotel on numerous occasions and have always been happy.  The rooms are always clean and they are spacious.  The breakfast is nice; eggs & sausage, cereal, waffles, breads, juice & coffee.  It would be nice if the menu items were a bit varied throughout the week, as most people who stay here do so for multiple nights since it is only a quick drive to Disneyland. The pool and hot tube are well kept. The staff has always been friendly.

Hotel was clean. Had a great breakfast. Hotel employees were very friendly and helpful.  Room was clean, but had a odd odor upon entering . Noise level was horrible probably didn't help that we were right next to an access door and the pool/hot tub. Noise level in the room above us sounded like they had on lead slippers.

I stayed here with some friends while on a Disneyland trip over the weekend. The hotel was just a short drive from the theme park (10 min at most), was reasonable, had an awesome free breakfast, very clean rooms and comfortable beds. I have already booked it for my next Disneyland weekend trip.

Quiet room with an extremely comfortable bed.  Friendly staff and great continental breakfast.  Perfect location close to Disney Land.  Everything met our expectations including the price.  Will stay again!

Are room had a musty smell to it but was very clean, beds comfy and breakfast was decent. Noise level from other guests made it hard to sleep. Yelling and doors slamming probably didn't help that our room was located by the access door aND pool area. All in all I would stay here again.

My room was really very nice.  It had a large kitchen area.  And the suites with additional rooms are also really very nice.  The TV's worked great, A/C worked great & the kitchen area was spacious.  Things not so great: no room service, internet was kinda slow & the kitchen had to supplies other than some coffee cups with the copy maker.

The accommodations good value but the hotel policy regarding credit card at check-in opens up to potential identity theft or overcharge by staff. Requires staff take imprint of credit card and leave blank for future fill-in, copy of driver's license for their files and no receipt given at check-out. Not worth the risk to stay at this hotel while these practices in place.

Summary Heading: STUCK in the elevator with my toddler son!!!
Summary: My son and I were stuck in the elevator that malfunctioned and took us down TO THE BASEMENT of the hotel and the staff did not know what to do!  I am very upset with the hotel in regards to safety measures for their customers.  The elevator DID NOT have a functioning "alarm/help" button and the phone inside the elevator could not be accessed to get help!!! IS THAT EVEN LEGAL?!  Luckily, I had my cell phone on me and was able to call my husband to alert the hotel that my young son and I were trapped in the stuffy elevator!  They sent someone down to the basement to help me, he said he needed to call the elevator company to get me help and for me to wait and that they will not forget about me. WOW!! HOW CAN YOU NOT KNOW HOW TO GET TRAPPED CUSTOMERS OUT OF YOUR OWN ELEVATOR?

Summary Heading: Theft on their property, inconsiderate staff.
Summary: Stayed here numerous times for business and  had no complaints at all. Everyone was friendly and helpful, good breakfast and the rooms were nice. I thought this would be my go to hotel for when I visit the area for business every week. Until my last stay, me as well as another guest got our car broken into. When I told them about it, their reaction was odd. And one of them replied "well, it IS public property". YES but it is also your place of business where your guests should feel safe and comfortable! They claimed they would help me by ordering surveilance footage and they have yet to contact me back about it. When I called them to inquire about it after not hearing from them when they said I would,the manager broke the news to me that the person who was to review the footage

Wonder how corrupt the staff is.  Had to fight for a receipt for cash.  They said I had to sign a blank credit card receipt.  Said they couldn't give me a receipt until I checked out.  I said if I just handed them cash how could I prove I had ever paid them.  Said signing a blank credit card slip is not to smart.  they could fill in whatever they wanted.  Spent a lot of time trying to get through to them.  Also glasses and cups were not replaced in room.  Rinsed out and put on a towel.  Needless to say we didn't use them.  We would have moved to another hotel, but we were visiting with family.  Wanted collect points with BW.  But stayed in Hampton's on the way home.  Got an application from them to collect points.  Their staff was great, and you could actually see-the lighting

Great little hotel. Clean rooms and kids loved the pool. Only complaint was about the staff at check in. Not very friendly at all, but have to say overall stay was great. Would definitely stay again. Breakfast was average and coffee could be better. Tasted like colored hot water.

We stayed in this place for 3 nights with 2 rooms last May 8, 2015.  I would rate the hotel 3.5 instead of 4 just because the building has an old building smell. The suite itself is very roomy, clean and has a  sitting room area. The people working there were friendly and polite. There was a guy there who is a "Jack of All trades". He does the breakfast servings on weekends and i guess maintenance of the place. He was very helpful. He saw we needed help and he asked us if he can help us.The beddings were good and towels were new.  The only problem we had for 2 nights, which we didn't reported to management, were directly above our hotel room 242 were kids running around their room and we can hear it from below. The young children were running around even at 11pm. I guess it

2nd time within 6-9 months I have stayed here.  Depending on your preference of bed; we enjoy staying here for getting a good nights rest. Again the wifi didn't work in our area, had to walk out our room toward the front of the building to use wifi, this was our only annoyance.

Booked room with whirlpool... got tub w/ 4 non-working jets on sides so if they worked would have hit knees. Kids allowed to run rampant & screaming. Heating was extreme hot or cold. Disappointed in Hotel Brand...

Great place to stay overall. It is a "green" facility . Great for those who like to conserve. They have all the amenities though. Even a free full breakfast every morning. I recommend the home made waffles, which are prepared for you. They even offer sugar free syrup as well as regular for the waffles. Free parking!!!!! WIFI works off and on . i'd give it a 7 out of 10. has a little gym that gets the job done. Front desk is awsome and friendly ! Great overall stay for the price

Summary Heading: Best Western Meridian in Orange Co
Summary: The stay was excellent and the staff was very helpful. They cared a lot about everything I needed assistance with. I loved how happy they all were. Thank you for the best hotel experience I've ever had!

At a last minute notice I booked 2 rooms.  Upon my arrival I was told the reservation had been made for the next day.  I was starting to get upset since I had also called to confirm rooms were available.  Right away they check and made sure it was a mistake on their part.  They fixed the problem and accommodated my stay.  I was extremely satisfied with the result and the quality of service.  Thank you for making my family happy.

This is my second time staying here. The rooms are spacious, clean, and comfortable. The pool was clean and warm. The spa is a little small for the amount of people but did the job. Breakfast had good scrambled eggs with sausage and a variety of cereals and breads.

Summary Heading: Good hotel for visit to Disneyland
Summary: This hotel is a few miles away from Disneyland, but easy trip to get there.  The hotel was very clean and comfortable. The room has separate living/kitchen area and separate sleeping/bath area.  The bed was very comfortable.  The hotel is located in a business park and was very quiet. There are several restaurants in the the area. Breakfast was average, but with a good variety.  Staff was very friendly.  We would consider this hotel again if traveling to the Orange County area.

Stayed here for three nights while visiting Disneyland. It is part of a business park which was good so there was enough parking and it was relatively quiet, however there was no shuttle to the park so that one needs a car to get anywhere. Room was older, but clean and spacious. Would consider it again if the rate remains reasonable.

I take a group of senior students to Disneyland every year and this hotel has been my hotel of choice for the last two years. They have large queen suites that can accommodate four teens easily. The rooms are large and clean with lots of amenities. They have a good breakfast in the morning for the kids, and easy access to Disneyland. They make check in and check out very easy for our large group, and service with a smile always. I am looking forward to bringing another group next year to this location.

Any problems reported are always passed on as they look at you with a blank stare.  No one tries to correct problems immediately.  Come on guys, a cup of coffee is an easy fix and that's the last problem I experienced there.

have stayed many times at this hotel for last few years, best deal in the area, clean well kept friendly. very helpful staff, good breakfast options, nice pool & spa, nice outside courtyard seating area

Have stayed here before, convenient for where I needed to be.  Will stay again.  Very close to the Block for shopping and a nice variety of hotels.  Not close to amusement parks, but close enough, you don't have the traffic issue that hotels closer have.

I just stayed here for 5 nights with some friends and family. We had a really great stay. The room and linens were always clean, and I loved how friendly and helpful the staff were. We had a huge suite that came with a kitchen, a fridge and an eating area, there was so much space! The pool and the breakfast are both huge bonuses to this hotel. They had a hot breakfast of eggs & sausage along with toast, waffles, fruit, coffee, pastries, cereal, ect. It was fantastic! The hotel also offers a shuttle to and from Disney. It's $5.00 per person/per day, and you can ride it as many times a day as you wish. Overall this hotel was amazing, I would recommend to anyone who wishes to have an amazing trip with a decent price. (:

Very large rooms with adjacent sitting areas, nicely done. Pool area and breakfast were also very nice. Great amenities and good location. An excellent value for the money! We would definitely come back to stay again.

We always stay here when visiting Disneyland. We've never been disappointed. This is a clean comfortable place with comfy beds, and it is a very easy and traffic-free drive to the park. We will definitely stay here again and recommend it to our friends and family.

We spent five nights at this hotel as we were in town for the Star Wars convention. It was a nice room, however when we came back at night after our first day at the convention we saw our door was ajar. Luckily nothing was taken but my husband immediately contacted the front desk to let them know what had happened. He was told the manager would be in touch but this never happened. My husband attempted to reach the manager several times; however each time he was told the manager was not in. On the same day our door was left open the maid also forgot to give us towels. Luckily I notced this before I got in the shower, but when I called the front desk the clerk said no one was available to bring us any so I had to go myself. Breakfast was sufficient; however if you stay longer than

We stayed 4 nights and it was really great. The room was comfortable and spacious, the courtyard was beautiful and the outdoor pool was amazing. Our first night here we were talking to Kimberly and Maria at the front desk and they were so helpful and friendly! They are definitely the reason that I would return to this hotel in a heartbeat! Nagi (sp) was so nice to us too.

We stayed here after our drive from San Diego. Rooms were clean, with lots of room. Had a kitchen sink, fridge and microwave. Kids loved the pool. Breakfast was ok can get a little busy. I suggest they need to find a better spot for the waffle maker as people were lining up for the hot breakfast but we're being held up in the waffle line. Free parking was a bonus and staff were nice and friendly. Lots of shops close by 5-10 min drive.  It was about a 10 -15 min drive to Disneyland. Hotel offered free shuttle but never used it. Wi-Fi was very slow and dropped in and out not great with teenage children. Overall it was not bad.

I was in room 237, a room that had known door lock and AC problems. A neighbor told me that they were working on the door the day before. When I went to use the key it took several attempts of wiggling just right to get the door to work. Not acceptable after a long day. Seeing the neighbor with the door open should have been a clue the the AC was inadequate. Other than that my stay was very good. Problems were reported.

Summary Heading: Room is great, service could improve
Summary: We stayed 2 nights. Room was spacious to accommodate a family of 5 so thats great! Free parking, wifi and breakfast buffet were great bonuses too.  Customer service could be better. 1.  I called front desk to ask for extra towels to be brought up to our room in early evening, and he said for me to come down and get them. Hmmmm...if my little ones werent in the bathroom all wet, maybe.   2.We went out all day just to find out upon returning, that our bed wasnt made. Housekeeper just threw all our stuff on the bed and took trash/replenish towels. Hmmmm...  Overall a good stay though. Its just the minor service details that make it excellent. Hopefully next time it will be.

Our suite met our needs perfectly as we attended a conference at the Anaheim convention center.  A 12 minute drive to the center and lots of good restaurants along the way. Some guests had kids who seemed to enjoy the pool area greatly.  I recommend an outside room to cut down on pool noise but it wasn't a problem for us.

Summary Heading: Other than a few annoyances it was great
Summary: I picked this hotel because it could accommodate  our family of 6 with a reasonable price,had a central location near Disney and a couple of freeways and the breakfast had good reviews.   The staff seemed friendly,( I think Nagy must work 24 hrs a day because he was always around) and the location is in a semi-business district so I never felt unsafe in the parking lot as there was never anyone around.Other hotels I have stayed in had homeless people hanging around the parking lot 24 hrs a day.There is a major outlet mall a couple of blocks away and other conveniences are also nearby.  The number one annoyance was horrible internet service.We could barely get service in our room and it was pathetically slow.I tried the guest computer in the lobby and it was worse.The breakfast

This is an overlooked gem! The Resort Transit comes to the front door.so you don't need to drive to Disneyland. The staff was wonderful. The rooms spacious and clean.The breakfast room is large and food plentiful.

I think the new ownership will help....it really is nicer inside than it looks like on the outside. But the paint in the bathrooms is chipping, and aside from the beds/bedding (superbly comfortable!), the rest looks tired and rather run-down. The pool is really warm, which is nice, and the front desk people are worth the stay. But for all the deals you can find in Orange/Anaheim, it seems a bit overpriced for what you get.

The staff was friendly and helpful. I would recommend staying here, the price was great.The breakfast was better than expected.I usually pay close to double the money for little nicer motel so the money I saved was well worth it.

We where there for a baseball game. The rooms are good size, it fit a family of 6 very nicely, everything was in working order and very quiet area. We got up for breakfast before checking-out and I would NOT recommend it. Everything was gone and the placed looked dirty/disorganized by the time we got up for breakfast. The rooms are great, the hotel is very quiet but the breakfast is not very appetizing.

Over the course of our stay I vacillated between a 1 and 4 rating for this hotel. There are some great things to like about this property, but there were also some frustrations. Please read the bottom of this review for two situations that greatly concerned me.  Pros: 1. Cost: We stayed during spring break and got a great deal. We paid less then we could find for other places on Hotwire. 2. Free parking and Free Breakfast:  It was nice to wake up each morning and not have to worry about extra fees, what we paid up front was what we paid.  The Breakfast had sausage, eggs, waffles, danish, cereal,   and an apple or orange each day. 3. two room Suite:  While it wasn't a huge suite it was still great to have a little privacy each night. 4. The room had a microwave, small

This was my first time staying at a Best Western PLUS.  Check in was easy, staff was VERY friendly/helpful and room was nice & clean.  Breakfast was very filling with many choices.  Grandkids had a ball swimming in the pool and soaking in the hot tub. Would staying here again in a heartbeat!

Very friendly and accommodating!!!! The first night we were there Kimberly helped us get the perfect room for our family. The hotel Manager helped us find some missing items and always had a smile on his face. Bill (maintenance) was friendly and helped fix our AC (it wasn't broken, I just didn't know how to use it). All the staff were helpful and friendly. Thank you for making our trip better; my son preferred the hotel over Disneyland - that's saying something.   Cat from Canada
Manager Response: Dear Cathena_5  Thank you for taking the time to write a review of Best Western Plus Meridian Inn & Suites, Orange, CA. It is great to know that you enjoyed your stay and regarded our staff to be kind. Turning A/C can be sometimes tricky as every hotel has different system; however, our staffs are available anytime to help with our guests' need! I also hope you enjoyed our two bedroom suite. We are only ten minutes away from Disneyland so there is no need to stay right on Disneyland with high resort fees! I will make a note of the amenities and bring it to management's attention.  Again, thank you again for your review and I hope to have an opportunity of welcoming you back again soon.  Sincerely,

Summary Heading: Fabulous, Great Staff, Very Clean, Very Comfortable bed
Summary: This was a delight!  Large room, with bedroom separated from living room.  Fabulous & comfortable bed.  Very clean.  Great shuttle to Disneyland.  Fantastic front desk staff.  They will try their best to make things perfect for you.  I would recommend this place to everyone.
Manager Response: Dear jan_ageless. Thank you very much for submitting review of Best Western Plus Meridian Inn and Suites, Orange, CA. I sincerely am glad that you enjoyed your stay! Our property is 90% suite like the one you stayed which has separated rooms for living room and bedroom. Being close to 600 sq/ft size of suite makes our property very unique with no resort fees! Thank you for acknowledging our staffs. I will share your review with all agents to encourage them so we could offer better service for any future guests.  Thank you very much again and hope you enjoy your day!  Sincerely,

Summary: I was sent here for business. The room and property were quite nice, spacious and clean. Its close to the mall:) The pool and jacuzzi were nice though I  didnt use them my friends did. The staff really stands out here as they really try to make your stay a good experience. They also have a bus that runs from the property multiple times a day to Disneyland.Its also situated in a center that has a wonderful mexican restarant:)

A very pleasant experience and stay at this really nice hotel. It's less than ten minutes from disneyland and includes free parking and breakfast which makes it completely a great value!   Stayed at the two queen bed suite which was fairly large for our family of four. Room was clean, modern and included mini fridge.   All in all it was a very nice stay here, however my experience at the front desk tops any previous accommodations I have ever had which even includes the Four seasons; George at the front desk was most pleasant, professional and welcoming. We were checking in around midnight after our trip from disneyland and we had a unique special accommodation request for our child and George was more than willing to be helpful in fulfilling our request at that late hour. He
Manager Response: Dear Harris E.  Thank you for your mind blowing review for Best Western Plus Meridian Inn & Suites, Orange, CA. Our staffs are the biggest asset of this hotel. I already have shared your comments of George with staffs. Reviews like yours definitely encourages everyone here at the hotel to offer better service. Also, I am glad that you enjoyed the ~600 sq/ft two bed room suites! It is very rare to offer this big rooms at reasonable price like us with no resort fees. We will do our best to make everything cost effective for our guest by providing FREE Internet, Free Breakfast, and FREE Parking.  Thank you very much again and have a great day!  Sincerely,

Summary: Room was clean, quiet and comfortable. Close to freeway but not too close to be noisy. We would consider staying hear again. The shuttle was convenient and reasonable for five dollars. Breakfast was ok, have had better and also had much worse. Acceptable for getting a start to your day.
Manager Response: Thank you for completing review of your stay at Best Western Plus Meridian Inn & Suites, Orange, CA. Our hotel is very accessible from major Highway 5 and Highway 22 yet is located a few blocks down so you don't hear any traffic noise. The shuttle runs every twenty minutes to an hour which makes it very convenient for our guests! I am glad that you were able to utilize this service. Have you had a chance to enjoy the Orange Outlet Mall right next door? They also have huge selection of shopping malls at discounted price. If you haven't, please come back and stay with us to enjoy even more next time!!  Thank you again and please do not hesitate to contact us for any future inquiries!

Summary: The rooms are very small.  The beds are uncomfortable.  The breakfast is disgusting with watered down orange juice, undrinkable coffee and a disgusting appearance.  The front desk staff are very rude (on phone, talking to co-workers, smelly) and it sets the stage for your experience there.  Do not book a room there!
Manager Response: Dear Linda L,  First of all, thank you very much for sparing your time to share your concern of your stay. I sincerely apologize that we did not meet your expectation. The biggest selling feature of our hotel is actually being 90% ~600 sq/ft suites. You might have stayed in a room that is not suite; however, those non-suite rooms are still ~300 sq/ft which is very standard sized compared to other branded hotels. Other issues will be brought to management's attention so we can try our best to fix/change our service to fit guests' needs.  For any questions or future inquiries, please do not hesitate to contact our hotel directly.  Have a great day.

Summary: We stayed here for a week while visiting Disneyland. It's relatively close to the parks and there's a huge outlet mall just down the road. The breakfast in the morning was nicely laid out and there's outdoor seating overlooking the pool which is nice if it's warm in the morning. Our room was a good size and the kitchen had good amenities.
Manager Response: Dear bm1224,  Thank you very much for your review of BEST WESTERN Plus Meridian Inn & Suites, Anaheim-Orange, California! We always encourage our guests to enjoy everything we have to offer including free breakfast (outdoor courtyard for breakfast), large outlet mall next door and very cost-effective shuttle right into the Disneyland! Our large suites are definitely the perfect fit for families who's going to Disneyland! Since we are centrally located, you can go anywhere in Southern California for a day trip and come back to stay! I am so glad that you had a chance to enjoy most of what we have to offer! Thank you!  Sincerely,

Summary: I don't remember his name but the front desk person was very helpful and friendly. The room was not the biggest but it was clean and neat. Great clean hotel to stay and plan on staying her again soon.
Manager Response: Dear, Brian S  First, thank you very much for completing survey regarding your stay at Best Western Plus Meridian Inn & Suites, Orange / Anaheim, CA. We are thrilled to heard that you loved stay with us! Did you get a chance to enjoy our courtyard pool and spa? If we can be help for your future stay, please do not hesitate to contact us directly!  Thank you again and enjoy upcoming summer!

Summary Heading: Some of the nicest Hotel Staff Ever
Summary: This hotel may look a little older on the outside. But don't judge a book by it's cover. Kimberly is at the front desk and she's one of the nicest people I've ever met. She took care of me and my wife every day during our honeymoon. Always smiling, always helpful, greeted us every time we walked in. The basic room is perfect sized for two people, very clean, toilet, shower room is small but not overly cramped. Breakfast was all high quality but not a huge selection.   Overall this hotel gets you some of the best bang for your buck you'll find in the disneyland area. Plus the ART shuttle only takes about 15 to 20 minutes to get to the parks.   Overall it's the people working here that makes this very solid hotel a GREAT find.

this hotel is very good i have been there since 8 years and still has the same great quality , if i will come back to orange and want a good quality location and hotel with great size this is the right place .

The hotel is in a quiet location but still close to Angel's stadium and Disneyland. We didn't use it, but were told about an hourly shuttle to Disneyland. The room was nice but we were not able to connect to wi-fi. We were able to connect nearer to the lobby. The breakfast choices are very good. We would stay at this place again.

Summary Heading: No darn iinternet, slower than DSL
Summary: Nide hotel, great staff, but poor management is they can not fix their crappy internet.  I was getting 1.24 down load and .04 upload.  In other words so slow they would time out.  Calls did no good.   I would not stay there until they fix that issue.

Good location for shopping.  Facility is well maintained.  Staff is very considerate and helpful.  Breakfast was well laid out and had a good variety of food items.  Not far from Disneyland and Garden Walk.

I booked this hotel due to it's proximity to the hospital, where I was taking a course. My room was comfortable, fashionable, and very clean.  The breakfast was adequate but most enjoyable because I was able to have it in the courtyard area. Good coffee. The pool and hot tub were perfect unwinding, and very well maintained.  The staff was very helpful and forth coming. j I enjoyed my stay!!

After searching the MANY hotels around DL, we selected this one. Was worried about the Eco-Friendly concept & Did NOT HAVE ANY ISSUES! Room was HUGE! Separate seating & bedroom a+. Breakfast was good, just small wait on refilling on some of the items and finding a seat, but it was understood the end of peak season for the park. I would def stay here again!

CSQE (convenient, safe, quiet, and economical) choice. near Disney land, highway, grocery, church, fitness club. Christ (formerly Crystal) cathedral is about 1 mile and worthy to visit. Possibly the best possible choice.

Summary Heading: Our Couples Marriage Retreat' The Mirror"
Summary: This was the third Retreat that we have held at this location. The location really fits our needs. The Staff is Fantastic. They take care of our needs with smiles on their faces ! The location of the hotel is great. There is no problem with parking. Over all, a wonderful place for our Marriage Retreat.

I appreciated the obvious effort of the housekeeping staff! Well stocked! Location is not a problem, but finding it and leaving it can be challenging in traffic. The bed was comparable to Embassy Suites and Comfort Inn. They just need to remember to turn the mattress or get better sleeping support systems, so one doesn't fall into any 'valleys. Their textured towels need softener. Breakfast was great, but sausage links had little flavor.

The beds and the food were 10/10.  the rooms cleanness was lacking, we had mouse droppings and previous travellers socks left in our room.  And we were out of hot water for half of our stay,   Being as were doing sports as our stay , hot water was not a luxury but a necessity.    The grounds, pool, hot tub were enjoyable.  Staff were good .

Recently stayed at 3 hotels in area. This hotel was the one I enjoyed the most. Quiet, clean with friendly and helpful staff. Stayed in a suite that was very comfortable. Eating breakfast in the court yard was a pleasant experience.

This hotel was very clean and updated. Very close to the location I needed to be at and not far from great shopping. The employees were very helpful and professional. The breakfast selection nice and the food was fresh and good. Love the Keurig coffee maker in my room

Summary Heading: Easy drive to visit Mickey Mouse!
Summary: This was our second stay at this Hotel. It's about 5 or 6 miles from Disneyland, but a very easy drive with little traffic. We enjoyed our stay and will definitely stay here again! A comfortable, sound sleep in a comfy bed, and a good breakfast helped us to enjoy the "Happiest  Place" on Earth all day long...

Summary Heading: Standard room too small, feels like a jail box.
Summary: The King standard is way too small. I felt like a jail box so I asked for an upgrade.  They didn't charge me for an upgrade which is nice.  The room appeared rundown, the carpet was dirty and so are the walls.  We had a great time in Best Western in Spokane, WA but NOT this one.

affordability with all the perks. This is my second stay here , this time with husband and prior with grandchildren. Our king room was very nice, bed comfortable and breakfast had something for everyone hot and cold items. Area was kept very clean , staff always with smile and helpful. I was amazed how well the breakfast area was kept stocked/tables cleaned during very busy mornings. Great for couples and family visiting area. Easy to freeways for commutes. parking easy and internet with room. I have also always felt safe at this location.

Summary Heading: One Night Stay Before Head Home
Summary: We were on vacation in Palm Springs and stayed at the Best Western our last night before flying out the next day.  The hotel was very well priced, the pool, hot tub, and court yard were very nice.  The breakfast was very good.  No major complaints, would stay here again if in the area.  Clean, secure, and quite.  Good value for your money.

This is close to Disney and there were several families with children. We would see them at the included breakfast. Wide choice of breakfast from cereal and yogurts, pastries and rolls, sausages and eggs (scrambled or mini-omelets alternate days). Special recognition to the friendly breakfast staff, especially a gentleman named Nagy. Desk staff also very nice. Place was very clean and appears to have been completely updated very recently. Although our room was small, it was very clean and the bed was very comfortable. Price was very good. The WiFi could use a little more band width and was slow at times of high usage. If in the area, we would certainly stay there again

Everyone was friendly, rooms were very clean and roomy.  Only nix would be the bathroom paint had been visibly touched up and not finished in the area above and around the toilet/shower. I stayed in a suite with two girl friends for the local Huntington Beach Surf City 1/2 Marathon.  Rooms near the event 15 miles away were unavailable and/or insanely priced.  This hotel was within a perfect driving distance to a shuttle drop/pick-up.  We leave about 1.5 hours from this area and it saved on an extra early wake-up call.  I will more than likely book this hotel again for future events within the area.

This is my second time staying at the Best Western Meridian. The rooms are nice! The beds are very firm and comfortable. Cleans bathroom. But the service is horrible!!! If that matters to you, don't stay here.The front desk person who checked us was very rude and had an attitude like we were inconveniencing him. He got the name wrong twice and had me sign multiple papers. When I asked if I get a copy he said "of what?" I replied "of what I just signed?" He said "no, this is just for incidentals, you don't get a copy." Then I go up to my room and the phone rings, it's the same front desk man asking me to come back down and sign more papers!" He was very unprofessional and should not deal with the public. The next morning the manager was yelling at a staff person at the front

We were planning to stay here for our anniversary. We were nervous about it because we've had bad experiences with the best Western in the past. However we got a gift card from redeeming credit card points so we figured it would be worth trying out. I did a bunch of research and find a time to make sure my gift card would work and when I went to reserve they told me that they would not take my gift card for the lower rate. I repeat they said they would not take my gift card for any of their lower posted rates I can only use my gift card if I paid the full price. That seems ridiculous to me so I asked to speak to the manager she said the same thing. not only did she say the same thing but when I was trying to understand and make sense of this she was curt and rude. When I told

Rooms are clean but a little older.  Suite had cupboards and drawers that did not open that seemed to be a waste of space as the bathroom was small.  Staff was great!  Friendly, helpful and knowledgeable.  Would stay at this hotel again just for the wonderful staff.

Summary Heading: Very nice place.  Internet was terrible.
Summary: I've stayed at other Best Western Plus hotels, but the rooms at this one were quite a bit nicer.  Our Queen Suite had two rooms, ample space, and comfortable furnishings.  Our only negative experience was the complimentary wi-fi internet.  Many times web pages would fail to load or take over 5 minutes to do so.  Made it somewhat difficult to accomplish business tasks. But otherwise, a very positive experience.

Summary Heading: great stay, great rooms excellent product
Summary: came to cali on business found the best western on line turned out to be a great place to stay. good product for the money. good price for the suite that I was provided with. great location, shopping center very close by with great place to have such or dinner, movies, etc. clean rooms excellent staff. everything close by. great stay. ample parking. the only issue was one of the elevator was broken so we had to take the long way in because of the location of our room.

Summary Heading: Finally Found My Go To Hotel for Disney!
Summary: So after several races and running into several crappy hotels (too noisy, to small, not clean) I FINALLY found a QUIET, CLEAN, SPACIOUS hotel in Anaheim. It located next to the OC Outlet mall so there is lots to see and do outside of Disney (eat, watch movies, shop). My husband very much enjoyed the pool area which was heated! The quietness of the hotel was the most important part for me as I do the Disney races and I desperately need to sleep. Absolutely ANYTHING wakes me up. At this hotel I did notice when people walked around outside of our room but it was minimal as most folks just wanted to get to their rooms after being at the park all day. I did bring my white noise machine (yes, I've had to resort to it to make sure I sleep) to help but I was a nervous wreck that night

Summary Heading: Served its purpose.  Good budget option.
Summary: We just completed a 4 night stay here for our Disneyland vacation.  We typically stay closer, but the holiday weekend and marathon meant hotel rates were very expensive.  This place was almost $375 cheaper than the original Marriott Residence Inn we had booked.  For that price we couldn't pass it up.  I am extremely loyal to Marriott and even though this property is a step below most lower end chain hotels (Fairfield Inn, Hampton Inn, Holiday Inn Express) it is a good experience for a budget choice.  Access to rooms are external hallways. Rooms are nice and big.  King bed was very comfortable and new.  Living room has nice pull out sofa for the kids.  Small fridge and microwave in mini-kitchen area, but no utensils. Not a single fork or plate.  Every cabinet and drawer empty.

Mved to Southern California 5 months ago, decided to drive up to take my son to Disneyland.  There were so many different hotels, reviews full of endless, dire warnings.  Travelling alone, I typically book at the Residence Inn/Marriott. But, I just didn't want to go "sterile." I wanted to book somewhere that would entertain, while at the hotel, in the event that it would rain.  After MUCH debate, I selected Best Western Plus Meridian Inn,  Orange-Anaheim.  Positives  The grounds are kept very clean  My room (338) overlooked the pretty courtyard, which boasted an adequate sizes pool/hot tub, a fountain feature, and outdoor eating eating area.  Our king suite was roomy, the furniture & fixtures standard for the price point of the hotel. No complaints.    Negatives  Planning for

Summary Heading: Best Western Plus Meriidan Inn & Suites
Summary: I stayed at Best Western Plus Meridian Inn and Suites the last week in December from Dec. 27 to Jan. 4 for vacationing at Disneyland.  What a gem of a hotel. I enjoyed my stayed at this hotel. The beds were very comfortable, the room was clean and it was spacious enough for two adults, a three kids ages 4, 11 and 15 years. It was only one exit away from Disneyland park and very close to the freeway, but far enough that it wasn’t noisy.   Staff was very helpful and attentive.The area seemed very secure; we didn’t have any trouble in the parking lot nor in the vicinity. It’s very close to The Outlets at Orange and many restaurants such as TGIF, Buffalo Wild Wings, Dave and Busters, and El Torito.  I would definitely stay at this hotel again.

A very nice hotel, reasonably priced, centrally located in Orange County. A excellent value. Full breakfast provided with eggs, sausage, etc. The outlets shopping center is very close by. Easy access to and from the 22, 57, 55 and I-5 freeways. I recommend this hotel.

I booked a 2 room suite and it was more than enough room for me and my family.  Carpet does have a large stain on it when you walk in the front door and the living room area's furniture looks a bit outdated (may just be the color) but it was clean and the bedroom area is great and having 2 TVs was really nice (especially with kids in the room).   There's a nice variety of food for the complimentary breakfast and it's consistently being restocked.  The Wi-Fi is always fast no matter what time I logged on. Great freebies!  For the most part, the staff was very welcoming and great.  They answered all my questions and the check in/check out presses are quick and easy.  A complete 180 from the customer service (if you can call it that) I received when I stayed at the Best Western

I had a great time at the hotel. Everyone was very nice and the breakfast was delicious. The room was also exceptional. I could not ask for more. We arrived from Disneyland and this hotel was very close from it. The next morning we checked out and visited the outlets that are just down the street. I will definitely stay here next time I am in the area.

Its a nice hotel with one problem when some one takes a shower in the room next to you its really loud. It feels like if someone is taking shower in your room ! Beside that its a great place I stayed in a suite room was very big and breakfast was great.

Summary Heading: I have and would stay again
Summary: I have stayed here for a couple years in a row now. This trip was good except for two things. First the breakfast was sub standard even for a free continental breakfast, the quality was pretty bad and there was no healthy options. Second we asked for a late check out which was given but our keys expired, so i was locked out of the hotel. Rooms are nice beds are very comfortable. I will stay here again.

The room that was provided for us smelled like urine. I asked for a new room but hotel lobby seems to have ignored my requests for a new room or to at least clean the room.  Fourth time staying here but after this experience will not recommend this at all to anyone.

Booked this hotel for our disneyland trip , i did a lot of research and looked up the reviews . Read some bad reviews after i booked so i was a little hesitate for when we would arrive . But i must say i was very satisfied with this hotel ! There was a little complications at check in but after that was smooth sailing . Booked the 2 queen bed suites and it was amazing very convienent for my and my daughter . I believe its a good location for other things around , i was able to easily find stores and places for food and the ART bus was good transportation to getting to disneyland ! My only problem i suggest they should fix and i saw in other reviews is the wifi . It worked at first then just kept cutting out . It got to be so much of a pain i just didnt use the internet at all

Stayed at this Best Western for a 4 day Disneyland trip- very satisfied overall...and slept like a baby! The beds were extremely comfortable! Great location - next to many restaurants and close to the I-5 for easy access to the theme park.

Summary Heading: Great location but a little tired
Summary: Hotel has a great location for all your southern California needs.  Rooms are spacious and work well for a family of 4.  the pull out sofa in the living area works great for the kids as it has it's own TV.  We have stayed here many times and will continue to do so.  It's getting a little tired but I understand it has new owners and they are planning to do some updates.  I hope not too many as the price & location are a great secret!

Summary Heading: Great sized room and great breakfast
Summary: We stayed at this hotel for our Disneyland trip. We had a two queen suite and the rooms were spacious and comfortable. The breakfast was also great and our kids enjoyed it. The bed was of good quality too.

Summary Heading: great value for family near Disney
Summary: We had 2 suites for 5 nights.  We were minutes from Disney, walking distance to shopping, close to the Honda Center.  Rooms were clean, comfortable and very spacious.  It was nice to have a microwave and mini-fridge in each room.  Temperature control worked well.  Pool area was nicely landscaped and the pool was heated.  Would have liked more fruit and healthier breakfast items.  Overall, a great stay for our family of 6.

This Best Western was close to Disneyland and was a great price for the stay.  The breakfast was excellent and offered a great variety.  Rooms were very clean and offered a great rest after a fun filled day at Disneyland.   I am a season's pass holder at Disneyland and Best Western is always my first choice and this hotel fit the bill perfectly.

We had a great suite, everyone working was really nice and caring.  Very accommodating.  Close enough to Disneyland and other shops.  The price was reasonable considering we we went during peek Christmas times.  Will definitely come back!!...

Rooms are clean, pool and hot tub are awesome, close to Disneyland and Knotts Berry Farm, good breakfast, friendly staff--great place! We booked 6 months in advance and price was excellent. We were with family couple and asked for rooms to be close together and we were accommodated.

Summary Heading: Nothing extraordinarily bad or good, except our luck...
Summary: This hotel is a pretty good value, big two-room rooms (a must for our big family)... free breakfast, nice pool, work-out room, good location.  There were a few maintenance issues (see below), but overall clean and very acceptable rooms.  The breakfast was filling, but not gourmet or very diverse.  We had a couple of related to noises.  The pipes made this knocking sound that was driving us nuts, so we changed rooms and then there was some kind of low-frequency hum in the new room.  They tried to give us a non-smoking room that was pretty obviously recently a smoking room for somebody.  The new room also had a very tricky key card swiper that malfunctioned about 90% of the time and delayed our entry to the room almost every time, sometimes forcing us to get help from the front

Nice room, friendly staff, okay breakfast buffet BUT the shuttle to Disneyland was the problem. We chose this hotel because of the shuttle. Unfortunately the staff was uninformed of the schedule causing us to miss the "World of Color" show. We drove 500 miles and paid over $200 for Disneyland tickets. We wanted to get every minute for our money and missed a wonderful part of the experience.

The suite was large, clean and quiet. The pool and outdoor area was beautiful. It was close to the 22 freeway and the outlets at Orange. It was about a five minute drive to disneyland or a short shuttle ride. I have stayed in many hotels near Disneyland and this one was nice. A car would be best at this location.
