The only things that were not great was that the hall trash can was overflowing and not emptied for 2 days in one of the outdoor upstairs area.Additionally this was a large hotel with 2 elevators which were a little far from the room for my disabled mother

The rooms where clean and well stocked. Great complementary breakfast. And  a decent rate. Next door to a outlet mall. They have shuttle service  to Disneyland. WiFi seemed very slow on the first day but okay after.

Great room, great service, good prices. Would definitely stay again. The hotel is just minutes away from Disneyland, and right down the road from an outlet mall. It's quiet and comfortable. And they offer a great breakfast to start off your day. The staff is helpful and friendly. Great place to stay at a great price.

I booked a suite while I could get one on the low and it did not fail to impress. The room was spacious and the 2 tvs helped out alot. Had a comfy bed and they gave plenty of pillows. There's real glasses and coffee mugs in the room so none of that plastic stuff.  My only complaint about the room would be the bathroom it's very small considering you get a suite. Also for a well built hotel it's a surprise that you can hear other guests in the shower or thumping of foot steps above you..this is the reason I gave a 4 instead of 5 because it is a little bothersome especially if you're trying to sleep in. The pool is heated so it's comfortable to get into and the hot tub was nice. There's a nifty little courtyard with tables and chairs to hang out in if you don't want to be in your

Summary Heading: Excellent overall. AC in room was loud at night.
Summary: Clean room. Very comfortable bed! Beautiful outdoor patio area. Great breakfast with hot and cold items. Friendly and helpful staff. The only reason I did not give it 5 stars was the ac in our room was very loud at night. It woke me up a couple times. Maybe it was just my room. But given that, I'd still stay there again. Everything else was a great deal for the price. Very clean and comfy!

This was our 2nd stay at this hotel in the past few months and it was just as good the second time. The accommodations are clean, nice, and quiet, and the cost was reasonable. The location is a little remote but there is a great mall with lots of nice places to shop and eat just on the other side of the freeway.

While I can appreciate that the price is right for families looking for a cost effective place from which to explore Disneyland, as a business traveler, I would not stay here again.  Room was small, bathroom really small, bad scent in the room for the whole stay and the walls are pretty much paper thin.  The grounds look terrible--neglected and pathetic.  The room for the free breakfast was way too small to accommodate the number of hotel guests--the place was a madhouse both on the weekend but also on a Monday...sub par food, flimsy plastic cutlery and a poor staff that was struggling to keep up with the dirty dishes.  The "fitness room" was tiny and had several pieces of work out equipment piled in practically on top of each other.  The shining thing about this hotel was the

Summary Heading: Great Value at Best WEstern PLUS Meridian Inn
Summary: Excellent value.  I would stay at this hotel again.  The staff was friendly and they upgraded us to a suite at no extra cost  I think due to my husbands retired military status and availability of suites.  The rooms were very quiet and the beds were comfortable.  The inn has undergone some upgrades and I only saw some signs of age in the tile surround in bathroom otherwise this stay was very good especially given excellent rates.

My daughter attends Chapman and this hotel location is perfect.Great value for a Suite and far away from the Disney crowd. The breakfast served in the morning compares and far exceeds any in this area.Great access to all major freeways in the Orange and Los Angeles map.

Summary Heading: Perfect Hotel I will be back
Summary: I have stayed at this hotel numerous times and it has never disappointed.  A great hot breakfast with many items.  The courtyard area where the pool and hot tub are located are surrounded with a palm trees a fountain and many tables, It is a great area to hang out and relax after a long day.  Minutes from Disneyland and the Anaheim Resort Transport bus comes right to the front door.  The rooms are all suites and the beds are very comfortable.  This hotel is an extra 10 minutes from Disneyland but well worth the stay and I will definitely be back next time I am in the area.

We booked a 5 night stay. We brought food and beverage with us. We specifically got a suite so that we would have a mini kitchen. We found several cupboards and drawers nailed shut. The refrigerator didn't work. The only ice machine on the property was as far away as it could be from our room. The safe didn't work at all. We reported both via telephone and were told that staff would come in and repair them the next morning. I went to the gym, and the treadmill didn't work properly. When i reported it, (and the fridge and safe again, as well) the man at the desk implied that i was doing something wrong because another guest had just used it and it was fine. He made me go with him to the gym and prove it to him. We returned to the room after a day in the park and found that

Summary Heading: Best Western PLUS Meridian Inn & Suites, Anaheim-Orange, Orange, CALIFORNIA
Summary: We just stayed here for two nights (Oct 2014).  We came for a visit to the "Theme Parks" (Disneyland and California Adventure) with our kids and 3 young grandkids.    This BW is a great choice for anyone visiting the area's attractions.  Theme Parks are only 3 miles away.  The rooms are "suites" which means the bedroom can be closed off.  Ours had a kitchen and we didn't even request it.   A big plus is free parking which is not true at some other area motels and hotels.  The rooms were spacious and very clean.  The bed was really comfortable with both firm and soft pillows.  The room rate was the best of any offered by comparable motels in the area.  We've always been satisfied with Best Western and recommend this property.

WiFi didn't work, breakfast was disgusting & shuttle service is not reliable. The worst was yet to come when I noticed an extra $250 charge on my credit card. When I called about this, I was told it was a smoking charge due to a report from housekeeping. I don't smoke!!  Being an ex-smoker for almost 10 years I'm very sensitive to the smell & there wasn't even a scent of it when I checked in as some non-smoking rooms have.  But now I'm at their mercy while they say they are going to check into it.  Check into what??  I've made 3 calls to speak to the manager & have been told each time she is not available to speak to me.  My only recourse now is to contact my credit card company to report a dispute or Best Western headquarters to try & get this resolved. I should have known

We were going to visit Chapman University the following day and last minute booked this room. It was a good deal at $138 for 2 queen beds. I forgot it was a suite and was surprised at how roomy it was. The interior of the hotel was very nice. We had a room facing the pool which seemed nice in the afternoon but very noisy in the morning when all the families had breakfast before going off to Disneyland. The breakfast was horrible so all I had was coffee. Why couldn't they have more fresh fruit, Yoplait yogurt, hard boiled eggs or something? Bad pastries, dry cereal and powdered eggs. Yuck! Enjoyed going down the road to the Outlets, movie theatre and dining.

Inexpensive place to stay and convenient to visit Disneyland, breakfast was good. Recommend the suite verses the room.  Internet access was good.  Bed comfortable. Bathroom could be bigger and might be difficult for a family.

Enjoyed the relaxing comfort of the place, well situated close to so many different attractions and shopping. Staff provided excellent service and able to provide helpful hints to things to do and see.

Summary Heading: Very good accomodations for price and location!
Summary: I recently stayed 10 days at a 2 queen beds suite with full kitchen. It really had the feeling of being an apartment. We were located in the back and had a door to the parking lot almost immediate to our room door. Our car was parked by the door. I am giving it 4 circles because (1) the tub leaked, (2) the TV in the living room had 2 channels with no volume (the 2 specific channels we wanted to watch), my sister reported it and was told we would get a replacement but the replacement never came (3) and foremost because the accommodations for the "smokers" were terrible. All the rooms are non-smoking and they advertise as a non-smoking hotel, BUT the smoking area/black poles/buts disposal containers are in the courtyard. One of the containers was in a corner of the courtyard right

Summary Heading: Good Hotel off the beaten path to Disneyland
Summary: I decided to stay here for a few reasons. 1.) Cost, 2) Free, real Breakfast. 3) No parking fees. It was not right by the resort( its 2.5 miles away)- so the cost was less. The hotel looks like a brick office building. So, don't expect anything fancy. The lobby was nice. the staff were friendly and helpful. I gt a King Bed suite and with my aaa Discount on a Tues night, it came to less than $100 for 2 people. The room had a kitchen, couches, table. The couches and bed were really comfy. I wish there has been more towels. The breakfast consisted of 2 types of eggs, sausage,breads, juice, cereal,oatmeal, waffles(make on your own), and coffee. There is no free shuttle service to  Disneyland. But, a shuttle pick-s up there. It is $5, buy your tix at the hotel desk first. The reason I

booked last min for a last min trip.  It was clean and had all that we needed.  The only thing is the sofa bed was very worn out and needs to be replaced!!  But they did do what they could to make it more comfortable for the rest of our stay.

Two adults, two kids... King sized bed and sleeper sofa.  The sofa was not as comfortable as the front desk agent promised.  The wifi never worked.  The continental breakfast was good.  We never swam in the pool. Close access to freeway, though you could never hear it.

Summary Heading: Rooms nicely updated but wifi down
Summary: We booked this king suite for work and pleasure . Close to Angels stadium . rooms just redecorated and new modern furniture . The down side in room WiFi not working. manger didn't call back when we complained . Front desk states this happens a lot and they can't do anything. Basically lost a day of work due to not being able to access Wifi. Lots of unhappy people in same boat .

My stay was average.  Hotel is in an excellent area.  Staff is very business like. Felt treated more like a number than a person.  No one smiled or greeted me upon check in.  Rooms are nice size.  Wish there was more consistency at this hotel .  Stayed here on many occasions because of area.  Just wish the staff was nicer.

Summary Heading: Ripoff (Resort Fee only charged to Hotwire Customers?!?!)
Summary: What a complete Ripoff (Resort Fee only charged to Hotwire Customers?!?!)  First of all, I was lied to by the very rude Manager at 730am when I tried to check in. I was informed by the night crew when I called last night that they had rooms available for Thursday night, so there should be plenty of rooms in the morning to check in (nobody staying in room, therefore, no room to clean-- it's READY!)  Told to come back at 11am.   CAme back at 10am, and again at 11am--- and still-- Nothing.  Called at 1230pm, and still-- nothing available.  He also mentioned I would have to pay more $$ to do an early check in (even though my reservation is for Friday and Saturday and it WAS Friday morning...  After I got on the phone to try and call Hotwire (the front desk afternoon manager (?)

Easy freeway access. Opposite side of freeway from commercial businesses, so it is quiet at night. However, you must drive to a store or fast food. Rooms are being updated little by little. We stayed here several times and have noticed the changes.  Don't know why, but the desk clerks are all like zombies. The rooms are spacious and comfy.

I like the location and it's quiet. Finding a parking spot can be troublesome when coming home late.  Biggest complaint was the WiFi wasn't working and had to settle walking to the lobby room internet.  Lucky enough my room on the 2nd floor wasn't far from the lobby, but still if I was on the opposite end at the 3rd floor; that would be annoying.  A lot of people use internet and having downtime up to an hour can be manageable, but not having it ever during my stay is a real inconvenience.  Overall I would stay here again simply for price, location, & quality of room, but advertising in-room internet and not having it work ever; please get it working next time.

This Best Western has been one of my top 5 locations to pick while on vacation to Disneyland.  2 exits away and right next to a shopping mall makes things so easy to obtain.  The property is well maintain and the staff are so nice.  My family and I always enjoy the heated pool.  They gym too is very accommodating since it opens at 5am.  Others have been 7am.  Rooms are nice and big and relaxing.

The hotel is a good value for the price paid. However the old, sticky carpet inside our "VIP Suite" probably accounted for the unrelenting ants. We enjoyed our stay though. Front Desk Manager Rania was wonderful, very patient, and accommodating. At check-out we had a different clerk who was very curt. Since we were enjoying our stay so much we didn't make a big deal during the stay about the ants however we just casually mentioned it at check out for their information, and the clerk was curt and condescending. She said there were ants al over - even in her home. Overall we enjoyed ourselves, and might stay there again.

The overall service of the hotel was very good with rates that were charged. The room as spacious, clean and very accommodating for traveling families, with and without kids. The food was not so great the best item was the waffle maker, coffee, milk and cereal and the fruit. the other hot food items were mediocre to not very appeasing. Other than that i will continue to stay, and hopefully a better menu appears !

there were ants in our room, no remotes for the TVs, breakfast was terrible, older hotel with old furniture - needs to be updated. Best Western usually has nicer rooms and better food, but this one was not good.

Summary Heading: 2 Queen Bed Suite with sofabed was great for 6A!
Summary: Everything was great except we were disappointed the pool/spa closed so early on the weekend 10:00pm.  We had looked forward to a little spa time after our event and before bed.  If it had been open till 11:00pm, on Fridays and Saturdays, that would have been perfect.

We recently enjoyed a last minute trip to Anaheim area to use Disney passes.  This hotel was a great value for a place with a kitchenette.  We didn't use it, but the hotel also offered what looked to be a very good free breakfast every day for guests.

Very efficient, quiet, easy access, easy parking, friendly staff, clean and wonderful breakfast. If you want a smaller hotel that has an apartment complex feel, this is the place.  We will definitely stay here again!

Summary Heading: Not bad for the price, you get what you pay for
Summary: Back for our fourth visit this year to Disneyland but our fave hotel was booked solid, We searched and searched, finally deciding to roll the dice on hotel@com.  The result was a booking at the Best Western Plus Meridian Inn and Suites in Orange.  It is close to I-5 and about 10 minutes to Disneyland park.  Best is to take Chapman to Harbor and park at the Woody Parking Lot , a far better option than the Mickey and Friends lot (which gets packed). Back to the hotel.  The hotel was a "suite" on the first floor, with sink, fridge, and a sofa bed.  Room was clean but for the ants in the kitchen area.  They just kept coming and coming and coming.  Another downer were the bedbug bites.  The hotel does offer complimentary breakfast but, unless you are really set on saving a few bucks,

I just stayed at this Best Western for 8 nights from August 14-August 22, 2014.  I stayed in a regular King room (not the suite) for $59.99 /night after booking the advanced purchase rate at the end of April.  What a deal and magnificent experience!  I absolutely loved this hotel!    First, my room was very clean with a  lovely bed ( I slept like a log every night).  I was a single traveler this time so the room was plenty for me.  It would be good for a couple as well unless you want a big chair or sofa to sit on as this room does not provide that.  No kidding for the price I paid.  I had absolutely no complaints about this room.  The only thing was some of the floor tiles had some chips in them but I'm only mentioning this so I can provide a completely honest review.  The air

Summary Heading: One of the worst experiences I have ever had a at a hotel
Summary: This was the letter I sent to the hotel below.  They read the letter and only gave us 45 dollars off of our room.  If there was legal action I would love to take it.  Heres the letter----  -Since I was a child, my family has used Best Westerns throughout our many stays across the country, as my father was military and we traveled a great deal.   I am writing instead of speaking with you in person  due to the lack of time I have to commit  to such an endeavor on 8/14.  I have been planning this trip for months, and do not wish to spend any time in which I should be enjoying myself, instead discussing room matters with hotel employees.  My girlfriend and I, (whom the reservation was made under) entered into room 245 on 8/12 planning to stay until 8/16.  On the night of 8/12 we

The Good: Reasonable priced, large rooms, comfortable beds The bad:   - Room smelled -Pre-authorized charge card for entire stay 1 day prior to visit without any communication that they would do so  (not in reservation details, not on website, and even surprised Best Western Reservations/Customer service Line). - Breakfast - Powdered eggs, and only fruit were apples and bananas. - Room was in disrepair - broken door and broken ice machine in fridge, furniture was old and stained.  Burn marks on tables - even though it was a non smoking hotel. - Room was missing basic essentials - no dresser for clothes, no suitcase stand, kitchen didn't have dish rags, pot holders, dish rack, or knives.  No napkins or paper towels.  - Walls were unusually thin, could hear people coming and going

Always stay at Meridian Inn & Suites when in the OC area. The suites are a perfect size for my family and the staff is always friendly. Finding parking if you arrive late at night is sometimes difficult but overall this is a great place to stay.

The rooms are great, if you get a suite it is worth the extra 10 dollars for a big living area and a nice big bedroom, as well as a work table and counters with a sink area It was very quiet on the side away from the pool. The hotel is well maintained and was being updated while we stayed there with fresh paint in the elevator.

This was the first time booking a hotel on expedia and I'll admit I was nervous about maybe pictures lying. However this king suite was more than plenty space and was exactly what description stated. The room was clean, fresh and had a mini kitchen which served us very well for the 5 days we were there. Coming to the room after a long day at Disneyland to find it spotless was great. Breakfast was very filling including hot items and tasty waffles. The pool/hot tub was also open late and super clean. Front desk was very nice upon check in and also let us check out at noon as a courtesy. Also Avery close to restaurants and Disneyland. We will definitely be staying  here upon our next visit to California.

Summary Heading: Nice large rooms and good location
Summary: Nice large room and beds comfortable.  Did have a problem with leaking of tub above us during night and had to move out at 2am. got another room but no manager ever apologized for our inconvenience.  Breakfast ok, same thing every day and not much variety.

the hotel was very accomendating with us arriving late for check in. We rented the room was clean and very roomy. the room was very updated. there was a microwave and small refridge in the room.  Courtyard area was nice to eat breakfast outside. hot breakfast(waffles, eggs,sauage,etc).  only complaint there was no shower cap in the bathroom.

front staff is great and good hot breakfast, recommend the vip suite. girl at the front desk went out of her way to be helpful while me and my wife stayed here on our honeymoon. hotel was very clean. the only downside is that the pool is small and it's always full of people.

Short lead time booking for a baby shower with a quick side trip to Disney.    Great location for Disney, Knotts, and Anaheim stadium, with Outlet stores, restaurants and large movie theater a long walk or quick drive away.   Have stayed in the area before, but first time at this hotel, my alternate being booked. Arrived at 10:30am on a Saturday in early August and was told no rooms available, so they stored my luggage, guaranteed the room and off I went to Disneyland. Front desk personnel polite and friendly.   Took 11pm ART shuttle back from the park ($5 rnd trip, $3 one way) arriving back at hotel at 11:20pm. Checked into room (was given mini-suite) on 2nd fl. Had requested interior room, which has front door and windows overlooking courtyard, pool and spa. On the way to

I should have realized something was up when I checked in.  The lobby was sweltering on the 90 degree day I checked in.  Who doesn't have A/C in their lobby?  Fans were going behind the front desk for the staff to keep cool.    My first assigned room was in the middle of being repaired by the maintenance crew. This after the front desk person used a walkie talkie to communicate with housekeeping to find out if my room was ready.   The second room was on the street side of the hotel and upstairs. All seemed okay at first. The A/C is enabled by sticking your room key in a slot by the front door. So the room was really hot when I first walked in. Still it turned on like it should and was blowing air. Not thinking anymore about it I unpacked and left to catch an evening game at

We were able to book a King Suite through Kayak for a very good price. The room was spacious and comfortable. It was nice to have central air conditioning with a vent close to the bathroom...it stayed cool while getting ready in the morning. The courtyard area by the pool was very nice.

Hotel was nice proximatey to Disneyland resort. Sz of room is nice for family in the suites. Pool area was great for mid day park break before naps. Breakfast avg buffet food. Room had a leaking toilet, air felt like swamp cooler, food left in microwave from previous guest, garbage under sink incl. broken glass which could have been bad if kids found before us. Only received fresh towels on request. dishes left dirty in sink. Need better housekeeping and would rate 9 out of 10 vs a 5.

Close distance to Disneyland.  Comfortable stay with typical complimentary breakfast.  Rooms surround the pool/hot tub area (like an atrium).    In their efforts to be more energy aware, there is a special light switch that requires your room key to slide in (like a credit card slot) to turn on lights, operate heating/cooling.  I suppose another advantage to this is you will never misplace your room key.  It's in the wall!  However, the hotel could use better signage to the hotel lobby and a notation regarding pool towels.  We had to ask the front desk every time.... need a sign for guest to do this, otherwise we hadn't a clue.

We love this Hotel, large and clean rooms , Great breakfast and very Honest, Friendly staff. Fun pool in the middle of the hotel, Great for families visiting Disneyland or Knotts berry farms. Also fairly close to the ocean.

Summary Heading: If you break it, you repair it!!
Summary: We have a suite and on the second day we advised to the front desk, that the toilet it was no flushing properly.  When we came back (at night) the toilet was still the same.  When I went to the front desk the clerk told us that since Best Western Plus is a 3 star hotel we have to repair what we break !! So, he gave us a plunger!!!  Be aware of this!!!!

We arrived on Saturday afternoon. As we checked in, the man at the front desk asked for the credit card we used to pay. I told him we prepaid using PayPal, and he said he needed the card. I explained we booked online and that I don't have a PayPal credit card - we argued back and fourth until he finally realized we had booked through Hotels.com and that's how we used PayPal. He was rude until he realized his mistake. We checked into room #203, a suite, with a king and a pull out bed. The hotel room itself was clean and spacious and nicely decorated. Around 10:00 that evening, we heard loud, stomping noises coming from the room above us. It sounded like someone was jumping off the bed, over and over, or throwing something really heavy off the bed repeatedly. It also sounded like

Summary Heading: Great place to stay, close to Disneyland
Summary: This is an excellent hotel to stay at if you are visiting Disneyland.  Very close to the outlet mall, and reasonable priced restaurants.  Pool was in good condition, with the exception of the fluff of the trees being in the pool.  Breakfast was nice and hot, and yes in July, a ton of people waiting to have breakfast. We sat a table with other people and did not mind it at all.  We had a wonderful suite with 2 queen sized beds in a separate bedroom, with a large living area, with kitchen space. Considering that the hotel was fully booked, we had no problem finding a parking space after returning from Disneyland at midnight.  We would recommend this place, as we found it to be an excellent hotel.

We were pleasantly surprised at the top quality of the accommodations. Everything was clean, neat, and nice. Almost every other hotel in the area was booked and we had lost hope of finding anything decent or reasonable and this hotel was both and more.

Summary Heading: Good Value but needs some updating
Summary: Value good for the area. Bathrooms need updating. Friendly, helpful staff. Wireless Internet is pretty slow for these days. Comfortable beds. Breakfast ok but need more staff to keep areas clean. Can be noisy with lots of kids there for Disneyland. Great running/walking trail close by.

My son and I stayed for a water polo tournament (along with many other players).  Even with a hotel full of young boys, it was very quiet the moment the 11pm curfew went into effect.  Also had great internet service, and staff service even though hotel was full!  Not sure if due to polo teams, but breakfast was only disappointment. Not much to choose from.

We stayed in three Best Western Plus hotels during our vacation.  The first two were updated, well appointed, clean and appealing.  The Best Western Plus Meridian was old, dirty, smelled and had a very noisy air conditioner.  We would never stay there again.

Staff t the front desk was very unfriendly. Worst I ever experienced. Room had an odor . Our room did not get cleaned one night and we were told it was because we left something on the bed. So they never cleaned the bathroom and any other part of the room. Would not bring us up fresh towels, we had to go get them ourselves. Checking in took a half hour because they did not tell us we had to bring the credit card that we made the reservation with. Never thought to because it was charged 2 months prior. She got very upset because I would not try and get a copy of it from home. This was at 10 P.M. No apology for having any problems and not helpful at all. I would never stay there again.

Overall good hotel for the price, hence my 3 star rating, but you get what you pay for. It was loud, even after midnight with kids and teens hanging in the courtyard. Older hotel, but well kept up however thin walls and you can hear the facets turning on and off in the adjacent rooms. Room was clean and maid service was adequate. The hotel was only 5 minutes from Disneyland and close to shopping and theaters. Happy with the location. We asked the maid for towels 3 of the 4 days we stayed and the answer was "I don't have any" never offered to get any either (weird). Only received 3 towels for 4 guests each night. The breakfast in the morning was enough to get the job done, but nothing special... Think continental breakfast with steamed eggs and and sausage. We showed up at 2:50pm

Summary Heading: Good Customer Service - read the room description before booking
Summary: Updated: July 20  A huge shoutout to Morgan at the front desk.  She was able to move our party to a king suite room today. The difference in price  was minimal. What a huge difference in having a suite. I am changing my review from poor to very good.  I have suggested that the front desk let potential guests know that the standard rooms are extremely small and do not come with a microwave. The pool is great. The water is warm and extremely comfortable. Large patio area with plenty of tables and chairs.  There is a microwave in the laundry room which is handy if you need to heat something up poolside. This hotel is heavily booked. If you are traveling to Disneyland area with a large group I would recommend this property. They do have units that do have cooktop stoves.   Again,

The hotel room style works well for families and is located close to popular Orange County Destinations. The breakfast is not well supplied for the amount of people they service. They ran out of coffee and bananas. Our kids ate waffles the first day but my Husband and I skipped it and we all skipped it the next day. The breakfast being poor caliber made the vaue of the hotel rate go down, but it did seem to work for most of the families as it was busy!

I have always passed this hotel because it looks just like an office building .. but once inside it was great   room was  clean and comfortable . No nasty smoke smell  very well maintained . Close to food / drinks and nightlife  King size bed was plush and I had the best night sleep. I know i will be back to this hotel breakfast bar looked good but i was on the run and could not try the food. Overall a great place to relax and unwind

My two teenage kids and myself stayed 5 nights at the Best Western.  The suite room size was good.  The bathroom was small.  The location was great, it was right down the street from the Orange Outlets, where they have lots of restaurants and shopping.  This hotel is not far from Disneyland and provides a shuttle to the park.   The hotel is located near all the freeways which makes getting to the beach and easy drive.  The parking is free.  They offer free breakfast daily.  The staff is helpful and friendly.  I would stay again.

There is a shuttle to Disneyland for a nominal fee which is much less than a taxi and saves the time for parking and the long walk to the parks.  The rooms are nice, the bed is comfortable and the staff are wonderful.  The buffet breakfast is the average fare you find at other hotels and there are tables out on the patio, which is very nice.

This hotel is clean, the staff professional and the rooms are suites. We've stayed in other Best Westerns and some have been pretty shabby. The Meridian is one we always return to. The staff is especially wonderful.

disappointed the pool was closed since we were traveling with 4 children.  Asked daily if the pool was open and opened on third day of our trip.  The breaskfast was very good, beds were comfortable, staff friendly

Having all the rooms being suites, even for two people, it was nice having 2 rooms.  You didn't feel so cramped as you do in many hotels - it was much homier.  All kitchen needs were convenient and handy.   Location was in central Orange and handy to all freeways but still quiet - no traffic noise but some noise from the next room.  Lots of restaurants nearby. All in all a good, very comfy relaxing place to stay.

Good place to stay and affordable rates.  Location was great.  The staff was friendly for the most part.  Amenities at the hotel were excellent.  Other attractions were close in proximity to the hotel.  Centrally located.

Decent place to stay.  Approx 10 min from Disney Parks.  Could use some utensils for guests not wanting to eat out all the time.  Rooms should all have the same kind of refrigerator/freezer.  Sister had one with a freezer, ours didn't, so our bottles of water got warmer much faster than did theirs, and our frozen food, well, couldn't be kept frozen.  Would be nice to change out breakfast meat daily.  A lamp fixture was loose and we thought it would fall off during our stay. Floors and walls are thin.  Noise comes through easily.  Lucky days at Disney tire the whole family, so eventually we all fell asleep regardless of the noise.

Great location, hotel and staff.  Met all of all needs and more. Close to freeway access, close to restaurants, malls, and other shopping.  Quiet area.   Relaxing atmosphere.  Well maintained.  Caring and skilled staff.  Will definitely stay again.

Summary Heading: Great place to stay in O.C.
Summary: Had a great stay, very comfortable beds, lots of room and very clean. Breakfast is just ok, service in the dining area was great. Spilled hot sauce on my shirt, went to front desk to see if they had something to help clean it and the young lady went out to her car and gave me her own Tide to-go and told me to use it and not to worry about it, superb service!

The Best Western Meridian staff are very professional and courteous.  They also have people skills, which is hard to find these days.  The breakfast was attended to at all times to ensure there was enough food and drink at all times. The breakfast attendant was busy, but continued to smile and assist people in any way that she could.

Came to town for an Angels game with family and friends. Got there early enough for little spa for my aching back....nice hot water in jacuzzi, and well kept pool area interior of hotel. Great game, nice two room suite, comfortable bed.

Stayed in a two-room suite. Overall, the property was in excellent shape (although from the outside it looked a lot like an office building). Some minor maintenance issues in the room were noted which did not impact comfort or utility. Best "free" breakfast buffet I've had in any hotel I've stayed at. Rooms clean, beds comfortable.

My husband and I stayed at the BW Meridian Inn & Suites a couple of weeks ago for 2 nights (May 30 & 31,2014).  Between July 2012 and July 2013, we stayed at this hotel a few times whenever we used our Annual Passes at Disneyland.  This time, we were going to stay only 1 night there and stay another night closer to Burbank, because we were going to start our Saturday in Burbank and end our day at Disneyland, but my husband wanted to stay both nights at the BW Meridian, so I booked two nights there instead of separate bookings.  Best decision!  We were greeted by the same hotel employee that was always there during our numerous stays in 2012/2013.  It had been almost a year since our last stay, and he still remembered us and instantly had a smile on his face when he saw us.  He

We stayed at this hotel for 4 nights while we visited Disneyland.  The shuttles to and from Disneyland cost $5.00 per person for a unlimited back and forth to the hotel and bck to Disneyland or to where ever the shuttle route gos to, such as the Outlet Malls, etc.  The Hote breakfast was also GREAT!  Eggs, sausage, waffles, fruits, pastrys, toast, cereal, WOW!  The jacuzzi and pool was nice and clean, Oh, they also have ice machines and doda pop, water vending machines on each floor. The Front Desk staff was very helpful.  I want to commend the overnight Front Desk (George George)  He was very helpful with my reservation.

The rooms are nice, staff is pleasant, but the breakfast is sorely lacking. We stayed here about four years ago, and since that time the breakfast has gone downhill. Some of the staples of other hotel breakfasts were nowhere to be found here (yogurt, peanut butter, etc.) They use flimsy plastic silverware that makes eating a waffle nearly impossible, and the dining room was a mess. I understand serving and eating space can get messy with so many people flowing through, but in other other hotels this is solved by having a staff member cleaning as the morning progresses. Unfortunately, I think I'll be looking for another hotel next time we visit Disneyland.

Fantastic everything. My family and I have stayed in several Best Western locations but this was by far the best. The pool was heated, the food was awesome, and the service was beyond excellent.  I would very much recommend this location to anyone. Very close to Disney and surrounding entertainment.

Was a nicer hotel in years past.  Split personality between serving Disneyland guests and other business guests.  Pool & jacuzzi are the only redeeming features.  Heating/Cooling system very loud.  Front Desk needs better training.  Big Rigs parked in back.

We love to stay at the Best Western Meridian in Orange, Ca. Very friendly staff & excellent rooms for a reasonable price as well. I always stay here when we are in the area, especially with the continental breakfast

Summary Heading: Okay hotel but slightly run down
Summary: The place was slightly run down but it did look like they were in the middle of fixing it up.  Looks like the place is mostly suites with just a few regular rooms scattered throughout.  We got a regular room and the window was so tiny it felt like a cave.  The hot water was almost non existent.  I discovered if I took a really long shower it started to warm up though.  Odd.

Summary Heading: Nice place with many maintenance issues
Summary: The rooms are quite spacious, and we loved having a separate living room and kitchenette.  The American breakfast was a great convenience, too. However, we had many maintenance issues during our stay.  The first night, our refrigerator and air conditioner were not working.  We also had a plumbing back up in our tub and it was covered in dirt. For the second night, we were moved into a different room.  The room smelled like smoke, even though it was a non-smoking room.  The safety latch on the door fell off in my hand.  On top of that, the television in the living room didn't work, and had to be swapped out for a different one.  We also discovered that when we changed channels on the TV in the bedroom, it turned on the TV in the living room.  If they can fix all of these issues,

1.  I made 2 reservations under the same name.  When I made the reservation, I told the frontdesk that these guest would be foreigners and older so they need to note the name and and made sure they thave their rooms.  I also asked them to have the rooms next to each other so these older folks don't have to walk too far to see each other.  On the day of the check-in, before my family arrived, I even called the hotel to remind them. When my family, from other countries, checked in using the name I gave them, they were given 1 room.  All 5 of them, ages 60-80, had to share 1 room with one ended up on the couch.  When they got in touch with me 2 days later (being shy to ask for help and a little perplex about why I treated them so badly) and I talked to the frontdesk, the reason for

Very convenient for travel in and around LA. Close to Disneyland not too far from Knott's berry farm and close to the' beaches. Superb place to stay. Its not the perfect location but it very nearly is. Superb service wonderful staff nice clean rooms. Will definitely be back

We frequently travel to California to visit our daughter.  We always stay at the Best Western Meridian.  Not only is it close to where she lives but close to the freeway, shopping and visiting friends.  We love that it has the extra room where we can sit on a couch or chair and not on the bed to watch TV.  We have even taken our grandsons.  They sleep on the pull out couch and have their own TV to watch. A win win for us all.

This hotel is very comfortable, clean and affordable. I also like this hotel because it feels safe. A hotel key card has to be used to enter the building after a certain time. You can walk around or sit by the pool knowing that only patrons of the hotel are in athe area ( especially, during the late  evening hours).  The breakfast and breakfast area is good. The other thing I like is that the hall/walkways to your rooms are carpeted. The only draw back I can think of for the hotel overall is that there aren't any elevators midway - the elevator is near the office and you use that one and walk your stuff the rest of way down the halls. But like I said it helps that the halls have carpeting and you don't hear everyone is passing by your room.

Summary Heading: WAY TOO PRICY FOR THE VALUE. Unreasonable!
Summary: It's A nice secure facility. Kind of a 'citadel' Interior corrorors, yet there is an open air atrium with the pool area in the center. In the Disney zone area, about 4 miles away. It's a good location. However I lived 3 blocks away, on the other side of what is now a Huge outlet retail/restaurant zone for 21 years til  2008. It's not a Bad area, but don't be fooled: it's east Garden Grove, the sleaziest most 'yuck' city in Orange County. Next to Stanton. EW!  The rooms are basic, clean but for $140.00 during the week, a King Bed, no balcony. and basic in room coffee (glorified hot water) and a 'breakfast"  there are cheaper places with similar are more quality amenities nearby.

Summary Heading: Don't waste your time and money....
Summary: Booked this hotel based on the good reviews. Booked a king bed, walked in and the room smelled musty and old.. We asked to be moved to another room, we were told there are no other king beds available. We had to pay extra to move into another room with 2 queens. They told us they would check the room out, and moved us one room over. From room 217 to 216.  Got into that room, put the key card in to kick the AC on, after about 30 mins the "room smell" was better. We were to tired to argue with them so we just toughed it out for 2 nights. Hotel is old and just needs to be redone. Spend the extra $50 bucks a night and get into the Hyatt or Sheraton.. I really wanted to walk out and go somewhere else, but we were exhausted. While sleeping, we heard every single noise from toilets

This is a great hotel for the price.  Comfortable beds and suites have comfortable furniture.  Breakfast does leave a lot to be desired.  The only negative is the way you must leave a imprint of your credit or debit card with no amount on it.  This leaves you open for unwelcome charges.

Comfortable room albeit a bit dark; good A/C. Had trouble connecting to Internet until I used Internet Explorer. Good rates. Good location, right off freeway. Quiet. Friendly staff. Easy parking and entry/exit.

Summary Heading: Great place to see Disneyland at a realistic price!
Summary: The suites are great, plenty of room to relax.  The rooms  have a thermostat to regulate, far more comfortable that wall unit.  Its hard to find your room, there are only signs for the large suites.  The breakfast is so so, not enough room to sit or walk.   We would stay again, easy on and off the freeway!

This hotel has recently been renovated. The room/suite was fantastic. The breakfast was pretty good. The hotel was very clean and the staff helpful. It's location was also great. It's only 2.5 miles to Disneyland and right near freeways.

The staff at the front Desk were not helpful and impolite. Even though guests were waiting for check in or check out that they were still chatting. I don't even have the wifi password when check in at night time. That's not professional. I am not the 1st time to stay in Best Western Inn and this is the only one that the staff treat us like this. I think they were discriminated Chinese because I can see that they only showed their warm welcome to Western Foreigner. Really disappointed to their service. Also, I found some ants in the room.

Summary Heading: If not for the outdated exterior, I will give this a 5
Summary: I am extremely satisfied by the 1-King br layout as there is a divider between the bedroom and the kitchen, giving us privacy and making it feel more like home. The mini-kitchen and living room where the sofa bed is, is quite big, we enjoyed the extra space so much. The 10-minute drive to Disneyland is not a hassle at all. I appreciate that the location is quiet plus there's that bonus that is beside the Orange mall.

My business takes me from the Desert to Orange County two to three nights per week, all year. I have tried most BW properties in Orange County now, and figured to try this one, which is relatively close to my work location. First, the room is very dated and old-fashioned looking; however, everything worked. The lobby looks a bit antiquated and the hotel has some dark corridors from the elevator to the outer rooms.  My primary problem with this hotel is with the charge card policy. Upon checking in, I was asked to sign and initial a check-in form from a printer, and initial agreements not to party, smoke, pet, etc. After this, however, I was required to sign a blank-total, old fashioned charge slip imprinted with my credit card number (to me, this is analogous to leaving the

Very nice large suite rooms. Nice courtyard and warm pool. Excellent blackout drapes and generally very quiet. Bed a touch firm but perfectly comfortable. Great location for Disneyland. Only real issue is the wifi, which was extremely slow and sometimes didn't work at all.

Summary Heading: Decent but not quite sure I would stay again
Summary: I stayed here last week and I thought the room was decent.  The quality however was pretty lacking.  The toilet paper roll holder fell off and a screw popped off on the towel rack.  Those items were easily repairable.    The room was large and it was nice to have a sink, fridge, and microwave in the room.  The one thing that I was pretty unhappy about is that I had left a swimsuit and cover-up at the hotel.  I called to see if they have the items in the "lost and found" and was told they do not. Due to the short time frame I called back to the hotel inquiring my lost property and that they basically gave me the run around during my call, I would not recommend staying here.

Summary Heading: I don't know why anyone would stay here
Summary: Our family booked several rooms here for a nearby wedding. Upon entering I noticed that the place is very dated and asked to see the room in advance.  The lobby, elevator, hallways etc. look old and tired.  I'm mad at myself for not looking at the photos more carefully because I should've seen how bad it is.  The minute I saw the room I knew I could not stay there. The size was okay but it was just old, tacky, and musty. I had reserved two nights via the internet and after negotiating with the manager I lost my first night's fee but was refunded for the second night, which I was not happy about but can live with. The front desk staff  and manager were polite when listening to my complaints.  I was able to immediately book a different hotel, Courtyard by Marriott, only a few

Summary Heading: Decent hotel, but had some problems
Summary: I have typically had a positive experience with this hotel, but had some minor problems during my last stay with noise (particularly the loud sound of water running in the wall when someone in an adjoining room turned on the shower).  Breakfast was mediocre, but there were fresh bananas and apples, which I liked.  The staff are always friendly, and the suites are nicely laid out.

Summary Heading: Great service, location and luxurious rooms!
Summary: My only minor negative comment is that check in was a tad slow for this hotel. Everything else was fabulous! We stayed here for 2 nights as we decided to visit Knott's Berry Farm (instead of the overpriced Disney!!). After check in, we approached our rooms. They definitely exceeded our expectations especially for the price we paid! You get a fridge and microwave, a lounge area, a decent sized bathroom and a huge king sized bed. The pool was also clean and I used the hot tub which was warm and relaxing. Service we received at the reception besides the check in was quick and efficient, we were given towels for the pool and got our postcards posted aswell. Would stay again, definitely!!

Summary Heading: AWESOME location in OC (LARGE 2 room suites)
Summary: We were here for 10 days, on a Skate-cation (skateboarding parks in SoCal).  2 kids 2 adults. The hotel is down the street from Vans park, and an hour drive north to LA, or an hour south to San Diego.  In the heart of skate country. (or 10 minute drive to Disney, or 30 min to Lego Land)  We had a 2 queen suite: that's 2 full rooms!  A large spacious bedroom with ensuite washroom with separate sink area, closet for clothes.  The Living room was actually that, full sized couches, a second tv, coffee table.  Very well laid out.  There is also a large kitchen area with full sink, fridge, microwave, dining table, etc.  Lots of cupboard space for everything, and room left over.  And besides the beautiful courtyard with hot tub and salt water pool off to one end, is the amazing

10 months after our stay I get an email saying they forgot to charge my credit card.  How does that happen? My husband gave them his card and signed all the appropriate paperwork. We stayed for 3 days. You would think after 3 days they may have noticed they did not charge our card. Nope. So they demand a payment or they will send us to collections and we are no longer allowed to stay at there hotel again. I find it really funny they think this is our error. Yes I should have noticed that there was no charge on the card. That is my fault. Out of sight out of mind. Why wait 10 months to contact us?!!! They are not willing to eat any of the cost, even though this was clearly their error they admitted to. HORRIBLE BUSINESS PRACTICES!!!!!

Front desk staff are unfriendly and unreasonable...   any business that wants you to give them a photocopy of your credit card (both sides) and ID needs to have their head examined!  I consider the front desk clerk to be either racist, sexist, or both based on the way my wife was treated.  I would never recommend that anyone stay at this hotel, ever.

Room was nice, shuttle only took you to Disneyland once every hour so you had to make sure you were there on time. Breakfast was good but need a little variety, stayed there 5 nights and had basically the same thing. Room had lots of space. Good value for the price

We were pleasantly surprised at the great place.  The reviews definately helped make up our mind to try it.  Yes, it is in a business area and so it was quiet, easy access to freeways, shopping and dining.  Super location.  Our king suite was perfect.  We had plenty of room and the layout was perfect.  We did not need a full kitchen, but the wet bar came in so handy for morning coffee and snacks throughout the day.  We loved it and would definately stay here again.  The fact that they offered a hot breakfast and free parking sealed the deal. Wonderful place for the money.

Stayed here for our family trip to Disneyland. The rooms were large, comfortable and clean. The hotel was very convenient for our  daily trips to the nearby Disney parking area. Overall experience was excellent.

I called a number of times prior to our arrival ensuring our reservations were confirmed and we had the King Suite.  I talked with Christina both times and she was great to work with.  I requested a suite next to the pool on the bottom floor and we were able to get one.  They also allowed us to check in a little early (at around 1:30) which was nice after a six hour drive.  We stayed for six nights.  On the first night while taking a shower, the shower head fell off and hit the ceramic tile ledge in the tub.  It cracked the tile and the head was broke.  Maintenance showed up first thing in the morning and fixed everything.  It only took them about 10-15 minutes to fix the tile and replace the shower head.  They did a great job.  James assisted with the replacement of the

Summary Heading: Larger rooms, disappointing location and wifi issues
Summary: The room was nice and large for our family of four.  Breakfast was ok; there should have been a bit more selection.  Our TVs would only work if we unplugged them for 10 min each time we tried to use them.  Our wifi hasn't worked reliably since we arrived which is a huge problem for us.  We keep being told that there is someone working on the wifi but nothing is improving.  The side entrance hasn't worked since the first day either.  Definite problems here and the hotel isn't around anything!  We will not stay here again.

Summary Heading: Dont rent the king near the elevator
Summary: Was placed in room 337 which is the elevator entrance. Was kept all night by the noisy fridge. The room smelled. In the morning was awoke by loud people talking at the elevator, children running and playing. Forget sleeping in! In the past I have stayed at this hotel and ordered a King Suit which is on the back side of the building always nice and quiet. Felt like I paid alot of money to be punished on this visit. Thinking twice about going to another hotel on my next visit.

Summary Heading: A recommended Best Western hotel in California
Summary: A very nice hotel with nice and serviceminded employees The pool was warm and appreciated. The hotel is located close to Disneyland with a possibility for  bustransfer We enjoyed the stayand can recommend this hotel

Loved this place!  We stayed here on our family vacation to Disneyland.  We usually stay right across the street from Disneyland, but this hotel was literally half the price for more room (we had a king suite room) and the shuttle was easy to use.  We will be staying here again.  Loved the courtyard and pool area.   The free breakfast was great.  A+

Always a pleasant experience.  We've stayed here before and have enjoyed the location and the pleasantness of the staff.  The price is right for our budget, and it is a comfortable, safe and clean hotel.  We also enjoy the fact that it is located next to some good shopping.  It also enhanced our Disneyland vacation experience.

The grounds were nice, but our room was "musty", and the shower was dirty. It looks as though they tried to remodel but the work that was done was not done very well. The location is great! We have stayed at this hotel before and it is a decent hotel for the area and price point.

Summary Heading: Spacious and comfortable, great for families!!
Summary: We stayed here for a family Disney vacation and found the staff extremely friendly and helpful.  The rooms were ginormous (great if youngsters or tired parents wanted to take a nap while others watched tv in the adjoining living room) and even had a dining table area that seated five comfortably.  The breakfast had many options - eggs: scrambled, with cheese topping, pancake style; sausages, waffles, croissants, varieties of cereals...great variety! We loved the dispensers for shampoo, soap, lotion, etc. (very green, eliminates plastic containers). Located right beside the Outlets at Orange, easy to get to and from Disneyland.  An excellent choice for families and a great deal too! We look forward to staying here again!

Summary Heading: ok stay not what we expected
Summary: Great location not as clean very old inside. Ok to crash for one night not for a whole week. Location is perfect great bus service not enough restaurants to eat, hotel restaurant is very expensive food is average not that great.

Booked this hotel instead of host hotel and saved over 50%.  Rooms were enormous!!! Full of amenities down to the wall-mounted shower gel, shampoo and conditioner dispensers in the shower and liquid soap and lotion in the bathroom area!!!  Delicious hot breakfast with a variety of options for everyone.  Outdoor pool and spa were heated and stayed open late.  On-site laundry and vending machines.  Quiet, secure area and the grounds were beautiful.  Walking distance to shopping mall/movie theater. Couldn't ask for anything else.  Excellent staff, value, and beds were the most comfortable I've ever slept in including my own !!

This hotel room was a suite with two beds and completely livingroom and kitchen - very large.  It was very comfortable and close to the city of Orange where we were going.  Loved the extra roominess.  It had everything that we needed and it was so nice to be able to spread out and not feel cramped.  Close to freeway but not too close.  I would stay there again.

very good hotel will stay again the shuttle to Disneyland was rarely on time but it was a city transit but with only 3 stops before Disneyland on an hourly bases but was rarely on time but easy and cheap transportation to the park

Rooms are not clean, internet is off and on, most of the staff is excellent however much training is needed. The location is good just off the 22 freeway with shopping, food and theme parks near.  The area is geared for Disneyland type travel, not for business.  The free breakfast area is a zoo, the facilities are overrun with families so if you like that enviornment it's okay.  It does not meet my expectations for a BW Plus, lacking in cleanliness.

Quality of the room, location and staff was a great value for the dollar.  Room was a big suite, clean and very accommodating.  The location is very central and easy to find.  The staff was very helpful.  For business, the internet was fast, free and easy to log onto.  Only downside was the breakfast which was mediocre at best so far as quality and selection.

I stayed at this hotel for a business meeting (which was also in their meeting rooms) and was disappointed.  The rooms and hotel itself are in dire needs of updating.  The rooms are not well lit and are actually laid out poorly.  The same goes for the meeting rooms.  The meeting rooms were poorly lit, hard to hear over the HVAC/Vent system (which you can not turn off because it is on the same switch as the lights) and is very disruptive when there is a large group in the main pool area.  The breakfast is also lacking.

Very nice hotel! Close to restaurants.price is fair. Nice & clean room. The bed was really comfortable. Beautiful garden with swimmingpool & jacuzzi. Breakfast was pretty good. Staff was very friendly and helpful.

Very surprised about how NICE this hotel was. Its rated a 3 star, as nice as a 4 star, but it definitely has a 2 star price!!!! It is conveniently located within a couple miles of both the Honda Center and Angels Stadium. Because its a "suite" our room had a King sized bed in its own room, with another separate room with a kitchenette , and living area. Very, very nice! we will definitely stay there again.

We just spent several days at this hotel while attending the Longevity Now conference.  It was comfortable, quiet and not too far from the event.  Once we learned where the Mother's market was we were able to get our organic food..  Enjoyed a fridge in the room as we made our own green smoothies.

Had read some scary badvreviews but my experience was ok,. Suite was a little small, but clean. No real issues and price was fair. They don't deliver your bill to your room like many other hotels. I didn't have breakfast so cannot comment

2 spacious rooms. Beds are in same room, and living room is other room. Living had sofar bed. Had microwave and small fridge. Very quite area during the weekend. I read the review about tall pillows so we  brought our own pillows so we don't have any issue with sleeping.

We had a wonderful small suite that was very comfortable and nice.  There was a shuttle to take us to and from Disneyland so we didn't have to drive. Our suite had 2 rooms with 2 TVs, a refrig. and microwave and counter space.   The three of us were very comfortable.  The staff at the front desk were extremely nice.

We have stayed at this hotel several times over the past 3 years. We like its large rooms for the affordable price. It located within 10 mins of driving to Disney/Knotts and our favorite shopping malls. The hotel is in a business complex and Friday and Saturday mornings were very quiet. Sunday was another case, both the guest and the gardeners woke us up with their nose. The hotel is looking a bit beat up and some tlc is needed. But the rooms are large and always clean. While we were there this last trip the elevator near our room was out of service so you had to walk stairs with heavy bags or take the long walk from the front of the hotel to the back of the hotel. Otherwise, to be out of the Disney family area, and for a great price, this place is worth taking a look at.

We like to stay at Best Western hotels and this one was a delight.  Great breakfast, pool, hot tub and amenities like laundry room and gym made us feel like we were at home.  We highly recommend this location.

Summary Heading: Beware the forced unitemized credit card slip
Summary: I truly regret feeling the necessity of writing this review - but I don't know how else to encourage the Meridian Hotel to change a really bad policy.     Due to plane delays, my wife and I arrived around 1:00am to check in to the Meridian.  We had made reservations on Expedia, so it should have only taken me two minutes to sign in.  But after being presented with the typical sign-in sheets, the manager ran an imprint style credit card charge slip and asked me to sign - with no itemization on the slip.  This was a standard slip, issued by the credit card company, with verbiage under the signature line "acknowledging the receipt of the goods or services in the amount of the TOTAL" and promising to pay.  I objected to the manager.  Signing an unitemized slip like this puts you

Summary Heading: The Hotel Staff made our trip great
Summary: If you get a chance to stay at a Best Western near Disneyland, this would be my pick.  The hotel is nice but the staff is what made our stay great.  They greeted us when we arrived and made sure we were comfortable during the entire stay.

I have stayed at this Hotel a few times. Their beds are excellent. So comfortable. The staff here will go out of their way to help you with any of your needs. It is close to the The Block at Orange for all your food and shopping needs

The service is great, staff super nice and friendly. Close to the outlets mall (former The Block) and freeways. Couple blocks from Angels Arena and 5 minutes to Disneyland by car. Room is comfortable and spacious,  had a mini fridge. You need to put your key in the slot to operate the air conditioner and main light, when you take it off to leave the room, lights and air cond. turn off. Soap, shampoo, cream, body gel comes in a dispense machine. They also offered tresseme shampoo and conditioner in those mini bottle and tooth paste (very convinient). They have purified cold and hot water machine available by the breakfast room 24 h. No hot cup available just a very small cup for cold water, you can use the room's glasses and mug or refill your water bottle. Tea(black only) and

Staff was awsome, Room was good, very comfortable bed, and loved the breakfast. Definitely recommend this hotel if you are in the area. Not too far from Disneyland, and they sell the pass for shuttle to go around and about.

Summary Heading: Poor insulation, noisy AC, and you can hear when people shower or flush...
Summary: We booked three night here. We could not sleep last night because of the noisy AC system, and because of poor insulation we could hear every movement of people in the room on top of us.  When we complained to the manager, Rania, she said  she could not move us to another room unless we paid for an additional room at $159/per night, that she said we could not afford. How does she know what anyone can afford?  This is the 4th time we came to this hotel. We got a  bad room this time.  However, the manager did not want to help us and listen to her customer - today 01/16/2014 . We will not come back here anymore.  We don't believe other hotels treat people like that.   We also believe this Best Western Meridian Inn should not be graded Best Western Plus because this Best Western

Late check-in went without a hitch. Room was large, clean, with excellent water pressure in shower and best of all bed was excellent. The amenities equalled the Marriott Anaheim, but the price was substantially less. Definitely will be staying here again when I come back in for business.

Summary Heading: This hotel has got it right!
Summary: My daughter, her husband and 2 year old daughter, as well as my husband and I all stayed here during the new year in one of their King Suite bedrooms.  We took the shuttle to Disney every day that we were there and found that to be quick and efficient.  (There is a charge for the shuttle, so be aware of that.)  We took advantage of the daily breakfast offered by the hotel, and it was very thoughtfully presented and covered a large range of food options, including a hot crock-pot of oatmeal each morning and greek yogurt!   If your room is on the 2nd or 3rd floor, a glass elevator takes you there as you enjoy the view...a beautifully-landscaped pool/hot-tub/leisure area in the center of the property.  Efficiency, cleanness and a friendly stay...what else could you ask for?

We stayed for over a week at this hotel during Christmas, 2013.  First, the decent points... 1. The pool area is kept fairly clean. They do make an attempt to vacuum the pool daily and the hot tub is kept fairly foam free, with the exception of a couple of days for the hot tub. But with the traffic that was in it, it was understandable. The pool is heated to a comfortable temperature.  2. We rented 3 suites. The full kitchen had a fridge that actually worked. Impressive. (Yes...I'm grasping for positives....work with me.)  3. There is a water machine near the lobby that dispenses water that tastes good.  4. There are laundry machines on site. (Albeit very pricey - $4 a load, and only one of each machine for the entire hotel.) The upside is the machines are next to the pool, if

We really enjoyed our stay at the Best Western Merridian.  It is a great hotel and a great location for us.  The staff were very professional and helpful.  We'll definitely stay there again when traveling to Orange

Summary Heading: I love this place! Excellent staff
Summary: I stayed here on the  5th of january.The staff here are super friendly. This ismy favorite best western to be in because of the location and staff. its close to everything. I love to stay here when I come to see a ducks game. Its close to downtown disney too. It was stuffy when i got in the room but nothing that the ac didnt fix

Summary Heading: Its the Best of The Best Westerns
Summary: I love this place. Its close to the honda Center and Disneland. We can use the buses to travel and its easy to do. its also saves money. Its a great location to everything that is fun. I have stayed here many times since November 2013 and i have to say its larely inpart to the awesome staff at this place. There are excellent people here but the two that stick out in my mind are George who i met on my very first stay. He is very nice. The other would be Nagy is a repair guy. He saw mein the parking lot and tried to cheer me up because i have been feeling really down ever since My best friend's Father died. He when out of his way to make me smile only to find out later thtat i was a guest there. I think its awesome. This is the Best western I prefer the most becuase the staff here

Nothing bad to say about this hotel booked it to go to Disneyland.Would reccomend it it's quiet and clean staff was nice and friendly. Our room was inside the courtyard no noise problems would stay again.

the staff was very friendly and made you feel right at home, the rooms were very clean and updated, the morning breakfast had a very nice selection and of quality. the kids really loved the heated pool

We have stayed at this hotel one other time. The price was right for our length of stay, so we decided to stay again. Rooms are average, our room smelled a little so i opened the window turned on the air and it was fresh again. The beds are comfortable, i like the refrigerator in the room, but you must remember to turn the temp down for it to get colder. I noticed a few things that could be fixed, the paint wasn't perfect, a few little finishing touched that would make it look more presentable. If you get a room next to the elevator be prepared to be awaken by people talking and children yelling and running around. Its average, i would stay here again, for the price you cant find anything as nice close to Disneyland.

Summary Heading: Lots of Positives Here & Surrounding Neighborhood
Summary: Ok let's start. Friendly helpful desk staff. Computers that work! Clean lobby and rooms. Good sized suites. A real hot, hot tub! Heated outdoor pool! (Kids loved it) Courtyard breakfast if you like! Adequate parking. Excellent Mexican Restaurant across the parking lot (Pepitos) walking distance to AMC movies & mall. Great restaurants at the mall. The area is very quiet and peaceful. The rooms can get noisy but it is the holidays. Could hear a noisy little fellow running back in forth in the room above us in the evening. No real noise complaints though. Price for larger family. Perfect. Fairly easy to drive to Disney, Honda Center (hockey/concerts) or California Angels which we passed on route to hockey. I will stay here again!

Summary Heading: Drive a little for great value
Summary: For Christmas vacation we booked a package and stayed two nights at Pier Paradise Hotel in Disneyland and would not stay at their hotels again. Small rooms and a long walk to parks. Never again. We stayed one night at this Best Western in a suite, very happy, and great value, it is a little over two miles which is only a few minutes from parks. Nice big, clean suites, very comfortable, free breakfast, and a nice patio with a pool and hot tub. We felt we were at a fancy hotel.

Summary Heading: Not as nice as the pictures
Summary: Room was average compare to other Best Western Plus. Hairs were found on the bathroom walls and pillows. Woke up many times overnight because of disturbing sound of water pipes from other rooms. Good breakfast. Quiet hotel otherwise.

Summary Heading: Nice place to stay at a reasonable price.
Summary: We like it's close proximity to places we like to go.  It has always been clean and the staff we have dealt with are nice.  Ut's nice the breakfast is included, they have a nice selection of items to choose from, different juices and cereals and hot dishes too.

Summary Heading: Very Cost Efficient but not the cleanest
Summary: Upon arrival the staff was pleasant and helpful.  My husband and I were taking our 2 and 5 year old to Disneyland.  My mom had booked the adjacent room as well.  We had a king suite which was very spacious.  Pull out sofa bed in living room and separate King size bedroom.  It was perfect for our family of four.  Very helpful to have a mini fridge and microwave.  We had breakfast in our rooms a couple of times just to save time before heading to Disneyland.  It's great to have breakfast included in the cost, but this breakfast was just satisfactory.  Same thing EVERY day.  For seven days at same hotel, it got a little tiring by the end.  Coffee wasn't even tolerable.  Eggs and sausage were good, and they had granola, yogurt and bananas that were pretty good.  My main complaint

About the only good thing about this hotel was the staff.  It was a bit smelly, very cold and noisy. Asked if I could move to another room and was ultimately accomodated.  Beds were comfortable, pillows were not.  Could not get heat to work in either room.. wonder about the AC?  TV in the living room would come on by itself in the evening multiple times.  Morning breakfast was edible (not very good).  Coffee had no taste to it. If you are looking for a low cost, no frill alternative, this will do.  Will not stay there again.

Summary Heading: Home Sweet Home in L.A. Outskirt
Summary: 3-girlfriend rendevous in Orange,CA for a wedding - we shared a 2-queen-bed room with adjoining family room suite; lovely sofas/sitting area, wifi, 2 cable-connected TVs, and full kitchen for just over $100/night. Excellent breakfast room with delicious and ample selection. Excellent hotel staff. I went to the front desk with a wifi connection issue at 3am and was immediately greeted by George - who asked if he could get me coffee, fixed my problem with a smile, and was willing to go the extra mile in the middle of the night for late-arrivees. The pool was heated and lovely; the hot tub an added delight! The central plaza area around which the rooms were located was beautifully planted with roses, and other delightful plants. I can't say enough good things about this place! It's

Summary Heading: BW Plus Inn & Suites - Great Experience
Summary: This hotel and the staff are the best. We are always treated like family. I recommend this hotel to everyone I know and it's only minutes from the Outlets at Orange. We will be back again in a few weeks just because we like it so much. Trip - Become a Best Western Gold Elite member. They give you a lot of discounts. My last trip with the $50 reward was $59.

Have stayed here several times, both with and without kids. Good location in OC, right by The Block for restaurants. Very close to some great taco places (if you know where to look). Not too far from beach, but without the traffic. Suites are very nice.

Bed comfy/large, spacious room. Free bfast okay. Overall good Hotel and would stay again. Unrelated to the hotel was the ART. HORRIBLE, HORRIBLE service. It was either late or took off super early. Never on time to get us to/from Disneyland. Will NOT do the ART shuttle again!

The hotel rooms are getting a bit run down (carpeting & bathrooms). The continental breakfast area is WAY to small, and there is never enough food available without you waiting or checking back to see if they have replenished food items. Although the family suites are large, the bathroom area is pretty small for a family of 4 to share. The exterior is nice, the front lobby is as well -  but it is a very small lobby.  It is right off the freeway for easy access around the city.

Great Room & a Great Rate...Love the Breakfast Buffet.  I have stayed here before & I usually use Hotels.com but this time I checked H.com & then contacted this hotel directly & was able save more $$$ & to avoid a bunch of extra fees.  This restaurant is close & convenient to almost everything U need in the Orange Co. area but is NOT in the middle of everything! ! !

This was a business trip to the City of Orange. The place was a little difficult to find, but once we found it the check in was great.  I can't climb stairs and left this as a note when reserving the room.  The reception clerk acknowledged this and put us on the 1st floor.  Our room was small, probably because the king bed. Room was clean but not immaculate, nice thick towels, everything was in great working order, and free breakfast that was very good.  Better than our stay at the Disneyland Hotel 2 weeks ago. Would definitely stay here again.

The hotel was clean and the room more than adequate in space to feel more than just a studio.  It has a tiny kitchenette for those who prefer to microwave and warm up snacks.  The FREE breakfast lacks variety, but the price is good.

Due to a scheduled surgery and family members flying in I needed two rooms in the Orange area. The quality and cleanliness of this hotel was surprisingly pleasant for the price in the area.  I would definitely stay here again if I needed to spend time in the Orange area.

I came to check in past midnight.  I was jet lagged and very tired.  The front desk gave me keys to 2 different rooms that did not work.  I came back to the lobby to find about 10 others who could not get into their rooms.  Turns out that no keys were working.  The front desk tried to use his master key and that was not working either.  He was getting overwhelmed and started snapping at customers who were just quietly standing there.  I also saw a man who came down to report that his TV was not working and the repairman who came by said that it was not repairable.  Also, the lobby smelled of cigarette smoke and ethnic food.  After waiting an hour, I finally had enough and went to the Hyatt.

Summary Heading: Had a training session at this dump
Summary: I didn't stay at this hotel but from the 4 days I spent in training here this place is a dump. The public restrooms weren't clean and the conference room was run down. They didn't have pads of paper or pens for us to use and when I asked for a pen they scrambled to find one. Also, for 3 days there was a condom in the bushes in the parking lot so they obviously don't clean their parking lot often. Ick.

I do not recommend this "inn" for anyone.  The front desk was rude when I checked in and rude when I checked out, which was an insulting experience (they had to check the room).  In addition, I got bitten by something, who knows what!  My recommendation is to spend the extra money and go somewhere else!

We booked this hotel at last minute as we were driving to Anaheim the night before our check in at our "vacation" hotel. It's kind of tucked away from the hustle and bustle of the city, but close to everything at the same time. The Outlets were close and the Garden Walk and Disneyland/California Adventure are within a 5 minute drive.  We were surprised at how much we liked this room. One room was a king bed and the was a sitting room with a sofa bed and a kitchenette. The only thing it was missing was a microwave, which I found rather odd as there was a spot for one in the pantry space.  When we got to our room, the key wasn't working, so I had to run back to down to get them re-done. Somewhere in that little window, my daughters cell phone (iphone 4) fell out of her back

Summary Heading: I'll Prepare to Fight Back (IF there's a next time)
Summary: Room was very good except NO microwave (and I had restaurant leftovers with me). Good breakfast.  Desktop computer w/ printer near front desk--very helpful. This would have been a good experience/value except for this:  I returned to my room after 8am bfast and card key wouldn't work. Went to front desk to inquire. Got a new card; and, b/c I guess I looked tired, was ASKED if I wanted a late checkout. I said I'd appreciate an extra hour to give me a full chance to nap before leaving and my wish was granted by the front desk clerk. I put a do not disturb sign on my door and laid down. Then, at 11am as I was asleep, there was hard-pounding on the door as given by a cop. I ignored it but it started-up again & wouldn't stop. I opened the door, hiding behind it in my underwear, and

We really enjoyed our stay. All the staff was very helpful and pleasant to deal with. Any little thing that came up, they were right on top of it and addressed our needs. I would like to mention Morgan who works at the front desk and say how professional and pleasant she is. She is a real credit to the Best Western organization.
