This was a weekend getaway to visit family and friends. The hotel was much better than I expected and service was exceptional. The location to Disneyland and other things to do is less than 5 miles. The location, and price was my reason for selecting the property. I would definitely return.

Stayed here for a night in October 2013. Liked the rooms, big and spacious. The free breaksfast was good too with many varities. It also had free wifi. Overall good accomodation with in 4 miles of disney. Would recommend staying here.

Summary Heading: Surprised that this hotel has such high reviews.
Summary: Surprised that this hotel has such high reviews. I was expecting so much more since there are much nicer ones in the area for the same or cheaper price. The wall and ceiling had areas falling apart in the room and it looked like someone had painted the room in a rush. There were fingerprints all over the walls in the bathroom areas although the sink, toilet and bathtub appeared clean. The hotel is very minimal blankets and no microwave. The upside was the staff was friendly, the bed was comfortable and it was relatively close to the highway. At the same price, I wouldn't stay here again.

Very good experience with this hotel.  Our room included a refrigerator &  microwave that made it possible to eat in our room and save a little money.  The entire hotel was clean.  The staff was friendly and helpful, and the location was perfect.  Close to an outlet mall, coffee shop, grocery store and I-5 access.  Would stay here again.

Summary Heading: Good Value for Best Western Hotel
Summary: We've stayed a a number of hotels near Disneyland with our family. This hotel is a little farther away from Disneyland compared to several other Best Westerns, but having a suite was the reason why picked this hotel for our family.  This hotel does not have a resort feel, but more of a business park atmosphere with the brick exterior. It did not have the Disney inspired decor around the lobby or kids activities on site as many of the hotels closer to Disneyland would, but it was still a nice clean place to stay at.   Our room was a suite with a wet bar. They also suites with full kitchens in some units. The bed was very comfortable, the room and bedding was clean, and the room decor was nice. Breakfast was a step above continental as it included eggs, sausage, and make your own

Family of 4 stayed 5 nights in late Oct.  We would give a higher rating but service was extremely poor.  First 3 nights we asked for a duvet for the pull-out sofabed (child has allergy to bedsheet)  and 4 sets of towels (instead of 3). For 2 nights at least 4 different front desk staff would "forget to communicate" our requests and said there were no extra duvets in entire motel (even though it is low season). When we asked for manager, they conveniently said she would not be back for several days (after we left).  Finally on the third night another front desk person listened and fulfilled our simple requests.  Once we had received our requests the rest of the stay was fine.  We travel to lots of motels/hotels and this customer service was one of our worst experiences ever at a

Quiet and secure location away from the Disneyland rush.  Room was clean and only slightly worn.  Breakfast was not up to expectations so don't expect much.  The hotel felt very secure and courtyard was nice but seemed dated. Huge room

This is a great place to stay with the family for an Anaheim or other Orange County/ Los Angels  trip. Having a bedroom and two TV's is a life saver after a long day and kids who sleep with the TV on. This hotel is also right next to 4 Freeways that can get you anywhere in Southern California fast

I stayed for the night on business.  The room was a suite and wonderful.  Breakfast was fine, but the coffee needs work.  I would recommend this location to everyone. The pool was cute and the kids swimming were having fun, but when I closed the door I couldn't hear a thing.  That was awesome.

We really enjoyed staying here. The service and staff are top-notch and the location is great! The breakfast buffet far exceeds anything I've ever seen at other hotels and it's always a pleasure staying at this establishment! :) Plus the beds are so comfortable! Simon and Roger were a true joy to meet and talk to at the front desk and were incredibly helpful at suggesting things in the area to do that we enjoyed! :) Thanks guys!! You rock!! :)

My stay here was so nice,I pictured in my mind how I wanted it to be and they helped me make it happen.. Ana was understanding,helpful,patient and extended the courtesy to let me do late checkout with leasthassle..Simon was excellant on checking me in..fast-no fuss! Will definitely be coming back! :-)

My party and I had an overall good experience at this hotel.  It provides all the amenities we need.  We really appreciate the outside doors that require a room key to even access the hallways - this is a great form of security.

We have stayed at the Meridian several times and we always have a wonderful experience.  We have family in the area and any time we go to visit family or friends, we stay here.  The staff is very friendly and helpful; the rooms are suites with a separate bedroom and very very...did I say very comfortable bed.  There is a TV in each room.  There is a kitchenette with microwave and small refrigerator.  They aren't stingy with the coffee or the other freebies.  I think this is probably the best place I've ever stayed.  Oh, and they have shuttle service to Disneyland and they are kid friendly, too.

Summary Heading: Great place to stay when visiting Disneyland!
Summary: We stayed at the Best Western Plus Meridian inn & Suites in Anageim while visiting Disneyland! the hotel staff were very helpful with directions to restaurants and attractions! the hotel also provides a free computer with printer to print out your disneyland entrance tickets if you have not purchased them before arrival! breakfast was good and the rooms/pool/hot tub and grounds were clean and well kept!

Received a very warm welcome from very helpful checking in staff. The room was very clean and the beds very comfortable. The air conditioning was a little noisy, but acceptable and the water pipes where noisy when the room above used water, but again, acceptable. The pool area was kept very clean, as was the outside seating area and the breakfast room. The free Wi-Fi was a bonus and worked extremely well. For those visiting Disney it is a short drive.

Summary Heading: Wonderful Stay at a Disney Theme Plus Hotel
Summary: I stayed here on business but intend to return for pleasure. The rooms were very spacious, clean, and comfortable. I loved the courtyard and pool area. It is so pretty and tropical with the palm trees and lovely island style umbrellas. The price was so reasonable. I really got a lot for the money. The breakfast was good to with hot items like cheesy scrambled eggs and sausage. The location is right down the street from the Outlets of OC and lots of restaurants. I will be back soon!

We enjoyed our stay. The staff was very helpful. Though we were early, the front staff offered to store our luggage in a safe place until our room was available They also any questions we had and gave advice of things to do see in the area. Though there were lots of families with children, we weren't disturbed with the noise. Enjoyed the pool and hot tub. Nice bed and pillows.

Summary Heading: Great for the price and close to Disney
Summary: I searched for days and hours trying to find a place that had the essentials for a Disney trip that didn't cost $200 a night.  So glad that I cancelled the roach motel across from Disney and booked here instead.  We needed a separate bedroom and living room with a pull out, a kitchenette, and a crib (not a pack n play!) and having a breakfast was a bonus!  This is a lovely hotel and the amenities you get for the price is less than anything in the Disney vicinity.  It's less than 5 miles away!!  You will absolutely need a car as the ART shuttle takes about 25 minutes according to the front desk. Yes, the AC is loud and I could hear people walking around upstairs, but it really didn't bother us too much.  If you have high expectations look elsewhere.  The rooms are clean, lots of

Staff making you feel like thieves and liars, noisy air condtioners, smokers everywhere - even in non smoking areas, burned and stale breakfast items every day, thin floors and walls meaning that you hear everyone and everything, keycards that failed four times in for days. Do yourself a favour and don't spoil your holiday here like we did.

Summary Heading: No bells & whistles but clean & comfortable
Summary: We were looking for a good priced clean place to stay when we went to Disneyland. This fit the bill with clean rooms, and breakfast included. We had a bit of trouble with the tv one night and they told us to unplug it for half an hour. We had been out all day and wanted to catch up on the day's news before bed so that was no use to us. The lady in the breakfast place was fantastic.

Rooms are ok. Air con is noisy. Breakfast is plentiful - coffee is bad however!  Beds are super comfortable,  but pillows could be replaced.  Easy access off the freeways, and quick easy drive to Disneyland which is great .......so you can avoid that 1-5  which can be a nitemare! Plenty of resturants around the area, but you will need a car.  Heaps of parking at hotel.

The hotel is the complete package for business or pleasure. These are rooms with elbow room. Very clean. Very professional staff. We needed to extend our in room business meeting a few hours past check out time. The staff was very accommodating with a can - do no pressure attitude.

Had a decent suite for $90/night, but you really get what you pay for.  The location is in a safe feeling area, the hotel is in clean condition although it is older.  The amenities, decor & overall feel rate a strong $90/night.  Great value if you are looking for a good bargain, low frills place to stay.

My wife and I had a late night gala in downtown Los Angeles, then an early morning to meet friends at Disneyland.  We arrived at midnight with a couple of people ahead of us checking-in.  The Front Desk agent was super friendly and engaging, as he quickly got us all checked-in and to our rooms.  Our room was updated, well-appointed, and very comfortable.  The beautiful courtyard is lush with live plants, flowers, and the pool.  It's in a business area, so you know that it's a safe and quiet area.  This hotel is very eco-friendly, utilizing an energy efficiency system that activates the room with your key.  (Very commonly used in Europe and Asia.)  The bath amenities were also eco-friendly, reducing waste going to landfills.  Breakfast in the morning was very nice with scrabbled

Summary Heading: Clean Room, Excellent Bed, Nice Pool & Breakfast
Summary: We've stayed in this hotel 2 times and both were good experiences.  The bed was firm/comfortable, the pool and hot tub were nice.  It was quiet.  The breakfast was satisfactory.  Parking was convenient.  We would stay there again.

nice spa & pool, quiet location, clean comfortable rooms, helpful pleasant staff, nice breakfast area, good selection hot foods, cereals, muffins & fruit Wi-Fi flat screen TV microwave, refrigerator etc.

We have stayed at this hotel several times. This last time wasn't so great. The breakfast was undercooked. The tub was broken, the fridge didn't keep cool very well, the carpets were filthy and there was a huge spider in the room! Overall, the hotel was "ok", but I think there are better options for $100 a night.

We are a family of 4 that went to Disney. Stayed here for 4 nights and were very pleased. Ana at the front desk was great and the housekeeping staff kept the room spotless and tidy. If you have small children, get the suite so they have room to run around. Will return here on our next trip!!

Summary Heading: Great Place to stay excellent beds
Summary: Great place to stay.  King suites are very nice sized and well furnished.  Breakfast is OK.  Only down fall is they require an open credit card authorization with no amount, instead of swiping to hold a determined amount on your card.  They also don't know when or how the authorization will be destroyed once they determine no extra charge is needed.

We stayed here for 4 nights/5days during our trip to Disney.    PRO’s: Free Parking, WiFi & breakfast (typical continental breakfast).  The closer you stay to Disney the more likely it’ll be that you’ll have to pay for all of that yourself.  The pillows and bed were GREAT!  They had 3 different pillows (per person) for you to choose from.  Location – Close but not too close to all of the Disney traffic.  Get on the freeway, go a couple of exits down and you’re at Disney.  It’s about a ½ mile from a great Outlet Mall and there are various restaurants in the area.  The staff was nothing but nice.  Rooms were clean and updated.  We had a one bedroom suite and with two flat screen TV’s and a kitchenette.   CON’s:  A lot of pool noise on the weekends (kids, family’s) but nothing

Our second stay here in Anaheim. Our first experience with a Best Western Plus was in Lake Elsinore for a family event. Because it was so great we decided on trying it again in Anaheim for our usual Disneyland trek. Very affordable roomy suite that is nicely furnished with a more upscale look and feel than you would expect for the price! The continental breakfast is plenty ample with fresh made waffles! It was comfortable, great night's sleep! The staff people were very nice and helpful! Thanks for a great stay!

Other than a few minor issues, we were satisfied with our week long stay. 2 room suites have lots of space, 2 TVs with many channels definitely a plus. Good value for price we paid. Friendly staff. Close to major freeways so easy to get to places other than Just disneyland.  Would recommend to families who want to stay close to Disneyland without paying high prices of resorts closer.

We stumbled across this hotel randomly but will be back when ever we bring the kids with us to Anaheim. Loved having a separate room to sleep in than the kids and we both had TV's. We felt safe and close to everything.

Summary Heading: BW more then met our needs
Summary: $5 shuttle to Disney and back is fast and easy and cheaper than parking !  The rooms are spacious and clean and comfortable.  The King size bed was very comfortable,  The free breakfast is a few notches above continental including make your own Belgian waffles and delicious cheese eggs.  Tjhe staff is super friendly and helpful.  In addition to being close to Disney, it is also close to good restaurants and Orange Outlet stores

We've stayed at this hotel several times now. it has been a very good experience everytime. the staff is very nice,the rooms are clean,and it's nice & quiet there. Brkfst is more than "continental",several yummy foods & variety of drinks.

Check-in was fast and efficient. The staff was friendly. The room was a suite with small kitchenette 2 tvs, french doors separated the bedroom from the living area, it was clean and roomy. The beds were quite comfortable & good water pressure in the shower. The stay was nice & quiet (we felt very safe) , and the pool relaxing. The only bummer thing was the breakfast. I am thankful there was hot coffee, toast and cereal for the kids. ( the waffles were ok, basic hotel waffles). The eggs seemed artificial, the danishes were rock hard. The sitting area outside was nice with plants and a water fountain. A nice outdoor outlet mall just up the street gave us some dinner choices & alittle late night shopping.

The Best Western Meridian in Orange, CA is the place I stay when visiting my daughter at Chapman University. It's very clean, quiet and safe. The staff are friendly and efficient. The hotel is close to shopping and lots of restaurants. The free breakfast is ok, not the best, but passable.

Near town of Orange. Good overall. Staff at check in was excellent and very friendly. Room was nice and bed comfortable. Pool area was nice and clean. We did not swim. Breakfast was just OK. Nothing special.

Staff was very friendly and helpful. Nice breakfast. Stayed in a room with king size bed. Room was very small. Hotel us been updated but bathroom area needs some maintance done, kind of falling apart.

The hotel was a terrible place to stay. I would never stay there again. The beds were very uncomfortable. The rooms were small and to expensive for what you got. There breakfast was also terrible. The bathroom was small, paint was peeling off the door jam. Would never stay there again.

We were given a room on the ground floor opposite the elevator.  It was dark and smelled musty.  There had been overuse of some sort of air freshener which made it worse. The first night after an eleven hour flight, we were very tired but were constantly disturbed by people who were waiting for the elevator. The pillows were not comfortable, one was like a sack of potatoes and weighed as much! We asked to be moved the next morning and was told that it was possible but the room needed to be cleaned and to come back later.  We explained that we were going out and was told that was fine.  When we got back the clerk knew nothing about this. After all this we decided to stay where we were as we couldn't be bothered to move. I was disappointed with the quality of the room and I

Loved your your rooms and all the hotels locations. there was just a minor thing that needed to get done with housekeeping & maintanance,but administration took care of it. my over all experience in the two I stood in was amanzing and will definately will go back and give an excellent review. Breakfast is good but perhaps add different things. pancakes and different kinds of eggs would be nice. All front desk are wonderful and kind; great people skills. Most likely will go back and will spread the word to family and friends.

still smells of smoke, energy saving lites and air/heat controls are a  major hassle slow to respond, and,end up with lights in bathroom not coming on till your done!  unable to eat breakfast hours too late, slow inconvenient elevator.  check in a project with credit card slip on file and 500. deposit if use debit cards,,, made a different group leave instead

We used this hotel as a base for our stay in California for the weekend. We stayed on a lower level room and thought that we were in for a lot of noise, but surprisingly the room was quiet and there were no noise issues at all. We had also taken a suite with a kitchen so that we did not have to rely on eating out all the time, so it was a nice convenience. The provided pots, pans, dishes and utensils were all fine. It wasn't your top notch pots, but they did the job in getting the food cooked. The fridge was a full size fridge so space was not an issue.  The living space for the room we had was large with a separate dining and lounging area from where the main bedroom was. This was perfect as we were travelling with two toddlers that needed space to move around. The tv reception

Overall very happy with this hotel, pros definitely outweighed a few cons:   Pros- 2 room suite meant the 3 of us could spread out, could close the doors between sitting room and bedroom for privacy or even when the guys watched sports to wind down at the end of a busy day and I wanted to watch something else in the bedroom.  Beds very comfy, bedding soft and plentiful, clock radio, flat screen TVs, double sink vanity outside of the separate toilet/shower room, a third sink in the kitchen area off the sitting room was also useful, rain-shower head was very nice, liked the soap/shampoo/conditioner dispensers on the shower wall, fridge kept our drinks icy cold, microwave in the kitchen, also a coffee maker.  Room nice and clean.  Near enough to highways to get around, but did not

We stayed here 5 nights in july 2013 to do Disney and Universal.  Despite some people saying that this hotel is some distance from Disneyland, Google maps show it to be less than 5 miles!   Our suite was large - one room with a kitchen, sitting area and TV and the other room with two double beds and another TV.   Everything was very clean, although a bit dated in overall appearance.    Our only minor criticism of the room is that the wash basins are located outside the actual bathroom, which means that the bathroom itself is very small.   The complimentary breakfast was more than adequate, although it is served with disposible plates and cutlery.  The hotel is located close to the Orange outlet shops, which also have a good selection of restaurants.   We would definitely

This Best Western Suites hotel is solid for the Best Western brand. The suite was nice and spacious - we only stayed one night, but it would be nice for a longer stay. The hotel is located in front of an business office plaza so it's not much to look at - we actually thought it was an office building. There is a nice pool/spa located in the middle of the hotel. It was busy with families. The location for us was perfect for a trip to Angels Stadium - it's only about a 5 minute drive. It's also close to the outlet mall. I wouldn't stay in this location if I was planning a trip to Disneyland - it's not that close. The breakfast was nice. There was a nice selection and the staff kept the food refilled and stocked.

We stayed here with 2 grandchildren 11 and 13 and were very happy with the hotel.  Pool, breakfast, free internet, 2 TV's and especially the spaciousness of the suite - all contributed to a positive experience.  The friendly, helpful staff and attractiveness of the courtyard with flowers, palm trees, and fountain made us feel like we were in a more expensive hotel.

Summary Heading: 15 minute drive to Disneyland, but one of our favorites
Summary: I am catching up on my 2013 reviews.  We have been in Disneyland about 40 days in 9 months.  We've stayed in 10 different hotels near DL in those 9 months.  I am big on Hotwire/Priceline, but this time, I needed a bigger room for 6, so I found this and still can't believe the value.  If you prepay, you get about 20% off and the rate reflects the distance to Disneyland, which is far, so it's cheaper.  If this property was outside the gates, it would be sold out all of the time and the rate would be about $200/night.  We returned from DL at night and found the door ajar (housekeeping was there last).  After talking to the desk and checking our items to see if anything was missing, all was well.  Hotel doors are designed to close by themselves (fire safety).  This room did not.

Summary Heading: Very nice place to stay me and family enjoyed our stay Will recommend to my fire ds and family
Summary: I really enjoyed my stay  very clean and rooms are great ! The staff was very friendly  and professional Will return in the future thanks for everything!! Meand my family enjoyed e everything .The area was amazing .Did not care for towels  little rough but  other than that my stay was great!!

Summary Heading: Excellent King Suite for a small family
Summary: Three of us stayed here for three nights for Disneyland.  It was one of the best king suites we have stayed in in terms of comfort, size and price.  We usually stay at Marriott's SpringHill Suites and generally like them.  This BW hotel is better for its size and price.  It was the largest king suite we had stayed in.  Location for Disneyland is not bad either if you are willing to drive for 7-8 minutes.  We usually have issues with sofa beds in the king suites of many other hotels (the springs are either too soft or too worn out), but the sofa bed in this room was just firm enough for a comfortable night of sleep and we felt it was more comfy than some of the actual beds in othe hotels. Parking is free too.  If I have to mention problems, the external look is not very pretty -

Summary Heading: NOT EVEN CLOSE TO BEST WESTERN PLUS
Summary: I have stayed at this property 2 times, after the first time I said to myself never again, but on the Best Western site stated that the property had just been upgraded and remodeled. When I arrived, the lobby was exactly the same, I thought that the upgraded done was on the rooms, wrong! The elevator stunk, the 2 luggage carts on the back of the property, seemed to have gone trough the African Rally, when I enter the room, it was so small, we could hardly move around without bumping into each other, no microwave, only 2 bath towels that seemed like sand paper, left a note to housekeeper to please leave an extra towel, the request was ignored, and the note was left on the screen of the TV, no way to miss it, the shampoo and conditioner seemed to be purchased from a 99 cent store,

This hotel was recommended to us by family living in Santa Ana.  It is in an office park and looks like an office building.  We were surprised at check in that our 2 rooms had been upgraded to what seemed to be a double room.  We had a separate room with double pocket doors separating the living room from the bed room.  There was a sofa sleeper with a couple of tables and a kitchen area.  No stove, but with refrig, large sink, cabinets.  Bath area needed to be up-dated too.  The bed was very comfortable.  The only criticism I could give it would be the dark, out-dated decor.  But a comfortable bed is what we needed so that made it a wonderful night. Good breakfast but a lot of families with kids, probably for Disneyland.  Court yard was lovely.

I have never stayed at a Best Western before because I sort of felt like they were on the lower end of the hotel/motel chain. After seeing the pictures I decided to take a chance and check it out. We booked a couple of rooms for our group and upon arrival I was pleased with the appearance of the property. The lobby is nicely decorated and the rooms are also nicely updated. The rooms are quite large (we booked suites) and one had a full kitchen and was fully stocked with cookware, dishes, and flatware. While we were all pleased with the size and decor of the rooms there were other aspects that were disappointing. Within the first few minutes in the room we spotted a large cockroach in the closet and several large beetles of unknown origin around the hotel. In the bathroom of one

the people at the front desk were very helpfull! we stay here every summer! We bring a wrestling team before camp and they love the pool and the court yard to eat and hang out.we love the mini kitchen and alot of room in our mini suites!

We  enjoyed  this  hotel the  rooms  were   large  and  staff  friendly  . We  come  to so-cal  every  Summer  and  this  is  a hidden  gem.  It   worked  perfect  for  our family  trips . We  look  forward  to our  next   stay here . The breakfast was  fine  for  us . It  is  nice  not  to  be  charged  for  parking a big plus and  the 2 bd suites  are  spacious !!!

This hotel needs some major overhaul. Old, cracked walls, insufficient lighting, questionable carpeting, mediocre breakfast and breakfast area. It wasn't disgusting, but really was really lacking in TLC. Some very patchworked renovations and upgrades made it feel off.

My daughter and I stayed in a standard king room for four nights (Sun.-Thurs) in July. Overall, the experience was a positive and enjoyable one.  The room was nicely sized, had good closet/drawer space, and adequately clean, even behind the desk, headboard, and chairs (I hate it when I have what is an apparently clean room on the surface, only to move something to plug in a charger and find caked on dirt and cobwebs). The bathroom could have used a deep cleaning in the grout, but it was fine. We booked online a few months in advance and got a great deal overall, so I don't have any real complaints. The area felt safe, and even though it was close to the freeway, I heard no noise at all (a problem we have previously run into with other L.A. area hotels). We requested a room

Requests not met, poor area, police at property for several hours, going through rennovations, staff excessive on taking additional credit cards, was told there was credit card fraud at property by staff when police were present.

Summary Heading: Watch for holds on credit/debit cards
Summary: BW requires a hold be placed on your credit/debit card for incidentals upon arrival. Though I was not informed of this when I booked via phone, I was okay with it and authorized an $150 hold on my debit card. I decided to pay for the hotel stay in cash. When  I returned from vacation I discovered that BW had placed TWO holds on my card, one for the authorized amount, and another for the total hotel bill. I made purchases on my vacation unaware of the unauthorized hold, and had I not had overdraft protection, would have had over $100 in overdraft fees with my bank (I typically do not keep large sums of money in my checking account). Beware of this type of issue.  I spoke with a customer service representative who assured me that both hold were released but that it might take a

I had business close by and this hotel worked very well for me.  Obviously it's very good for families and kids going to Disneyland but overall was quiet enough for me, the rooms were big (2 rooms, front and bedroom, which I like) and everything worked fine.  Breakfast wasn't 5 star of course, so I'd just use that to snack up until you get out somewhere but good enough to get started for the day.  Owner and team were friendly.

Summary Heading: I wanted to like this property...
Summary: I read all the bad reviews before our trip and I honestly thought (based on the photos) that it couldn't possibly be as bad as those reviews made it seem. Well, it was. The furniture in the rooms is new, but the room itself was old and in need of some serious attention. The elevator and laundry area were absolutely filthy as well. There were not enough towels or blankets in our rooms. At first we thought our pillows were stained, but when I looked closely, they were just completely threadbare in spots (too much bleach?). I requested a pack n play for our son and they brought up an ancient mini crib on wheels that was actually falling apart due to loose screws. Our son is older, so with some modifications, he slept in it fine, but I would never put an infant in there. The room

My family and I recently stayed here for 3 days for a Disneyland trip.  Having just checked out of the so-so Best Western in the Woodland Hills area, this one was made so seem like a luxury room.  We had a very spacious two-room suite.  Very clean, well stocked.  Everything in room was updated.  No shortage of towels and no mildew smells.  My picky daughter and I felt comfortable walking barefoot on carpet.  Breakfast was bare minimum, but did the job.  No bugs in rooms, that I could see.  Location was about one mile away from Disneyland and perfectly easy drive to park.  We actually enjoyed being a little bit away from the busy Disneyland area.  "The Block" outlet mall, Starbucks and a Target just around the corner.  Front desk very nice and helpful, check-in/check-out super

We stayed 2 nights through a deal on Expedia, but still was not cheap.  The beds were decent, but everything else only earns a mediocre review. Rooms were VERY dated, smell mildew-y and one of our rooms smelled like smoke. Booked as it advertised 'free Internet,' but our room was too far from the router to pick the signal up.  When we called to the front desk to ask about it, they said they would try to reset the router and to just keep trying.  Never did work.  Breakfast was cold, undercooked sausage links and eggs.  The dry cereal was damp, like it had absorbed moisture frim the air.  It was in a decent location, and the Mexican restaurant in the mall parking lot nearby was excellent.  Would not stay here again.

Summary Heading: Don't Judge a Book By It's Cover?
Summary: I booked the hotel on Kayak about 4-days prior for an average of $84.60 nightly, compared to the list price of $130 each night. Hotel is in business complex, which was bit odd of location. Outside looks semi-industrial and not hotel inviting. Building itself is old, probably built in 70's with bricks and stucco exterior, elevator is run down. My initial impression was not great. Check in was quick and attendant was friendly enough. I questioned them about cockroach reviews read and he said no reports of them for 2-months since winter months over? Room itself was tiny with large furniture. Furniture is real wood and nice. Bathroom and tub have different layers of old white tile, with some replaced expensive tile splash-back, which seems bit odd why they don't just replace it all

The room smelled like mildrew. We kept killing bugs in our room. the air conditioning system was so freakin loud! The bathroom was way too small and dirty. The only good thing i can say is our housekeeper was awsome!!

At first glance the hotel doesn't look amazing but once inside it is a much different story. The room itself was amazing, stayed in one of the suites and it was worth every penny. My only complaint would have to be that the Jacuzzi bathtub was small, one of us barely fit into it.

It's a nice hotel for its value, minutes drive from everything, yet it's far enough away from alot of partying and traffic that it's quiet so you can get some good rest. Great for families, and has free breakfast and wi-fi. It's a bit older, but still kept in good condition.

At first we thought it was a little far from Disneyland but once we got to know our way around it is actually very close.  The reception  person (Morgan) was fabulous.  Very friendly and very knowledgable.  The room was good. Very clean. The bed very comfortable.  The garden area was nice and had a fountain.  The hot tub and pool was great.  Breakfast was very good. It included freshly made waffles as well as eggs and sausages cereal, muffins....lot of choices.  We really enjoyed our stay. Would definately stay again.

My husband and I Truly enjoyed our stay. Our room was great! It was clean and comfortable.  Staff was beyond great, from the moment we checked in to the time we checked out. Professional staff all the way around. The location of the hotel was perfect!

Our stay was good. It had what we needed and our family was comfortable. The downside was the need for updates in the rooms. New tile especially would make a huge difference. Also the lighting wasn't great. It felt like we had to have every light on in the room to see anything. Last was the breakfast. There were no healthy option besides plain yogurt. We chose to eat something in our room more mornings than not. The staff was great and very accommodating. When we had an issue they quickly resolved it. We would stay there again. Oh, and the location is great!  Quick 5 minute trip to Disney plus all sorts of shopping within 5 minutes in every direction.

We have stayed here 4 times. The breakfast service and quality was outstanding. The pool and spa area looks great(courtyard style). It is not too far from Disneyland only about 10 min. The price I paid was a deal, we will book this hotel for all trips to Disneyland.

Summary Heading: A very warm and comfortable stay
Summary: We checked in around 9pm in the night.  The front desk staff was so cordial and welcoming.  The quality of the room and the amenities provided therein way exceeded our expectations.  The bed was nice (not too hard, not too soft), the room was super clean.  Had a great night sleep.  Then, in the morning we headed to the complementary breakfast.  The breakfast could have had more choices, especially more fresh fruits, but nonetheless it was decent and satisfying.  Overall, we had a great stay, and would certainly recommend the place

Stayed here for one night for a buiness trip.  Very friendly front desk.  I was upgraded to a King Suite.  Very nice room.  Felt like it was brand new.  Comfy bed, nice linens, a lot of room, very green-friendly.  I did not eat the free breakfast, but I would stay here again for business or with family for a trip to Disneyland.

I had great stay, rooms were clean, staff exellent and welcoming. Check in, out and breackfast. Very accessible properties. Thank you Morgan for the best wishes at check out. Also to my friend from Egypt ..:) This will be my destination every time I go to Orange CA.  M Daoudi

Summary Heading: A comfortable stay at the Meridian
Summary: If you're looking for a cost-saving alternative to the hotels lined on Harbor Blvd, the BW Meridian Suites is a great choice. Located near the Orange Outlets, the hotel affords visitors a comfortable stay. It's not the most glamorous of places, but it's clean and the staff are very helpful.   I think the hotel does a fantastic job of being eco-conscious by providing dispensers instead of individual bottles of toiletries (shampoo, conditioner, lotion, et al). The hotel also provides guests with free filtered water (bring a bottle).   There isn't much around the hotel, except office buildings, but there is a (pay-to-ride) shuttle that will ferry passengers to Disneyland. Otherwise, if you have a car, it's only a ten minute drive from main attractions.   Breakfast is included with

Summary Heading: beautiful hotel we would definitely stay again
Summary: Stayed here May 2013  The room was great ,beautiful hotel  Staff were excellent and knowledgeable  The staff also helped us with our many questions concerning transportation and what was in walking distance.   perfect location near Disney and mall good place to stay Thanks, Best Western Plus Meridian Inn & Suites  we would definitely stay again

Was pleased with everything. Breakfast service and quality was outstanding. Pool area was very relaxing. Felt secure and not too far from Disneyland. Just wish the price I paid was a regular price, then I would book this hotel for all trips to Disneyland.

Good location. Rooms a little dirty and bathrooms a bit run down. One of the front desk staff was not very helpful and not customer oriented. Breakfast a bit poor quality, as expected for a BW. Will probably look for another location near Disney next time.

Summary Heading: Almost exactly the same as the guy below
Summary: Was going to write a comprehensive review but the bloke (Gary) wrote almost all that i was going to write so i will just add the differences  Paid $111 a night for a week. Lucky didnt' get mould.  Pro Large room (basically 2), kitchenette with microwave and sink (not all have this) Water cooler for hot or cold water on the 2nd floor Parking is very very very easy staff at the desk are good.  Good location  Con My last hotel stay a few weeks ago was at sydney park hyatt so this is pretty dated but I think for the price it is good enough.  Hot full american breakfast is ....... maybe because i ate the same thing for one week. There is scrambled eggs +/- cheese, sausage, Waffles. Thats it for hot options. (excluding beverage). Diluted juice (? cordial? not sure). Cereal with milk.

If you are used to Hiltons and Marriotts then this place is not for you. Pros - 2 room suite for price of a room - we paid 104.00 per night. Comes with a kitchenette ( we didn't use it but is convenient for families with kids).. Very quiet on 3rd floor. Free breakfast, wifi and no parking fees. Shower head with good water flow. TVs in both rooms, if you care.  Cons -  Rooms had that damp smell, perhaps due to lack of air circulation. Very noisy  when you turn on AC fan and using water in shower or sink. No natural light in the room unless you want to open windows only on front of the rooms  which are next to common walkways on every floor. Lastly biggest con is that we  found black mold around the bath tub area - done a poor job in cleaning it with  fresh caulking.

Stayed in a King Suite with jacuzzi tub. Very comfortable bed, jacuzzi is just the right thing after a full day of standing/walking.  Upscale furniture and upgrades, not your "grandmothers" decor.  High-end experience worth the extra $ over the typical motel 6 variety hotel, and a lot less $ than the hilton types charge. Location is 10 minutes to everything, but quiet except for the early morning Disney-drunk kids running down the halls for breakfast. Bring your own bath towels though, the hotel ones are very cheap and feel like sandpaper!  We would definitely stay again for park visit , concert, or antique shopping trip.

Summary Heading: A reminder of underwhelming best western standards.
Summary: Arrived at 9pm. Two people behind the counter- one of them eating (and continued to do so whilst we were checking in) and the other on the phone to a friend- morning reception staff were far more friendly. No bell service. Lift and corridors were jaded. Good room sizes and look recently refurbished. Short drive to a wide range facilities and although only hourly, a decent shuttle bus (public not hotel operated) to Disney. Big concern I had is over safety. Fire extinguisher in the laundry room last looked to have been inspected 9 years ago, and others in public areas had their 'annual' inspection over 18 months ago. Reasonable value for money given room sizes but pretty uninspiring, particularly given limited breakfast choices.

Stayed here November 2012 and November 2011 only stayed a couple days each time when we went to Disneyland.  Suites are large with separate bedroom and living room/kitchen.  Kitchen has microwave and small frig and free coffee and tea.  Room is clean and staff helpful.  Only problem was a couple pillows are too hard to sleep on(at least for my husband and me)but we always bring our own pillow anyway.  Would stay here again.

We stayed here for 5 days while visiting Disneyland and Los Angeles. The room was great.  Having a suite was perfect for our family of 4. The buffet each morning was nice and included eggs and waffles. We were on the 3rd floor and there was no noise from the rest of the hotel, although if you are on the pool side, it might be noisier. My only complaint was that the A/C unit was pretty noisy. There was a small locked closet in our suite that contained the unit, I assume and it was a little loud at night. There were a few small cracks in the bathroom tile, but nothing major.  Overall, a nice hotel, a great value, and I would definitely stay there again.

We stayed here for the NAMM show and it was our first visit to California. We showed up before the appropriate arrival time and they got us right into our room! So helpful, being that we were exhausted from a 6 hour flight. The staff also helped us with our many questions concerning transportation and what was in walking distance. So friendly and knowledgeable! Not to mention the room was very clean and enjoyable. Thanks, Best Western Plus Meridian Inn & Suites!

This hotel was perfect for staying in Anaheim and going to Disneyland. I went with my boyfriend this past weekend and it wasn't far from the park and it was a beautiful hotel as well. The price I think was nice for being relatively close to Disneyland. The staff was super friendly and accommodating. The only issue I had was the A/C that seemed to be broken, but it wasn't a huge issue since it wasn't too hot while we were down there.

This hotel is ideally located a short 5-10 min drive from Disneyland Resort (close enough for a convenient drive/shuttle to the park, but far enough away to not be bothered by the fireworks!). There is a beautiful courtyard in the center of the hotel, with a medium-sized pool and small hot tub. It's a nice place to eat the continental breakfast, or to relax in the afternoon when you can't take the craziness of Disneyland. The hotel is also close to a large shopping center, and there are several family-friendly eating establishments located closeby. The staff are very friendly and accommodating, and the rooms are of average size. My biggest complaint is that there is no microwave in the room and that the continental breakfast, though large enough, was a little one-note. It would

I took my two small grandsons to Disneyland and we stayed at this hotel for 3 nights.  The staff was very helpful - the suite was very nice and roomy, and the pool and the area around the pool was very nice and big.    We had a problem with the A/C in our room and I told the front desk.  They said they would gladly change our room - but we were leaving to go back to Disneyland.  The manager said she would oversee the move herself if we would like the staff to move our stuff!   When we returned - everything had been moved - exactly as it was in the other other room - things were hanging int he closet - our toiletries were on the sink, etc.    I would recommend this hotel to anyone staying in the area!  Including Disneyland trips!

Summary Heading: Great, just stay on the 3rd floor
Summary: Everything was great, employees were excellent, room was nice.  Just stay on the 3rd floor so you don't have to listen to kids jumping off the bed and running around the room above you. And if you do have kids CONTROL THEM!

I am giving this motel a rating of 4 based on the price. I paid no more than $70 per night (I can't remember exactly) so I wasn't expecting a 5 star experience.   We stayed here 4 nigths. There was a massive outdoor shopping centre just around the corner and we drove to heaps more places and shopped till we dropped!  The motel was old and dated but the service was good and I would stay here again because it was so cheap and a good location for what I wanted for the 4 nights we stayed here.

We traveled 300 miles that day and tried to check in but the front desk was not able to accomodate us until after 3:00 even after I explained we were in town for a very important medical appt. Grounds were very clean as was the room.

My husband and I have stayed at this hotel various times since July.  It is our preferred hotel to stay at.  It is a short 10 to 15 minute drive to Disneyland.  It's close enough to Disneyland, but still away from the hussle and bussle of the busy Disneyland area.  Our first stay at this hotel was in July, where we stayed 8 nights, I have nothing to complain about that stay or any other stay.  We were so happy with our stay in July, that when we look up hotels in that area for other trips, BW Meridian is the first that I check.  The beds are super comfortable, the rooms are clean and comfortable, parking is decent.  We usually arrive late in the evening, and it so happens that the same gentleman is there to check us in every time, and he is super nice and remembers us now.  The

Room, bed and laundry facilities were very good - breakfast was excellent! Front desk staff and breakfast staff were friendly and helpful - very nice! Only complaint was that the maid service did not clean or replace the cups and galsses on a daily basis and this was reported to the front desk on check-out who were surprised also. This would not stop us from staying here again as the rest made up for it.

Summary Heading: Dissappointing because probably could be better
Summary: Well okay so the hotel had a hot water problem day i arrived... so they couldn't provide the top floor requested.... was an odd choice to give a room facing the noisier street instead of the garden but decided to accept that as at first the room looked nice. Was a one bedroom suite. Again at first this seemed okay.  Despite the rather small bathroom and the oddities. This hotel does not seem to trust their guests much and even if this is with good reason as we shall see, it still doesn't make one feel at home. The kitchenette... no utincels or plates or anything are provided... as a matter of fact none of the drawers in the pictures can be used all are glued shut, so as not to have clean up after dirty guests i assume... makes the kitchen less welcoming though. Also the fridge..

Three of my friends and I were going to a concert at the Anaheim Convention Center and decided to stay here. We booked the 2 Queen Suite and as soon as we stepped in, we were at awe. I did not expect such high quality for the price. I was expecting it to be dingy but in fact it was very clean, the bed was comfortable, the entire room including the living room was spacious and during that cold winter night, the heater was a plus. The receptionist were really nice and I really have no complaints. The tv in the room was a bit fidgety, it randomly turned on in the middle of the night but other than that I would highly recommend this hotel.

Summary Heading: Horrible scam artists with smoking fee gross do NOT stay here
Summary: This place is a disgusting mess. The room is gross it reeked upon entering but that's what I expect out of a little  best western by Disneyland.  Little did I know as soon as we left these morons would try to blame the disgusting odor in the room on my family.  They said we smoked in the room but found no evidence they claim three people smelled it only so they can go along with best westerns policy. When the rude and arrogant manager lady called us accusing us of it we stated we'd pay it only if a police report was filed because I'm not going off some low budget hotels employees noses on what smoke smells like they hung up and said ok....to this day no report was ever filed (because nobody smoked in there) and they still tried to charge me! I've hired a lawyer and will take

Summary Heading: Clean,  good price,  quiet,  friendly,  and good breakfast.
Summary: My family and I stayed in a  two queen suite on our trip to Disneyland.   Beds were nice.  Two kids slept on the sleeper sofa and said even it was comfortable!  I felt like it was  a good deal for five  people.   The split room gave us some extra privacy.  The kids stayed up watching TV while my wife and I went to bed.  VERY clean and quiet.   Would stay there again.

Booked a great rate through Expedia.  King bed suite. Room was on the first floor, but very quiet. breakfast was fine. AC was odd as you had to use your room key to access controls. One other thing, the bathroom was in the King bedroom and not accessible from the living room so little inconvenient.. minor gripes really...Staff was very friendly and helpful...ten minutes from Disneyland, very convenient.. no issues with parking...overall excellent stay...would stay again

Our room smelled like throw up when we got there. I  alerted the staff and they sent someone to clean up the carpets. Later we come back to the room and it still smelled like throw up. So besides the smell the stay was fine

Summary Heading: One of the most pleasant stays!
Summary: We were just at your hotel for a six night stay and I missed it already :) I loved the fact that you had suites and that I was able to watch tv or work a little late at night while my family was resting in the other room. The beds were very, very comfortable and the service in your hotel was excellent. I thought it was one of the best stays in our trips to Disneyland. The convenient location right next to the 22 freeway was easy to access and leave each day. Walking distance to The Outlets at Orange was also a plus. Just a couple of hiccups... Since you have a kitchenette, some forks and knives could be handy even if they were plastic ones. The elevator could use some lube now... It was kind of noisy and during the day time it was ok but late at night you could really hear it.

I stayed at this hotel just like any other guest: because we want to go to Disneyland. I stayed for 2 nights with my family and overall we have an a-okay impression. Here's why  + Free parking is definitely a big plus + Free in-room wi-fi + Our rooms are very spacious with a living room and a kitchen, a separate room with two large queen size beds, and a bathroom with separate sink + Location is quite good. Close to Disneyland, close to many restaurants, shopping mall and factory outlets, and the highways.  However, here comes the downside: - Breakfast is just horrible. The whole place was a mess and dirty with only two staff in charge. To their credits, they were doing their best to serve us all. Food selection is abysmal and so was the drink selection. - The whole hotel is

I wanted badly to like this place, and there were several things done right- free parking, spacious suite with 2 queen beds, 2 flatscreen TVs, bathroom accessible from the bedrooms (so we could use it at night without disturbing the baby sleeping in the living area), night light at the sink. However, the cons, though few, were of the more grevious sort.  I believe a significant number of guests here were staying due to the proximity to Disneyland, as were we. So be prepared for excited footsteps stomping above your head at the crack of dawn, as well as late into the night. It was quite unbearable after a long day at the park! And especially since we were rudely awakened several times through the night by the aircon kicking in.   This is classified as a green hotel, and they have

Awesome stay. Wonderful accommodations. Nicest place I've stayed for quite some time. Spacious rooms, wonderful service. The free breakfast was satisfying for my whole family. We will definitely stay here again next time we're in Annaheim.

Our stay at the Meridian was always as expected-- service was great and the room was clean. The only thing that surprised me was how tiny our room was! I'm used to the suites with two queen beds and spacious room, so this room caught me by surprise, but no bad reviews about it. My stay at the Meridian was awesome which is why this is my go to hotel when I'm in Orange.

My husband booked us a king suite for a week's stay to visit friends and go to Disneyland. We had a nice stay.   There were two rooms. The main room was large with a couch, chair, tv, dining table, and one full wall of counter space and cabinets in the "kitchen" area. There was a refrig, microwave, and coffee maker there. The bedroom had a tv, king bed, chair, and a night stand on each side of the bed. The sink was outside of the bathroom, which is nice for getting ready. It also had plenty of closet space and an in-room safe.   Everything was clean and the linens were in good condition. The mattress was very comfortable for both myself and my husband. There were also plenty of pillows, which were also comfortable and nice.   The breakfast was good. Scrambled eggs with cheese,

The staff was very helpful. Once again Anna was very helpful. The housekeeping staff did very well. The additional help at breakfast made it easier. The choice of meats could be improved with the addition of crispy bacon say.

Good location, less than 10 minutes driving from Disney area. Reception team are helpful and there is a shuttle to Theme Parks. The room cleanliness could be better and WiFi signal which is suposed to be available for the whole hotel were not available in my room. To use the internet you must good to hall. Breakfast avaliable but could be better.

We booked the two bedroom suite on Expedia for a mid week stay to visit Disneyland. The check in staff were efficient and very helpful for recommendations for dining options. Our room was clean and spacious with a separate bedroom area with two queens and a large sitting room/dining area with a kitchenette. The bathroom was clean however the tiles became very slippery when wet. Wifi, parking and a basic breakfast was included in the cost. The hotel also has laundry facilities, a pool (which is very cold) and a spa. There was a large shopping centre nearby. We chose the hotel for the inclusions and the short drive to Disney. I would recommend it if you intend to have a car when you are in Anaheim as it is not walking distance to food/shopping/disney and I wouldn't like to rely on

The room where we stayed smelled with mold really badly, the bed sheets were rough, the carpet was old (the source of the smell), needs to be renovated. The front door was covered by fingerprints.  2222

Bedroom in suite is nice but living room, bathroom and kitchen are old and neglected. Internet sucks.  3 of the female front desk clerks are rude. Male front desk clerks are nice. Manager is nice. Elevator, hallways, breakfast area are old, dirty and neglected.  No one likes to answer the phone at night, even when you call 10x.  Afternoon front desk clerks are rude, useless and hopeless.  Beakfast cook and attendant is friendly.  Security lock for hotel room sticks out and could poke your face or eyes. It doesn't go all the way to the left and against the wall when not in use. Not worth the price and it's not even that cheap. Never again!!!!

I'm a bit late with my review, but wanted to make sure I put one up on this property.We were here on a family trip to go to Disneyland and take in other activities for 11 nights. We wanted to stay somewhere that was reasonably close to Disneyland and in a nice area. After reviewing reviews online and pricing out different hotels, we felt this was the one. Well, we were very happy with our choice. The rooms were clean, quiet, and updated. We liked that there was a small kitchentte area with a mini fridge, microwave, and a sink. The king bed and pillows were very comfortable. The in-room safe fits a laptop and a bit more. Free Wi-Fi. The pool and hot tub were good. We were there in March so we found it a bit chilly on most days to go in the pool but the hot tub was great,

I stayed over at the hotel on a Friday-Saturday night. I was staying for relaxation. I expected the hotel to be a decent hotel. I suppose I needed to define "decent" in my own mind.   All of the rooms are along outside hallways, with only the first of the three floors being "closed in" with key activated doors. The upper two floors have outdoor hallways. It gives the entire hotel a very motel feel.   I stayed in a two queen suite. There were two rooms, a living room/dining room combo. The living room had a sofa, a matching chair, a small dining table, a TV, a microwave, a sink, a coffee maker and a small fridge. It was a spacious area, perhaps 10x14. The bedroom had two very comfortable queen sized beds with soft linens, a TV mounted in the corner, double doors that closed the

We will return to this Best Western!  The staff was very helpful and the suites were awesome!  Imagine traveling with kids and having a bedroom with a door that shuts when they are asleep, a living room and adjoining kitchen.  It was a great find!

I have been reading some very different reviews We stayed at this hotel from Monday-Friday in late October. We had the top floor on he back side i believe #314. the bed was sooo comfortable!!!  The room was clean, bathroom and shower area also. However the shower curtain, it was a cloth material so it would get wet while you were showering. We could hear the air conditioner units making noises, and some plumbing noises as well, but not enough to drive you crazy, with the T.V you dont hear much. We had a good variety of places to eat at, the mall was very close if we needed to kill time, or buy a few things. We had a 5 min drive to Disneyland. We only used our hotel room to shower and sleep. For the price i paid for 5 days was worth every penny. The staff was helpful, very

We stayed at the Best Western Meridian Inn for a family trip to Disneyland.  We chose this hotel because it had a pool for the kids, a free breakfast, and a shuttle to Disneyland, all of which were disappointing.  The two-room suites were satisfactory, but everything about the breakfast was sub-par.  The shuttle to Disneyland was a city bus that only ran once an hour, so it was not convenient to come and go during the day The biggest disappointment was the pool.  It was too cold for warm-blooded creatures, and the hot tub was too hot for anything but a lobster.  The equipment in the fitness room was in need of repair.  On the positive side, the staff at the front desk were friendly and helpful, and the price was was good.  On the whole, though, I think we'll stay closer to the

I arrived today at the hotel and I found out that I had a double reservation (5 rooms for 4 nights) The staff was very friendly and they helped me to delete the surplus one. The room is big and very comfortable. The nearby freeway make the movements very easy and it's far enough for not hearing the noise.

Summary Heading: Rooms are great, customer service not so much
Summary: The room itself has a nice layout and was very clean. The hotel is also a nice distance from Disneyland, parking isn't an issue, and there is a nice courtyard area to relax in. They do have a free breakfast but unless you're a big fan of either cereal or toast, it leaves a lot to be desired as the eggs are very runny, the sausage is sitting in water and neither of the serving dishes were covered which concerned me from a sanitation perspective. The hotel staff is not helpful and even answered a phone call while we were in the middle of a conversation. Stay for the room, not the food or the service and you're fine.

Summary Heading: Nice, quiet location close to Disneyland
Summary: We enjoyed our stay in room, I believe it was room  #121, a corner room on the first level, a king suite.  The bed was comfortable, much more so than some.  Weird pillows though, we had six and we were able to make up the combo to our liking.  The shower was very powerful, the most water pressure I have ever seen outside of a waterpark!  The mini kitchen was convenient but did not come with anything like plates, pans, kitchen towels, dish soap silverware, etc.  If you plan on using it bring your own.  The housekeeping was good a little slow a couple of days when we decided to rest in the afternoon before going back to the park they hadn't cleaned but they were very good.  Breakfast was better than most but nothing special.  The gentleman that cooked the eggs and sausage and

We had initially planned on a 3 night stay but decided to extend it one more night. The manager on hand made sure that we got the best rate possible, as well as made sure we did not have to move rooms once the initial 3 night stay was over. The rooms themselves were really roomy. There was 3 of us in the king suite and it was more then enough room. The bed was nice and comfortable. Breakfast was much better then other hotels we have stayed at on Harbor. This hotel in no way a 5 star hotel, but for 80 dollars a night, plus free breakfast, parking, wifi, it was a tremendous bargain. Keep in mind that if you stay here for Disneyland, you will have to drive about 2-3 miles to get to the parking structure.

Lovely 1 bedroom suite with a kitchen, although it had no utensils so a bit pointless! Had asked for a top floor room but the air con units were obviously up there and made a terrible noise. We moved to a lower level the next day but the plumbing noise when another room used their toilet or shower was unbelievable. It was like an aircraft taking off in your bathroom. Unfortunately we had someone near us showering at 12.15am and then someone else at 6.15am so we couldn't have a decent night's sleep.  If another room decided to flush the toilet at night it also made a dreadful noise in your own bathroom.  The breakfast was ok and there are tables in the courtyard so you eat outside which is nice.  The pool wasn't huge but didn't seem to get busy. About 4 miles from Disney and

Summary Heading: Room was spacious, Bed was definitely comfortable...never slept so well ever in a hotel.
Summary: When I first walked it the room I was quite surprised at the size of the room and that we had two TV's , it was so spacious and also had a kichenette. We really enjoyed our stay at this hotel. The room was nice and clean and the bed was so comfortable, I usually don's sleep well when I'm away from my home. The only thing is that the room lacked lighting.  Breakfast was ok as expected. Staff was really nice and helpful. I would definitely stay at this hotel again and recommend it to family and friends.

Stayed here from Sept. 29 to Oct. 6 and had a wonderful stay right from check-in to check-out.  The rooms were large and spacious and it was great to have the separation from the bedroom and living room.  We ate the breakfast and it was to be expected.  Nothing spectacular, but substance for the day.    The pool was clean and cold, which was great considering it was over 100 degrees while we were there.  The courtyard is kept clean and it was basically empty after 4pm every night.    My only complaint was with the TV's.  We would turn on either TV and then 5 or 10 minutes later, the other TV would turn on by itself.  We eventually unplugged one of the TV's to stop this from happening.    Other than that it was a great hotel at a fantastic price.  We would definitely stay here

We stayed here from June 30th - July 7th for our family vacaction!  I was very pleased with the suite and the staff was very pleasant and helpful.  They have a shuttle at this hotel that takes you to various stops from disneyland to the convention center and so on so it was very nice not to have to drive everywhere!  I would definely stay here again :)

Summary Heading: It was better than I expected
Summary: We stayed here for 4 days/3 nights and enjoyed the hospitality. We did have an issue with the air conditioning and notified the front desk. They immediately acted on this and because they couldn't sort out or find the problem, the quickly found a replacement room for me and my wife.   The room was pretty tidy. The king size bed was comfortable, the bathroom was decent size and the main lounge had adequate space.  Unfortunately we didn't use the pool or the spa but it looked clean. They have an on site laundry which was good and a convenience. The front desk kindly exchange our notes for quarters which was nice as we didn't carry coins with us.  The breakfast was ok. Nothing fancy. Just good to have something decent in the morning before starting the day. They offer scrambled

Lovely suite with bedroom and separate lounge/kitchen area although the kitchen has no utensils or cooking equipment whatsoever! The issue we had was the plumbing of the surrounding rooms.  If someone flushed their toilet in the night it was very noisy and the shower was unbelievable.  It was like a plane taking off.  Unfortunately for us someone decided to shower late at night (12.15am) and then someone else showered at 6.15 the following morning.  Not what you want on holiday. If you are a heavy sleeper it probably won't bother you but it ruined my stay as every night was the same. We also left an ipod when we checked out.  I did e-mail but it had 'disappeared'. Disappointing but to be expected I guess.

Decided I would take the kids to Disney for the weekend. This is a really nice hotel with decent rates. The thing I love most about the hotel is that I got a suite and it had two separate rooms. The room also had to separate flat screens so the kids could watch their shows and we could watch ours.The kids loved swimming in the pool and they do have a really nice open courtyard where I was able to relax and still watch the kids. Breakfast in the morning was good. One night we walked (5-6 blocks) to The Block of Orange which is an outdoor mall for dinner and the shopping. Overall a good get away and a good hotel!

I was on a business trip but took the opportunity to take my kids for a weekend Disneyland run; a farewell to summer vacation.  Hotel has great setup for family: very large & clean room and friend staffs.    OMG, to top everything else are large flat screen TVs, not just one, TWO!! Kids can watch in bedroom while I enjoy my own programs in the living room.  One in bedroom and one in living room.  Room has nice decor, very warm and inviting. Disneyland was easily reached with regularly scheduled shuttle.  Over all, it's a great place to be for family visiting Disneyland.

Summary Heading: Interesting location with a slightly odd feel.
Summary: I am from the area and have driven past this building for years with no idea that it was a hotel. My sister was getting married at a church nearby so I chose this hotel for its convienent location to the wedding. The building itself is 3 story open air brick building surrounded by other brick office buildings which makes it seem like its just another office building in the business park. Upon check in there was no valet or bellmen even though it looked like it was set for that kind of service. The lobby smelled like monkey's and dirty bar mats. The front desk service was OK. If you check in with a debit card they hit you with a $250 pre auth, which is high, and they make you sign a waiver saying that if you throw a party in the room they will charge $300 and if you smoke $250.

We stayed here over labor day weekend for the Disneyland Half Marathon. We stayed here last year too & I must say that this year's room was an improvement. It was large with spacious living room area & sufficient kitchen space. Bedroom had large flat screen mounted in the corner which was a nice touch. Breakfast was ok. The usual plus waffles. Pool/Jacuzzi area was also good. We found 1 dead roach in the room, however, I wouldn't make a big deal of it because it was dead & I realize sometimes they will get in. What I will say is it was there the first night AND the next day when we returned to the room. I thought for sure the maid's vacuum would take care of it, but not a chance, proving only the the rooms are not cleaned very well. So all in all a nice place to stay but could

Summary Heading: Very nice place for your disneyland vacation
Summary: This is a very nice hotel with decent rates.  the outside of the building looks like an office building, but don't let that fool you.  This hotel has a very nice inner court yard that has a pool and out door tables.   The breakfast was excellent.  The breakfast host/hostess were some of the nicest people.  We did have to wait an extra hour to get into our room which was a little annoying, but the remainder of our trip was excellent.  The beds were very comfortable and the 2 room king suite was great.  We are going to stay here again in a couple months when we visit disneyland again.

Summary Heading: I think the 'Plus' means plus cockroaches
Summary: We booked this hotel due to the kitchen and it's proximity to Disneyland.   After 2 days, we found cockroaches in our room. They were crawling under the fridge and up the walls. After freaking out, the front desk attendant showed up at my door to move us to another room. I declined his assistance, because it's not that easy to pack up kids and all your stuff to move to another room in 10 minutes, not to mention the fact that I wasn't sure I wanted to stay after seeing roaches. He managed to catch one and take it away.   I was assured by the front desk that these roaches were different. Similar to flies, they came in when it gets hot. I took this as a plausible explanation, and was happy with the room they moved us to.   We stayed here for several more days, never seeing roaches,
Manager Response: Dear Valued Guest,  Thank you for your review and  for taking the time to share your feedback with us. On behalf of our team, I would like to apologize for any inconvenience that may have occurred during your stay. We also would like to assure you that we are aware of the problem and  have been working very closely with the City of Orange to make sure this problem is eliminated; our findings showed that those are an outdoor flying insect called the American Cockroaches. They can fly or crawl into an indoor area to get out of the heat and or the dry weather.  ( for more information please follow the link below) http://sandbox.orkin.com/cockroaches/american-cockroach_new/   We really appreciate having you as one of our guests and we understand that you took time out of your busy day to post this review to help us improve. We sincerely  hope that you will accept our apology and consider staying with us again in the future so that we can have another chance to provide you with a great experience.   Thank you, Rania

Summary: Stayed here for ten nights whilst visiting the LA area/ disney. It was in a convenient location with shops and restaurants close by. Staff were all very friendly and willing to help. We stayed in a king sized room which was a great size and the bed was very very comfortable!!! We were on the ground floor and didn't have any bugs or creatures in our room during our whole stay. Pool area/ courtyard was lovely and we enjoyed eating breakfast (breakfast was ok!) there each morning. Good value for money and would stay there again!!!! After staying here we stayed in Caesars Palace in Las Vegas and much preferred the bed in the best western!

Stayed at the Best Western Meridien last night and can't say enough about the size of the suites, the friendly staff and the great breakfast in the morning. We have stayed in Anaheim in the past, but this hotel is definitley one we'll be going back to as it is much better value than other hotels in the area that we have tried.Also, very close to the City shopping mall with some great restaurants to choose from.

Hi we stayed at this hotel in the largest suite they had and it was well worth it it could stand some up grades but our overall experience was great the staff was very helpful and friendly we stayed there two nights the first week in Aug this year. Thankfully we didn't experience bugs like some of the other reviewers stated. The young ladies up front was very helpful they were really nice. And for the price you get a really good deal I myself have stayed in 5 star resorts and hotels and this room was a lot larger and way cheaper. Yes the hotel does need some renovating but for what u pay in OC this is a great deal!

Summary Heading: MUCH LESS THAN AVERAGE, AND YES, ROACHES!!
Summary: I agree with Rick_Mc2 “Average”, but I am downgrading it to “Much Less Than Average”.  We stayed here August 11 – 16.  We have family in the area and needed a place to stay for a visit with children, and grandchildren who turned 4.    The hotel is badly in need of renovation and an exterminator.  Things feel and look dirty; rooms are on the darker side.  The paint in our bathroom (218) was chipped and in general, everything looks very tired.  Housekeeping kept propping a worn couch-type pillow on our bed after making it and I kept throwing it back into the living room.  Gross.  I don’t want the 1,000+ heads who have lain on the pillow previously touching the pillows I sleep on.  Other hotels do the pillow thing and it doesn’t bother me but this place does not feel clean.

Summary: We stayed for a week early August 2012. They say that they renovated the property, simply put new paint does not equal a renovation.  They also claim to be "Eco", I think that it's just code for cheap in there case, the a/c turns off when you leave the suite, and house keeping, resets the controls everyday to 74, and no a/c to speak of in lobby & elevator. No recycling bin in room, had to toss empty beer and wine.  But pool was nice and staff are friendly and helpful.

I booked this hotel based on the tripadvisor rating and was sadly disappointed.  I cannot understand the good reviews.  Felt more like a motel than a hotel.  The room was clean, but very basic.  While the bedding looked attractive, it was rough and uncomfortable.  We checked out early after our first night when the cockroaches came out to play.  The hotel offered to move us, but didn't have any other rooms available (not that I would have stayed).  They did refund the portion of our stay we didn't use, but a full refund would have been more appropriate.  When we left, we checked into a Sheraton closer to Disney and it was worth every penny.  A world of difference.

Summary: Stayed here from August 4-11. It is only 3 floors and has a pool, jacuzzi, daily complimentary breakfast, vending machines, 2 laundry rooms and a small workout room. You can take the stairs or there is an elevator. Parking is free and there was always enough even when we would get back at 12pm or 1am from being out and about. I would definitely stay here again. It is a little ways off the I-5 and there is a big outlet mall right down the street. Disneyland was only about 12-15 minutes away.  Rooms were cleaned daily, got fresh towels and they already supply some basic body wash, shampoo, conditioner, and soap in dispensers. You can ask for some things at the front desk for free that we didn't realize like razors, toothbrush, toothpaste...The complimentary breakfast consisted of

Summary Heading: Liked it so much we are coming back!
Summary: We stayed here last September with our Grandson on our annual Disneyland pilgrammage and had a GREAT time. It is far enough away from the hubbub of Harbor and Katella that you can still get an early nights sleep yet near enough that you are only 10 minutes from everything.  The breakfast is not IHOP but there is variety and it is certainly filling. The beds are comfortable and the rooms are large. See you in October!

Summary Heading: Average hotel but breakfast needs improvement!
Summary: This hotel is in a very convenient location. Close to main highway and a shopping outlet is just a block away. It has a very nice courtyard and a pool. The staff at the reception are polite. The suite room is spacious and clean and I particularly like the seperate vanity. However, the air conditioner in the room is too noisy which luckily I got used to it after one night but my husband was very annoyed by the noise all thru our stay of 5 nights. The shower was also loud enough to wake me up every morning when my husband turn it on while I was still in bed . Our major complaint is the breakfast food, although I know they are free but is simply not up to Best Western standard. They are like the food we get at some Motels. The orange juice, the coffee, the scrambled eggs(not real

Summary Heading: Good location for Disneyland and the beaches
Summary: Nice location only 9 minutes to the Disneyland parking garage during rush hour traffic and walking distance to the outlet mall with 20 places to eat, my fav was TGI Friday. The hotel has a full breakfast so that saves $ 9 a day and means you save time in the morning. Nice pool and spa for relaxing and a courtyard to enjoy the Southern California weather.

Recently we did stay at the BEST WESTERN Plus Meridian Inn & Suites, Anaheim-Orange California 3 nights in 3 different rooms . The hotel staffs keep moving us along the hall way every day for same reason. Roach !  They came out  from the kictchen, the bath room, in the closet and any where any time made us can not help but have to think: We paid more than $500.00 to sleep in the best roach hotel. Some how we feel sorry for room service ladies . They did all the best they could to move us ahead of those sick creatures. But seem like they are every where .

We sincerely  hope that you will accept our apology and consider staying with us again in the future so that we can have another chance to provide you with a great experience.   Thank you, Rania

Summary: We were looking for a hotel that's close to Disneyland and this hotel met up to our budget and requirements both. It is just a mile away from Disneyland...the rooms are spacious with a separate living dining and bedroom. It also has a small kitchenette with sink which is very useful while travelling with young children...washing bottles and all. The bathroom had all the amenities and was very good. The pool was also good for the children. They also have shuttle that goes every 15 minutes to Disneyland which is also very convenient. We were there for a total 3 nights and it was a pleasant stay. It would certainly suggest this hotel to people coming to California especially to visit Disneyland.
