A great all suite property close to Disney which could be spectacular if they would clean the common areas once in a while.

Depending on what you are looking for this was a wonderful place to stay. We had a 2 room suite, kitchenette with dining table/chairs, livingroom, and king bedroom suite with the most comfortable bed. TV's in every room! the guys were in heaven. Breakfast provided and eating by the fountain and pool began our days. Awesome. Laundry facilities and work out by the pool. It's  clean and comfortable. We had 6 additional family members come over for pizza, salad, speghetti and pop which by the way was all of $27. through the book provided at the front desk of places that will deliver. Yes, we went to Disneyland, Universal, Sea World and the outlet mall just down the road which includes Nieman Marcus, Nordstroms, Sacs 5th Ave and a theater for the guys while the girls shop. We had a

Ok here goes, we just got back from a week long stay at this hotel.  Price wise it was not too bad.  954 for 7 days and 6 nights.  The building is definitely dated.  We arrived at 8pm and check was quick and easy.  We have to quickly drop off our bags as we wanted to grab a bite before we pick our friend at LAX.  When we opened the door, there was a weird smell inside (it smelled like a wet towel that you forgot to get out of your bag for days).  We didn't have time to complain as we were in a hurry to leave.  Wifi is a joke!  Our first night there, it was sooooooooo slow.  11 pm rolls in and we lost internet connection, ok too late to complain we went to bed.  The next day we asked them to check the odour and they gave us an air freshener and that's it.  Second night, the wifi

Stayed here while in the Past doing a So. Cal. vacation including = Disneyland, Univeral Studios and Catalina Island  and enjoyed it then.  Stayed at again this Past Jun 2012 while doing a Disney and Magic Mountain vacation and Enjoyed it as well, especially the Kids!  We like the roominess of the suites and how there is a door to divide the 2 ares as well. Love the Pool and the Breakfast at this establishment!  The Staff is very nice and is Perfect distance from everything L.A.. . Also visited "The Block" mall just down the street.  Will definetly stay here in the Future!

My wife and I stayed for 4 nights in July 2012.  Had a great rate $75, incl. tax per night.  The hotel is away from freeway noise, has a landscaped courtyard for free breakfast and entertaining, as well as a heated pool and jacuzzi.  The hotel has been recently remodeled and it was clean & comfortable.  Hotel staff were friendly and accommodating.  The only negative was the breakfast. The hotel is not set up for the number of people attempting to dine and they often ran out of breakfast items.  All in all, I would stay again, especially at that price.

Having just returned from our vacation, here is my take on this hotel (while it is still fresh in my memory).   The GOOD:  For those looking for a slightly less expensive place that isn't right across the street from Disneyland and all the hustle and bustle that goes along with that, this is conveniently located on ART line #16 (with a city transit stop also available right around the corner) and approx 3 blocks from the Outlets at Orange where you can find everything from Old Navy to Neiman Marcus in addition to several restaurants.    Compared to most hotels we have stayed at, the rooms here are very large. We happened to stay in a King Suite with separate bdrm, living room and kitchenette with table and chairs.  The NOT SO GOOD:  While this hotel claims to be "newly

Very bad customer service. This hotel wants to put a 250.00 hold on your credit card. The front desk staff were ridiculously rude, I would NEVER stay here again. Let me repeat that, NEVER!    Very disappointed in the overall cleanliness of the property. I don't understand all the reviews that rave about the condition of the rooms. The place is not that great.

Pros: Initial check-in Isabel at front desk efficient, pleasant and great at multi-tasking!  Have had breakfast once at 8 am & there were eggs, toast, waffles, fruit, cereal, muffins, bagels and more.  Room clean and very spacious!  King sized bed, sofa bed, two oversized chairs, desk with two chairs, in room safe, mic, mini fridge, two alarm clocks, and much more! A/C works terrific!! Showerhead very large and water pressure awesome!! In room 308 great to see Disneyland fireworks at night and very quiet as well!! CONS: Unfortunately, it is a very very BIG pain to get anything no matter how trivial the request!! This applies to both staff and management. The first night we needed an extra pillow b/c there are four of us in the room (on the second day we were told they "sold out

We've stayed at 5 different hotels while visiting Disneyland over the years. NONE of them would I ever go back to. Until I found Best Western Meridian Inn & Suites. I did book early so the price was amazing (lowest price i've paid for ANY Anaheim/Orange hotel!), I thought because it was so cheap, it was going to be one of those "it's just a place to sleep, nothing more, nothing less.." places.. FAR FROM IT! First, I absolutely LOVE the courtyard. How relaxing. Check-in was super easy, we were lucky enough to get a 3rd floor inside king room. PERFECT for our needs! Oh my gosh, the bed! We didnt want to get out of bed in the morning, it is SO comfy! The breakfast was an added bonus-it was the same items every day, but you dont have to eat the same thing everyday. Eggs & Sausage

We had a trip to anahiem for Disneyland. It is a very good location, it is quite, in a good neighboorhood, close to resturants and Orange outlet mall. I loved the location of it, and the feel of it. It had a fresh and relaxing feeling to it. Only like 5-10 min from Disneyland. The rooms are spacious, the little kitchen area is nice also. We also got discounted Disneyland tickets. The front desk attendants were very helpful and they had great customer service skills. The pool is decent and we really loved the courtyard. They let you have breakfast out there in the morning and it is just the perfect setting for a cool and relaxing morning. The breakfast was decent, a lot of different choices of cereals, pastries and drinks. They also served eggs, sausage, waffles, toast, yogart

Found 6 cockroaches in less than 24 hours. Management moved us into a new room but was extremely rude with the experience and even questioned the validity of our explanation. Did receive a full refund and moved to a new hotel as we were clearly unwanted guests and were no longer comfortable staying there.  Breakfast was sub-par. No one was cleaning up or replenishing food during the breakfast hours. Fairly certain the yogurt was sour.  2 room suite was great though for a family with an infant like us. Bed was very comfortable.

Summary Heading: Great suites...perfect for families...had a wonderful week here!
Summary: We booked a two-queen suite for our week at Disneyland. We loved it here! There was plenty of space for our family of four with the bedroom separate from the sitting area (french doors close between the two rooms). There is also a kitchenette with a small microwave, dorm-size refrigerator, sink, and storage cabinets. There are two televisions, a table with chairs, a sofa sleeper, coffee table, and comfortable arm chair....like I said, plenty of space! The beds are very confortable! We are night owls and closed the parks down most nights (back to the hotel after midnight) so it was a bit difficult to make it to breakfast each morning. We bought cereal, milk, and fruit for the mornings we didn't manage to get up on time (breakfast runs only until 9:30am on weekdays, 10:00am on

This is the Best 'Best Western Inn' that I have been in. We paid about $108 a night for 3 nights through hotels.com or travelocity.com. I have two kids (1 1/2 & 4) and its perfect for our little big family. We got a suite which comes with 2 rooms. The two queen beds and bathroom are separate by a door and we also got a full kitchen and a couch and another TV on the other. Very close to the freeway, The Block, restaurants and about 5 minutes away from DISNEYLAND. The room is pretty clean with minor touchup needed. Also free parking and wi-fi. My family and I were pretty satisfied and I'd definitely would stay again.

My family and I stayed at this hotel from June 12th to the 20th.  I was very excited to find a hotel outside of the resort area with all the amenities we needed to make our stay comfortable; a suite with two televisions and a kitchen with dining space that would make us all feel at home and like we could stretch out after a long day at the park. The free parking, breakfast and internet were all a plus and the room was beautifully painted, with nice curtains and the most comfortable beds and pillows I have ever slept on away from home. It was also nice to come back and have the beds nicely made every day.  Unfortunately, the happy vibes stop there. The breakfast, which was more for my husband than myself, was inedible. Odd tasting and hard round mini waffles and grocery store

The Meridian Inn and Suites worked well for us.  It is conveniently located off 22 and the Block outlet shopping center.  We stayed in a King suite. There is aTV in the bedroom and sitting area.  The was a mini-kitchen with a mini fridge, micro wave, sink, counters and coffee maker.  There is a desks with 2 chairs, couch and matching chair.  The couch contains a pull out bed.  The room was clean and quiet.  The inn is set up with card key access doors on the ground floor, except the lobby which is open.  This provides an added level of security since you need a key to get into the halls for room door access.  There are 3 floors, multiple stairways and an elevator.  There was guest laundry, pool, hot tub/jacuzzi.  The breakfast area was always crowded.  They ran low on food many

Very nice room, comfy bed, clean. Bathroom needs updating, though. Internet worked well. Really close to shopping and Disney. Breakfast was nice. All in all, we`ld go back if we were ever in the area :)
The front desk people were very helpful. Overall I had a great experience and I enjoyed my vacation over there.

Stayed 5 nights and chose this hotel due to the two-room suite with fridge, free parking and included breakfast for under $100/night  Very quiet on top room floor facing parking lot. Breakfast was AOK but we grew tired of the same thing (cereal, scrambled eggs, waffles, toast) by day 3. We supplemented by buying fruit, peanut butter and yogurt from Target.  5 minute drive from Angel Stadium and small outlet shopping. Less than 10 minutes to Disney and Target.  Wish there were more restaurants within walking distance so my husband could have a couple beers (he was our designated driver at all times).  Part of our group went on a bus sightseeing trip of LA and the shuttle picked them up right at the the hotel. I think Starline was the carrier.    I wish there was an oudoor balcony

I like to stay in a hotel that is clean and convenient.  This hotel was very nice ... newly remodeled so everything is fresh.  Nice pool and spa area.  A courtyard which was beautiful so you could enjoy your continental breakfast out by a waterfall.  Would have been thrilled if the coffee area had more choices ... such as liquid cream for my coffee and real splenda !!!  I am a coffee lover and to enjoy a cup of coffee in the morning is a must.  The front desk staff is wonderful ... very helpful ... kudos to Isabel and Maria (who helped us navigate our way to the best beaches !!).  I would definitely stay here again ... except I would request a room on the third floor so that I would not hear the people above us walking ALL NIGHT LONG !!!

Summary Heading: Don't fall for the free breakfast
Summary: We spent 6 nights here while visiting Disneyland in April 2012. We had chosen this hotel because it included breakfast and free parking. The pictures seemed nice, the reviews were good and the price was excellent for everything that was included. The room was clean, but it smelled like old cigarrette smoke and the kitchenette area was very dated. The breakfast was so boring that we ended up not eating there for half of our stay. Although I was not expecting a great selection, I was hoping the quality of the breakfast would have been better than what it was. For those of you choosing this hotel because of the free breakfast and parking and the cheap rate, I highly recommend you to skip the free breakfast option and pay a bit more for another hotel.

stayed in king suite first floor, pool right outside door.  clean, friendly and very helpful staff.  free breakfast and it had variety.  was able to smoke in smoking areas outside of room.  place to sit a beautiful court yard.  noise from pool open till 10 but understandable.  people just having fun.  service was great and room was terrific.  bad side only 1 bathroom in bedroom area but can understand this as well.  room was large, clean and everyone went out of their way to help.  had computer near check-in and was able to print out e-ticket for flight out.  near everything you should need.

We spent 5 night here while visiting Disney and LA, and were pleasantly surprised.  The suite was roomy, beds comfortable, and it was nice to have the kitchen to fix a late night snack in after returning from Disney.  The breakfast was very good and the fellow who made the mini waffles was super.  The grounds and pool area were lovely and well kept.  Overall, a nice place to stay in a quiet area and only 10 minutes from the parks.  The location is convenient to the freeways and shopping areas.  The front desk staff were always helpful and cheerful no matter when you came in at night!

Summary Heading: Great Customer Service *** Stellar Accommodations for $$
Summary: We had to be in the Santa Ana Court and it is SUPER convenient to that location with a 8 min door to door commute. The suites are clean, perfect with separation from the living room/workspace and the bedroom for optimum productivity. Also, my biggest and best compliment has to go to the AMAZING STAFF, Maria, Isabelle, Ana, and Rania for your INCREDIBLE flexibility, patience and “can do” attitude with helping me at every turn. I have never needed a staff at a hotel for so many things and they were always happy to help and I was a crazy mess! Thank You Thank You Thank You!! Also, great price for the location and a suite!! I will definitely be back!

Summary Heading: Pretty good for visiting Disney Land
Summary: The suite we got was medium.  Our kids loved the late afternoon swims.  Breakfast was average.  The old gentleman serving there was very nice. Good price

If you are visiting Disneyland and have access to a car, I would highly recommend staying at this hotel rather than closer to Disneyland. The hotel is only about a 7 minute drive from Disneyland, but it is much quieter and removed from the mobs that are around the parks. We have stayed here twice in the past 2 months and received only courteous service both times. They serve a hot breakfast each morning that includes freshly made waffles, fluffy scrambled eggs and sausage links, along with the standard continental breakfast fare you receive at most hotels. The breakfast fills you up for a morning at Disneyland and is a money saver. You also have to pay an extra parking fee at a lot of the hotels near Disneyland that you don't pay here. The biggest plus for my family (we have a

This year we bought annual passes to Disneyland and we have stayed at Meridian on 4 of our last 11 trips this year.  To be quite honest, I have promised never to return 3 times because the manager and I can't seem to get along, but the fact of the matter is that there is no better hotel in the Anaheim area for the price.  We have tried staying in 3 other Best Westerns and a  few Hilton properties in the area and we keep coming back to Meridian because the rooms and amenities are unbeatable at this price point.  We have 2 small kids and lots of gear, so space is very important to us.  We also love having 2 rooms and 2 TV's so that we can all unwind in our own space in the evening and we don't bother the kids when they are asleep (We got a Kids Suite at Raffles once and the

We stayed at the hotel for six nights right after Easter. I have read many reviews of the hotel prior to my selection and was quite surprised that many of our experiences did not match the positive experiences highlighted in others' reviews. First of all, the check in girl was border line rude. She reluctantly answered our questions with that underlying hint of attitude of "How many more people are going to ask me this?". To be perfectly fair there was another male desk attendant in the evening who was much more friendly and accommodating.  Our room did not face the courtyard and was quite dark, as the front window faced an interior corridor of the hotel. If you are at all claustrophobic, request a room facing the courtyard. The room was somewhat dated, but very functional.

Summary Heading: Spend the extra $$ and stay somewhere else
Summary: I normally would not have stayed at a Best Western Plus but this was a quick family get away to Disneyland and the location was great and knowing what we'd be spending at Disney and then in Huntington Beach, shopping, figure I'd spend the $120 per night plus all the reviews were good on Trip Advisor. Our visit starts by an unfriendly agent at Check in. What happened to a warm welcome and a smiling face? She was not helpful, curt, not even a hello, welcome, instead it was " last name?". The room was a king bed suite, very outdated, the bathroom is ridiculously small, You could barely move. We walked into the room and I was very conscientious of the room since they have so many rules and additional items you have to initial when you check in. There was water all over the bathroom

From the reviews I was expecting a much nicer place. What I liked; the beds were comfortable, they had a nice courtyard with a heating swimming pool and hot tub. The area around the hotel was quiet (office buildings).   What I didn't like - our room was very small and dated (but it was clean), breakfast didn't have a great selection and was over at 9:00 or 9:30? I know we missed it the one day we decided to go to Disney a little later. The shuttle takes half an hour to drive the three miles to Disney ... even the drivers complained about how they 'have' to take a long way there.  Be careful if you buy shuttle tickets at the front desk, we were buying them every day and then noticed a sign where we could have purchased one for several days and saved money - it would have been

Summary Heading: Enjoyed our stay... worth the price
Summary: First of all, I commend the staff for making our stay as enjoyable and relaxing. Very courteous, available and responsive to our needs. We requested for another room without any problem. For the price, this hotel exceeded our expectations. The free internet access was A+. Close to the The Block at Orange was certainly a plus. The TVs were fine and they are very watchable despite somebody else's opinion. The beds were indeed delightful. My wife definitely loved the restful sleep she needed (better than at home..he! he!). The free breakfast was a lot better than most comparatively expensive hotels, except that the variety on a daily basis was negligible (we stayed for 3 nights--the same for our entire stay). However, this did not make our stay unpleasurable. With regards to
I love the it! So clean and the rooms are so big It is more like a studio! I could put my kids to sleep and watch tv in the other room! I will sure came back!

Excellent hotel in good location for the Angels stadium, orange shopping outlet, transport, Disney, and all transport. Staff were very helpful. Breakfast included and was just enough. The beds in the rooms are the best beds i have ever slept in and would have brought it back home with me if i could get it in my suit case!

We have Angels season tickets and since we reside in Burbank, occasionally when a day game follows a night game we have opted to stay here rather than fight the traffic back and forth in such a quick time frame. The rooms are very nice and clean and since it's located in an industrial park, if you stay away from the pool area, your visit should be a tranquil one.   The bed is very comfortable too and the room's controls are activated by your room key ... Very 21st century and energy efficient too! The free breakfast is delicious especially the waffles and the scrambled eggs which are real eggs unlike most locations where they are of the powdered, tasteless variety.   However, as the headline alluded, there are a few BUTS preventing this location from being excellent: First,

Stayed two nights for a trip to Disneyland.   A quick and easy 10mins by car to Disneyland.  This hotel was close enough to the action but far  enough away that it wasn't over run with noisy families.  We had a two room suite which was spacious and clean, the only drawback is the layout of the bedroom makes it a bit tight to navigate around the bed.  The sofabed was good enough for teen agers plus they had their own TV. Towels were better than average.  Breakfast was typical with eggs,sausage and waffles enough to get you by.  I would stay here again.  easy access for food, shopping and a trip to the beach

We stay at this hotel atleast 10 times a year. We have family that live maybe 5 miles away. This hotel is close to the freeways as well as the block in Orange. The breakfast is fresh and hot with lots to choose from....and free;-). Our rooms have always been clean and comfortable. Always enjoy our stay here.

This suite was a great value for the size. Perfect for families esp with small children. We are a fam of 3 with a teen so there was more than enough room for us. No parking fees, resort fees, etc. Decent free hot breakfast. Complimentery WiFi. Clean, modern rooms. Large family room with large bar area complete with ref and microwave. Comfortable beds. Short drive to Disneyland (fastest route bypassing car, bus, and shuttle traffic: take a right on Chapman, right on West street and straight all the way to Disney and follow signs to parking).  Suites also located right next door to the Outlets at Orange.  ART is available hourly for a small fee but takes 20 min to get there. We chose to drive because we get free parking with our annual pass.    We requested a first floor room

Summary Heading: Noisy Room and Management Didn't Care, Nice Beds Though
Summary: The hotel is in a business park and looks like an office building, but it is convenient to the freeways and just a few blocks from the Outlets at Orange, which have some nice shops and a great Van's Skatepark.  First, the positive. There is a breakfast served every day with yummy waffles, though the rest of the food (cold eggs, weak pastries) is quite mediocre but a quick, free way to start your days of adventure. The pool is small but very nice and the hot tub is well maintained and had a nice view of the mature tree is the hotel's open courtyard.  Now, the negative experience we had. We asked to be on the top floor when we booked as some are light sleepers. We were placed on the first floor, where the desk clerk assured it would be very quiet. Soon we found a cheerleading

My family recently stayed here for 4 nights on our trip to the SoCal area.  We thought the hotel was perfect for us and very comfortable.  We weren't able to check in early because our room wasn't ready.  But, it was ready by about 2pm.  The young lady at the check-in counter was very nice and helpful.  She assigned us a room on the third floor.  We had a king bed with separate living area with sofabed and small wet bar with mini fridge, microwave, and sink.  The mini fridge was a decent size, not the tiny fridges you sometimes see in other hotels.  We were able to fit our ice packs and gallon sized milk, waters, and sodas without any issue.  The room was roomy and the bed was comfortable. The bathroom was smaller and could use more lighting.  It could probably use a thorough
Friendly staff, excellent value for the money, clean and spacious rooms, shuttle to Downtown Disney.   Would definitely stay here again.

We stayed here on a trip to Disneyland and loved it.  The price was what brought me to this hotel, but experience will bring me back.  The room was very large and the beds were amazing.  I never sleep well on hotel beds but I sure did on this one.  Loved the small kitchenette and living room.  There was plenty of space for us and it was clean, quiet and comfortable.  The breakfast was good and the lady working was very nice and helpful.  Actually, friendly employees overall.  We will definitely stay here again on our next Disneyland trip.

We stay each year for the volleyball tournament at ACC.  This place is great for a family visiting Anaheim rooms have King/Queen beds and sitting room, flat screen tvs, fridge and microwave.  All great for a family. I love the free wifi as well.  There is a free breakfast but it needs to be beefed up a bit seems to have gone down hill since last visit. Proximity to area attractions cant be beat and the nearby Block at Orange is within a quick walk.

The room and surrounding area smelled like backed up or unvented sewage. They moved us to another room and then told us that they had sold that room for the next night so they would see if they could keep us in there. Turns out they couldn't and we would have to move again. We asked for a comp room for the trouble but they refused. Then they insisted we come back in the middle of the day to move our stuff or the police would be called. When we got there to get our things they didn't seem in a hurry to get the room clean for this other family, who I am sure received top service. S he put us out after my husband got mad about it. Bw customer service agreed with us but the manager would not budge. She ruined our family trip that we had flown our daughter in for and that we had

Stayed here for 5 nights recently and was impressed with the efficient service and standard of this hotel. Free Wifi, basic breakfast and fitness center and pool for under a $100/night in the Anaheim area - what more can you ask for?  There is also a shuttle to Disneyland from the hotel for about $4/person which can be convenient. Most of the other attractions are pretty close by and accessible through the I-5 and CA 22.

Stayed hear with the family for a 6 night Disneyland vacation. After reading the good reviews on Tripadvisor we decided to stay here. To sum it up the place is excellent. The beds are the most comfortable I have ever been on in a hotel. Hot breakfast every day, a close walk to the Block at Orange shopping centre. Also a close taxi ride to Target or Albertsons for a few groceries.. The ART (Anaheim regional transit) stops right at the hotel and then from there it's just a short twenty minute drive to Disneyland. One of the great reasons we stayed here was all the amenities are at this hotel for the right price. The closer you stay to Disneyland the less you get. One of the greatest things about this hotel also is there great customer service. Prior to coming I had gone on the ART

We stayed 3 nights in a standard King room and enjoyed the location near the junction of the 5 and 22 freeways in Orange County. Breakfast was included in our rate and was quite filling although unchanged during our stay.

Summary Heading: Fantastic Place to Stay while visiting the Disneyland Resort and Anaheim Area
Summary: This Best Western is the perfect place to stay when visiting the Disneyland Resort and Anaheim area.  The rooms are quiet, comfortable, and very clean.  Infact, the beds are very comfortable.  The staff is very friendly and greeted us every morning with a smile and "good morning."  A bonus was the hot breakfast that was served every morning.  It consisted of scrambled eggs, sausage, hot waffles, hot and cold cereal, fruit, pastries, coffee, juice (apple and orange).  Also, if you don't want to drive to Disneyland the hotel is on ART (Anheim Resort Transit) route. The passes are very reasanable.  I purchased ours online for $10 which gave us access to the shuttle for 3 days.

Summary Heading: best place to stay in anaheim!!!!!
Summary: we stayed here for 3 days everyday our rooms were made up,coffee,tea and condiments.Staff was very friendly and gave us a  lot of very helpful tips on how to get around. We had a 2 room suite and it was spacious,pool was warm hot tub hot towels were by the pool to help yourself to and the continental breakfast was a full breakfast buffet!!!This was truly an enjoyable stay which we will 100% go back!

I got more than the $60 a night I paid for - nice room, comfy bed, quiet location.  Very nice hot/cold complimentary buffet breakfast. Front desk staff were very friendly and helpful.  I would definitely stay here again when in the area.

Nice spacious rooms. Best fridge we've had. Freezer section large enough to fit all our ice packs. Grandkids loved having 2 tvs.  Pool & courtyard very nice. Breakfast OK. However this is the 1st BW we've stayed at where the hard boiled eggs were not unshelled. The hotel had a problem with the electric company scheduling a shut down to work on other property so had to work around shutdown. So we had to leave when electricity was turned off. Ran out of towels at pool, but no problem getting towel at the front desk.  Away from all the traffic but close enough for us to go to the Bower Museum. Manager very helpful & friendly. All the staff were also  friendly & helpful.

I think I would spend the extra few dollars for the homewood suites.  The pool area looked nice, you get a free breakfast (dining area way too small).  The staff was very pleasant.  The room was ok, the bathroom wasn't really clean.  One elevator located at the front of the building, we were all the way at the rear of the building.  A LONG walk...

Very comfortable room and nice staff.  This was a business trip but I plan to bring family here for a Disneyland trip-the breakfast was really good with a nice selection of everything-especially since it was included in the room rate-appeared to be very kid friendly too.

Close to Disneyland and Angel's Stadium, yet far enough to be free of the traffic madness of other hotels closer to the attractions. Great rates, mostly suites, full breakfast, and friendly staff. Shuttles available. I found this place quiet and restful, and would definitely stay there again on my next trip to visit family in the area. I've tried a number of other Best Westerns in the area but this one is now my favorite.

The rates are unbeatable for everything included!  (I love that the website shows the floor plans & pictures of the rooms!)  The rooms are spacious, have 2 flatscreen tvs, & kitchenettes.  It is perfect for anyone traveling with children.  My kids love that they have their "own" tv & my husband likes that he doesn't have to watch the kids' cartoons! The breakfast that is included with your stay saves time & money, especially when you have major plans for the day.  Great location.  Tons of restaurants & shopping nearby.  Close access to several freeways, so traveling in any direction from there is pretty simple.  The hotel is clean & the staff is really helpful.  We have stayed there 3 times since 2010 & have never been disappointed.

Stayed New Year's Eve so we could hit Disney on New Year's Day.  The check-in staff were very friendly and made it clear there would be no tolerance for noise by any guest and made us sign and agreement to that effect.  Never heard a peep.  The room was spotless and didn't have that "cleaned too many times I smell like a chemical spill" smell.  We stayed two nights and the breakfast was timely and delicious.  GREAT value.  Comfy, beautiful furniture that belonged in a higher-end hotel.  Can't say enough great things.  It's nice when you look for a great deal and get more than you bargained for.  We'll be back.

Summary Heading: Beware they authorize $250 on your card!
Summary: We we shocked upon check in that they wanted to authorize $250 on our credit card for a $70 room. I have never heard of putting a hold on a card for more than twice the cost of the room. Same for cash, they wanted $250 on top of the $70 and then would refund at check out. This policy was not explained when I made the reservation or when I called to confirm. I usually like Best Westerns but apparently some are individually franchised and so have their own policies. I will never stay at this location again although it was conveniently near the Block at Orange and Disneyland. Terrible customer service compared to other Best Westerns. Room was small and cramped but shower was great, big and nice shower head. Out door pool are was nice, but overall I don't recommend this place.
Manager Response: Dear guest,  Thank you for the time you took to post your review on TripAdvisor, and for giving us the opportunity to clarify the hotel policy. I sincerely apologize if the Channel you used to book your reservation didn’t provide you with all the details. We do not require any additional payments; however, our property does require a Valid ID and a Valid Credit Card that can be authorized at check-in. When using a Debit Card for the Incidentals we advise our guests that their bank  may hold the authorization as pending for a period of time ranging from 24hrs to 3 weeks or longer depending on their bank’s policy. We release the authorization immediately, but unfortunately we cannot control when the bank releases the funds back.   Best Regards,  The Management Team

Summary: It is a AMAZING to walk into a hotel past midnight and experience a friendly smiling face. we didn't have a reservation so we were worried we are going to sleep in the car.... we found this hotel online so we decided to walk-in not knowing what to think....(especially late at night) we walked into a beautiful lobby "big for a Best Western" the thing that amazed us was the gentleman George who welcomed us with a friendly sincere smile, he arranged for us to stay in a very "high end suite" it was very spacious with beautiful furniture. the suite we had was a blessing after a long drive and no reservation! comfortable beds and very clean space. it's a plus that we were given a great deal... thank you for an excellent service. I only have one comment about the girl who worked the

Summary Heading: Perfectly calm and comfortable for two mom/daughter pairs for ... Disneyland!
Summary: I thought the service, price and amenities were just right for us!  I got a great rate by paying in advance, and it turned out to be a very nice suite, separating the moms and girls for better sleep.  Breakfast was also quite adequate--eggs and sausage and waffles and cereals and beverages.  Good!  Thanks, BW Meridian!

Meridian Inn & Suites have become our vacation home in Anaheim. Off the beaten path it is a clean, quite and comfortable place to stay. We love the beds so much we recently purchase the same Sealy mattress for our home. It's location makes it perfect for our trips to Disneyland, Huntington Beach and watching the Angels. The Block is around the corner as is family affordable dinning. Its perfect for my wife and I and with the availability of suites we can expand our room so that our daughters and friends have a place to crash. The free breakfast is hit or miss depending on how early you get to it. Pool and spa area with lots of room and clean. You will appreciate the free parking with other hotels charging anywhere from 12-25 dollars a days. Find the best room rate deals on their

Summary Heading: Great Hotel and Close to Outlet Mall & Disneyland
Summary: We stayed in the Queen Suite.  It had two seperate rooms(Bedroom & Living Room) and a mini Kitchen(Small Fridge, Microwave and Sink).  The Bedroom had two Queen Beds.  Living Room had Sofa and Single Chair.  Rooms where very spacious and clean.  Hotel was quiet and the grounds where well kept.  Check in was easy and staff was nice.  Hotel was like a 2 minute drive to the Outlet Mall of Orange and only a 10 min drive to Downtown Disney(did not have to get on the freeway).  Only negatives:  No sofa sleeper and the complimentary breakfast was at best below average.  The eggs where gross(i think powdered eggs) the pastries where frozen.  But the coffee, juice and waffles where good.  Overall though, I would stay here again.  The price was great and not far from Disney and

I stayed here with my family (wife and 7 month old daughter) in June 2011.  For two days of our stay I had to attend a work conference and thereby needed to make a separate reservation, but since we didn't want to have to switch hotels I made two sets of reservations for the same type of room (or so I thought).  Made two separate booking for the same type of room a suite with a separate living room so my daughter could crawl around and play.  When we arrived they had us booked for a room with two beds instead of the suite and said that is what I had booked, even though my print out said it was a 'suite', but it wasn't the 'suite suite' I book for the other booking.  I requested to be moved into the 'suite suite' and offered to pay the difference in cost (though there wasn't one

Summary Heading: A Good Deal and a Good Deal More
Summary: We recently spent a weekend at a family 'get together' in Orange.  Not being familiar with the area we took the recommendation of our son for where to stay.  He hit a home run!!!  Initially I thought 'at least it is affordable'   Well, as it worked out, it is an extremely well maintained hotel and the entire staff reflects the pride everyone takes in their work.  From a most tasty and generous breakfast to all of staff, it was a wonderful experience.  If we have the occasion to be anywhere in Southern California near Orange you can count of us returning.

Summary Heading: One of the best hotel we ever stayed
Summary: We stayed at this hotel for 3 nights. It's an excellent hotel. We are family of 4. Our kids enjoyed a lot staying in this hotel. It feels like home. Our room has microwave and refrigerator. Room is very spacious with two queen beds and a separate living room. They kept everything in place...including minor items like toothpaste, jergens cream.....etc. You don't have to look for anything. Breakfast was nice.

Very well maintained, clean & quite. Staff was very friendly and helpful. Nice breakfast buffet. Easy to get too in what felt like a safe area. 10 min from Disneyland.  I have stayed right by Disney with hotels that are more money with half the value. This will be my preferred place to stay when in the area.

This is a nice place to stay for the money. Close to many area attractions. Upon arriving to check in, the lobby smelled very strongly of Lestoil disinfectant. When we got to our room, it too smelled of Lestoil to the point we had to leave the door open to air the room. The room was clean and spacious suite. The morning breakfast was okay for institutional food, eggs, sausage, waffles etc. We weren't in the room long enough to enjoy the hotel amenities such as the pool, fitness room.

My husband and I spent the weekend in Los Angeles and Anaheim to watch the Detroit Red Wings play the LA Kings and then the Ducks the following day.  This hotel was perfectly situated between the two arenas and very easy to find.  Our beautiful room was a king suite with all the amenities one could ask for.  It was quite secure since no one from the outside could enter the entire complex without a room key.  We were quite amazed at the breakfast spread the following morning, expecting just coffee, some toast and maybe waffles.  But to our pleasant surprise, not only was there coffee, toast, AND waffles, there were two kinds of scrambled eggs, sausages, apple and orange juice, oatmeal, a variety of cereals, muffins and bread, plus fruit.  And a very nice gentleman making sure

My husband and I stayed at this hotel because we had a nearby wedding (at the Santiago Oaks Regional Park) to attend.  This hotel is three stories and looks like an office park from the outside.  We got a room on the third floor facing the balcony.  The room is extremely spacious and much more than I expected even after reading all the rave reviews.  Our room contained a living area, kitchen, and TV.  Behind another set of doors is the bedroom (another TV) and bathroom.  The rooms were spotless, and beds were comfortable.   The only thing I thought was a little odd was that even though the hotel promoted itself as "eco-friendly" (i.e., shampoo/conditioner/body wash dispensers in the bathroom, key card activated lighting), it utilized disposable cutlery and plates/cups in the

Summary Heading: Cheaper and cleaner than most for the money
Summary: 10 minutes away from the Park area and the price dorps significantly. We've stayed twice, both times, great service, good breakfast, and only an exit further out. Once you get over that the building looks like an office park, you won't regret the experience . . .

Summary Heading: Great place great breakfast I would recommend to anyone
Summary: I checked in Friday night the staff was very friendly and attentive. The room couldnt have been nicer it was large clean and comfortable  the furnisings were 5 star with a hugh sectional sofa and flat screen televisions in the living room and bedroom  i was expecting the typical cold breakfast but I was really surprised at the fresh hot breakfast. The scrambled eggs were cooked perfectly and the sausage was terrific not greasy. Like baby bear's porridge it was just right. The breakfast attendant was very helpful and friendly an the outdoor patio was perfect way to celebrate the morning.  If you are planning a trip to this area dpi yourself a favor and stay here. It is definitely a good value for the money.

My husband and I decided to take a trip to Disneyland and we stayed at the Meridian in a king suite. The front desk personel were very friendly and helpful. they even put us in the most quiet area of the hotel because we were staying so long (7 days). I thought that was very considerate. the hotel is a little ways from Disney so the tram ride is about 15-20 min. but not crowded at all. the area around the hotel is very nice and we were only about 2 blocks from the "Block at Orange" so it was not difficult to find a nice place to eat. the room was very nice and the bed is probably the best i have ever slept on by far, even better than the one i have at home. If you are interested in purchasing a matress set (which people do) they have the information for you fight in the front

We stayed At THIS hotel cause it was a Good hotel considering the price. Since it is a suite, we had the normal room And an extra room With the fridge And a couch. (does Not have a matress). The breakfast is included And its the normal waffles, cereal, eggs, sausages And juice. It has 2 tvs (1 in each room). The lobby is a bit run down. All in all its a Good deal for the price. We went to Disneyland Everyday With a car we rented And its only a 5 min drive. One Day we stayed At the hotel And used the swimming pool, had a nice time, it is an outdoor pool. It has free parking. Nearby there Are a few convinience stores,a krispy creme, a TGIF and an Albertsons. Good deal.

I stayed in a suite for recovery form surgery. The space was great, the staff exceptional. I was not able to life anything and they cleared my car and brought everything cheerfully right to me. I was deeply appreciative. The room was so nice, quiet and well appointed.

Summary Heading: Excellent value, very comfortable and pleasant, with a terrific staff
Summary: My wife and I really enjoyed our recent stay.  If you have a car, the hotel is located near Disney, beautiful beaches, and pleasant neighborhoods in Orange County.  LAX airport is about 40 minutes away.  You can't beat this place for convenience.  The hotel actually offers quite a bit of understated elegance and luxury, such as beautiful palm trees on an interior courtyard, delightful pool and hot-tub, breakfast in the dining room or outside on the patio by a fountain.  The lobby is very tastefully appointed.  The rooms are nice and quiet; beds are extremely comfortable and the flat-screen televisions are high-quality.  The very best thing of all is the friendly and extremely professional staff.  It is unmistakeable when you come across a high-functioning team.   You sense how

This is a nice hotel to stay at near Disney.  The rooms are very spacious and especially good when traveling with children as you can close doors to the bedroom.  The breakfast buffet is also a nice feature when traveling on a budget.

We stayed in a King Suite one night for a college tour at Chapman University.  The room was much larger than expected.  The entire facility was very clean.  The hotel would be a good home base for a Disney trip.

Will stay here again. Great value for the price. The staff was terrific; went way beyond our requirements for this stay. Breakfast was better than expected. An older building but well kept. Slept like a baby, very quiet. If you're looking for a good value around Disneyland I recommend this location.

Summary Heading: they do it right, and listen to your individual needs: the best!
Summary: We needed a "home base" while seeking an assisted living place for my mom. This place was PERFECT. We had a handicap suite, with a bed for her and a sofa-bed for me; two rooms, so space to spread out and be apart when needed, together when wanted. The facilities were great for wheelchair/walker. The kitchenette was handy and well laid out. The bathroom provided safety as needed. I could go out to the pool and jacuzzi for some relaxation and still be close in case of need. Breakfasts were hot and fresh and good.  But the very best thing was the people on staff: everyone was kind and helpful, and especially Christina, who was always cheerful and ready to help, and Ranya, the manager, who went out of her way to make things work for us. We stayed about three weeks--and would have

we stayed here for 5 nights and found it good value. Our room was a decent size with a fridge and coffee maker. The free breakfast was better than we expected even if it was all disposable plates and utensils. If we were to stay in the area again, we would definately stay there.

Car is required as although there is a shopping mall nearby it is reasonably isolated. However if you have a car the freeway is nearby. Room is large with kitchenette but no utensils are given. The corridors feel musky. There is a small gym containing basically a treadmill. Free wifi and parking is a bonus. Room was surprisingly quiet despite the open plan of the building. There is a shuttle to Disneyland.

We stayed with our two children aged 12 and 10 for three nights in October.  The room was a good size and clean but, as others have said, completely lacked any utensils, crockery etc.  The breakfast included in the room rate was extremely basic and average, and was served on paper plates using plastic knives and forks.  The staff in the hotel were not overly friendly but this didn't create any problems for us.  The location is great, being just a ten minute or so drive from Disneyland, and just a few minutes from The Block.
Manager Response: Dear guest,  Thank you for the time you took to post your review on TripAdvisor, and for giving us the opportunity to respond to your concern. We agree that all the Kitchenette suites should have utensils; however, the suite you reserved was not a Kitchenette suite. Your booking was for one of our standard King suites that has a Wet bar area and no kitchen. Due to that and for our guest’s convenience, items like utensils are always available upon request for no extra charge.  Sincerely yours, The Management Team

Summary: We felt the room (1 king bed) was a little small in size but you can't beat the value. We really appreciated the wonderful breakfast, free parking and free internet! There is a nice mall down the street which was handy and it's only a 10 min drive to Disneyland (if that)!  The staff was friendly and the room was clean. This is not a fancy hotel but it is safe and priced right!
We got an excellent deal - $79.99.  I'd stay there again in a heart beat.

First I want to say that the price ($98 for a two room suite) factored into my high rating. My 20 year old son and I met in Orange, CA (he came from Seattle and I from the east coast). We were there for a campus tour at Chapman U. With our different time zones the two room suite was excellent because I needed to hit the sack earlier and it was nice that my son could sit in the living room/kitchen and work on his computer or watch TV without disturbing me or that my need to turn in earlier didn't force him to shut down for the night before he was ready. Parking was free and offered easy access to our room.   The beds were AWESOME---so comfortable and firm. What I really appreciated was the BIG shower head. I really hate those shower heads that do little more than drool all over

We checked in for a wedding for a one night stay.  The Hotel was clean and elegant.  Courteous service was followed.  The room was very well done, clean with stylish furniture. The vending machines were not taking but $1 bills.  I tried all three floors with the same results (my only complaint of the hotel).  My wife left her seeing glasses at the room and had spares. Christina mailed it to us the next day.  A great experience at Best Western Meridian.  Thank you. Seto & Susan

Summary Heading: Excellent clean choice for Anaheim area
Summary: Stayed here for 4 nights at the end of September to kick off our Los Angeles and Las Vegas trip and couldn't have been happier. Clean and very spacious 1 bedroom suite, pleasant and quiet central courtyard which reminded me more of a small resort. The staff were some of the friendliest I have ever encountered and great location for driving. 5 mins from the Block at Orange with it's outlet shops and eateries, felt safe too as it was mainly a business location.  Only complaints would be that breakfast was perhaps a little too simple (but can't complain about it being free) and there was no kitchen equipment at all which was a bit strange but we didn't need to use it much anyway.

As soon as we arrived, I was put off a little because the property is a bit run down and old. But the room itself was spacious, clean, and the interior design was lovely.  The refrigerator kept our food/drinks very cold, the bed was comfortable, soft, didn't squeak, and had no bed bugs. The bathroom was my favorite spot. "green" dispensers are used instead of those little bottles of shampoo/conditioner/soap, etc... and the huge shower head was great too!  There was complimentary breakfast which my boyfriend and our daughter enjoyed. If you're lactose intolerant, allergic to eggs or simply vegan, you don't have much options as far as food goes. They don't provide soy or nut milk. Best bet is just fresh fruit.   Lastly, ramps are not provided. So you'll be picking your luggage up

Summary Heading: The wet-bar king suite worked great for our family!
Summary: We just returned from six nights at the Best Western Plus Meridian Suites. It was a very good stay. As other reviewers have pointed out this property has been recently remodeled and is very clean. We loved the space the king wet-bar suite provided. The king bed was comfy and the sofabed worked well for our two-year old. I don't know if an adult would be comfortable on it, but that's just because sofabeds aren't usually comfortable in general. We loved having two TV's and the closing doors between the King room and the living space. It allowed us to put our daughter to bed and still have some lights on and use the other TV.   We knew that with the wet-bar utensils would not be provided so we brought our own paper plates, napkins, cups etc. The cupboards and drawers really helped
This room was beautiful,  great rate,  great bed,  no bed bugs.  Staff was friendly and kind.   Breakfast food was ok,

When we told some local friends where we were going to stay here they said, "Oh, you're staying at the nice Best Western."  We have stayed here twice and both times the staff was very friendly, the rooms were clean and bed was comfy.  The pool is nice and clean but a little warm.  It's just a short easy drive to Disneyland with a mall with many places to eat less than 1/2 mile away.  We plan on staying here again next time we visit.  It's not a 4 star hotel, but is a good value for the price range.

Nice enough hotel. The grounds, hallways, and rooms were kept very clean.  If you have kids, the 2 room suites provide extra space so you're not all stuffed into one small hotel room. The refrigerator is a little small, and the freezer space doesn't actually "freeze" anything. Also, there are no plates or utensils in the rooms. The air conditioner is very noisy when it turns on and the faucet in the bathroom is horribly loud. I did find that the bed and pillows were very comfy and the pool was nice. I appreciate the free breakfast. It really helps because a trip to Disneyland will cause bankruptcy. However, it was dreadful. I've had the free breakfasts at a Hampton Inn and a Quality Inn. They were much better quality. The only positive thing about the breakfast here at Best

I stayed at the Best Western Plus Meridian Inn and Suites in June on a business trip. I was impressed with the overall condition of the hotel and the value for money paid.  Like much of Orange County, the hotel is nondescript. In fact, it looks like an office building from the street, which confused friends who visited me and expected to find something resembling a traditional hotel. The lobby is compact, the main elevator has seen better days, and the outdoor corridors took some getting used to. The building is arranged in inner and outer rings surrounding a courtyard, and all the rooms have windows looking out onto the walkways. Definitely keep your blinds drawn!  The rooms themselves are well appointed, clean, and spacious. I stayed in a suite and had ample room to unpack,

After reading the reviews, I was expecting a really great experience at this hotel, but was sort of disappointed. Our suite was large but that was about it. There was a large kitchen space with lots of empty drawers and cabinets. No plates or utensils. The sheets were not smooth, you could tell that they were cheap and had gone through quite a few wash cycles. The free breakfast was not anything to write home about.  The one thing that I really liked about this hotel was that instead of little bottles of shampoo and body wash, they had dispensers in the shower and next to the sink. This cuts down on waste and provides you with enough of a product that you can actually use.
Manager Response: Dear guest, Let me start by thanking you for taking the time to post your review on Trip Advisor. Your feedback is very important to us and we always do our best to improve our service for our guests. All of our kitchenettes do contain utensils; however, the suite that was reserved for you was actually a King Wetbar suite.  Our King Wetbar Suites don't contain a stove or a full size refrigerator; therefore, items like utensils are only available upon request for no extra charge. I sincerely apologize if the travel agent who processed your booking failed to mention the difference between the two suites. We hope this clarifies it for you and again thank you for giving us the opportunity to respond to your concern. Sincerely yours, The Management Team

Summary Heading: We enjoyed our stay and will return again
Summary: This is a beautiful property.  Great pool, jacuzzi and courtyard.  The rooms are very nice and comfortable.  It is easily accessible from I-5, & the 22.  As close as the freeways are it is very quite.  It is a 3 stops lights from The Block @Orange with many shops, eateries,AMC movies.  Also near Target, Fridays Restraunt @ Carls Jr.  It is about 15min (due to stop lights) from Disneyland Resort.  We got a great rate on line and a discount w/AAA.  Best deal ever for anything even remotely near Disneyland! Plus you don't have the noise and congestion of being across from the parks.  The hotel also offers a shuttle to the Disneyland Resort for $4.  If you are going to stay in the area you might as well stay in a great hotel w/a budget price.  The front desk couldn't be better.

Summary Heading: Don't let the ugly exterior keep you from this motel.
Summary: It is not a pleasant looking building and the exterior hallways really needed vacuuming, but the actual room itself was very nice. It faced the busy street but it was quiet inside and well furnished. I had a suite and enjoyed the space. The bed and pillows were excellent! Perhaps best bedding experience at a hotel in past many years! was Can't argue with FREE breakfast, FREE parking and FREE wi-fi. I was hesitant to stay because I haven't stayed at Best Western chain before, but as I said - the room and perks were very nice.

We have stayed at the BW Meridian Inn and Suites in Orange twice in the past month. Both times the stay was very enjoyable and convenient. This is an older remodeled property, but clean and nicely decorated. What I love about this place is that you can get a suite with either two queens or a king and a separate living area with sofa bed, microwave and fridge for a very reasonable price. There is a nicely landscaped pool and patio area, guest laundry and a fantastic free warm breakfast. The pool is small but adequate for family fun. Not quite big enough for serious exercise. Parking and internet is free, and the staff is warm and welcoming. If you are coming to the Orange or Disneyland area, I highly recommend this comfortable, clean and welcoming hotel.

We stayed here in June for 8 nights in a King room suite as we were after something a little more than the usual small hotel room as we were a family of 3 adults. Finding the place was easy as it is just off the freeway, but not that close that you hear it all day and night. The whole place was clean and tidy and had a kitchen area with fridge to keep the beer and the mixers cold, but no plates or cutlery. Sometimes the plastic knifes, forks and spoons aquired from breakfast did not quite make the grade cutting fruit or other hard items. Nearby was the Orange Block shopping centre with shops naturally, but also restaurants and other food outlets. A supermarket was a short drive away as was a liquor store. As you are in LA, you need a car and the free parking was nearby to the

i was with great joy and surprise at this hotel, the hotel is central located of all the important sites in the area, the attention at the reception was fantastic, I got a room in which I felt very comfortable and safe, very clean and the building is modern, economically the best in the area. i will come back to this hotel for my stay in the future. A did not have time to eat there, a few near by restaurants in the area.  Alba

Summary Heading: It was very nice. We loved the room.
Summary: The room was very spacious the breakfast was amazing and as a special bonus free parking. We would love to stay there again.

Summary Heading: You get much more than you pay for!
Summary: We have just completed a relatively busy family holiday to Southern California and are so happy that we chose to stay at this hotel.  After long days at Disneyland, Sea World and Universal Studios, it was a pleasure to come back to the clean and comfortable 2 room King Suite that we booked.  The best part...  The awesome Latex topped king bed that gave us the best sleep. Our two children, 12 and 10, had no issues with the fold-out sofa bed in the main room.  Also, there was always time for a swim as the pool was open till 10am.  The breakfast was more than adequate for a "complementary meal". And finally... Free wifi anywhere in the hotel. Even by the pool. Excellent!!  Our only suggestion?  Let customers know prior to check-in that there are no plates and cutlery in the room,

This was a great hotel! The only downside was that you definitely have to drive to get anywhere, from the Disney Parks to a good cup of coffee. But for the price, you won't find a better deal in the Anaheim area. The lobby and rooms are updated and lovely, and there is LOTS of space. A full counter, sink, mini fridge, and microwave are in the common room, along with a fairly comfortable sofa bed. The bed in the bedroom is HUGE. We really liked it, and any time we need space for 3 or 4 we will be looking at this hotel first.

Summary Heading: Great place away from Disneyland to stay!
Summary: We have stayed at a number of hotels in the Anaheim/Disneyland area and have seen the good and bad. This hotel definitely falls in the good, in fact the very good. We booked a suite with a king and a sofa bed. With a 6 week old baby we were hoping to find a place where we could close the door to one room to avoid disturbing our other children. This suite did just that. The suite was very nice and updated. The only issue with the room was the broken sink stopper, but without even asking we found that this was fixed after our first night. We were there 4 nights. Breakfast was wonderful and left us feeling fulfilled through mid-day to avoid having to spend money at the parks or anywhere else until later in the day. The courtyard and pool were very inviting. Next time we come back

Summary Heading: we loved it and we`ll be back
Summary: Great no smoking motel with quiet interior courtyard

Thus far, the nicest hotel I have been.   (1) Room is very spacious, modern and very clean.   I like the fact that the room is equipped with dining table, sink, microwave and fridge.  The living room is separated from the sleeping quarters.   (2) Free breakfast every day!!  (3) Cleaning staff did a good job cleaning the room! and making our beds :) (4) Close to Disneyland!! (5) Shopping at The Block (outlet) (6) Nice courtyard and so is the pool  Overall rating is A++ and would definitely recommend this!

Summary Heading: Perfect combination of price, location and service
Summary: We decided to stay at this hotel on our annual Disneyland trip. We normally stay close to the Park but now that we have older kids, we anticipated that we wouldn't need to return to the hotel during the day for a rest. This hotel is a few miles from Disneyland but since we're in LA, a few miles is nothing - just a short hop up Interstate 5 and we're at the park. Breakfast was good - not great - but better than many other free breakfasts we've been offered. The hotel is reasonably clean outside and the rooms are large and the beds are very comfortable. the front desk staff was extremely friendly and seemed genuinely glad to see us. The 4 star rating (it really should be 4½)  is because of the seeming thinness of the walls especially where the plumbing is concerned. The water

Summary Heading: We Loved it and we hope we can come back one day!!
Summary: When we were researching where we should stay on our small family vacation we wanted something close to Disneyland.  So we picked Best Western Meridian Inn & Suites because it wasn't too close so that it would be extremely busy.  It has the shuttle service that cost very little to take you to and from Disneyland as many times as you want during a 24 hour period for a very low cost.  The staff, the surrounding amenities, (great little coffee shop just on the next parking lot), the breakfast, the pool and hot tub, etc, were just great.  It was our first vacation to the states and we just had a great time.    A great hotel really helps!  When we came back to our room after being gone all day all of  our things were neat and tidy and the beds were made and the room clean.  Thanks

This is my second time staying at this hotel, both times during visits to Disneyland.  It is quite close to DL and there's a $4/person shuttle that takes you to and from DL.  It is hard to beat this price for this quality of hotel.  Rooms are pretty clean.  Breakfast is included and it is in fact a REAL breakfast: eggs, sausage, cereal, WAFFLES!  Would definitively stay here again when we come back to DL (assuming they don't raise the prices!).

We had two rooms for our family and were looking for a hotel with complimentary breakfast and parking to facilitate our days at Disneyland and other parks.  The front desk staff was very friendly and efficient upon checkin, during the 6 day stay and upon checkout.  The rooms are very large, with bedroom separate from the living and kitchen suite.  The recent remodel makes one feel comfortable.  Breakfast was waffles, sausage, eggs, toast, cereal, bananas and apples and the gentleman, James, serves waffles and manages the services very nicely.  Although we did not have time for the pool due to spending our days at the theme parks, the pool looks very nice and clean.  The distance from Disneyland parking is only a few miles, and it is convenient to get on the freeway to John Wayne
Left over food in the frig when we checked in - smelled terrible.  No extra pillows.  Exact same thing for breakfast every day.  Terrible sofa bed.

Summary Heading: A great base to explore Disney from!
Summary: We stayed here August 2010.  Looks are certainly deceiving, from thevoutsidevyou would be fooled into thinking this was an average motel but you will be surprised.   Our suite was great, from the lay out, furnishings, comfort, cleanliness and two flat panel tv's and free wire-less.  We just loved the space having two rooms.The breakfast was basic but adequate  and the staff were friendly and helpful.  We had a hire car so it was a great base to get to Disney and other attractions. With the free wireless we were able to look up things to do as well as find places to eat. This is important to us as I'm coeliac and need to research gluten free menu options.  After the long days at the parks we did just end up getting take-out most nights but we felt we were in the comfort of our

It was the first of 7 hotels we booked for our 3-week trip to the US but from the moment I entered our room and saw the outdoors environment of the hotel we questioned of whether at all we should move somewhere else (though, Las Vegas, national parks and San Francisco were ahead!).  We never used the pool (just didn't have time in between of multiple POIs in the area) but it looked clear and attractive, not crowded but with enough people not to feel alone. Same about breakfast - no judging as we ate it in other places nearby.   But the room was spacious, with a separate bedroom. Very clear and well-supported. Enough places in the parking in front of your room.   Wi-Fi worked well at the moment of the first connection but refused to connect next morning. As far as we understood,

We took our two daughters (ages 2 and 4) on our first family vacation to Disneyland.  I did a ton of research and decided on this hotel because of the price for a suite and its location (it is a 10 minute drive to Disneyland.)  I had read a ton of excellent reviews, but the day before we left I read a few bad ones so I was a little nervous.  I shouldn't have been-this hotel was perfect for us!  The room was a nice size (we had a 2 queen suite).  It was quiet with mostly other families.  The pool was perfect for my girls.  The free breakfast was good (nothing fancy, but enough to get us going each morning.)  The drive to disney was easy and quick-we were able to leave and go back later.  The beds were comfy, the room was clean, and the staff was so friendly!  I am so glad that I

Summary Heading: Close to shopping, theme parks, and the freeway
Summary: This was an excellent family hotel.  The rooms are spacious and clean.  The only complaint was the breakfast room, which was crowded and unclean.  The pool and hot tub were a nice way to wrap up the day!

Summary Heading: Spacious Room, Excellent Breakfast and Affordable Rates
Summary: The suite we got had a  private bedroom that was separated from the living area, which has a sofa bed, and a TV in each room.  Our room was always promptly cleaned and the staff is super friendly.  Check-in and check-out was quick and painless.  Our kids loved eating breakfast in the beautiful courtyard every morning.  I love that it's a green hotel!  The rates are very affordable and it's in a nice part of Orange County (business area).  An added bonus is that it's right by an The Block at Orange.  We travel with our kids, so we always want to be near a medical facility, which this hotel is...I believe it's near two hospitals.  I also like that the hotel is near a lot of stuff, but not in the middle of it all so you're close to fun, but not in the midst of all the

We stayed here with our daughter and three grandchildren. There was plenty of room for the six of us. Even having just one bathroom worked. The sofabed was very uncomfortable and had no pillows or extra blankets. The hotel is older but clean and the staff was very friendly and helpful. Breakfast room was hot but we ate outside as there is plenty of tables to use. The mornings we went to Disneyland we grabbed something to eat and ate on the shuttle bus. The first day on the shuttle to Disneyland the bus made many stops. Second day route changed and we went straight to Disneyland. The shuttle was a great way to travel to Disneyland. The grandchildren loved the pool. The hotel could have had another computer to use for guests. Cleaning staff does the minimum and when I asked for

Summary Heading: Noisy: neighboring A/C heard in the room
Summary: Well, stayed there a couple of nights on my family visit of Disneyland in Oct 2010.   Good breakfast with sausages, apples, bananas, juices and other staff. Ample (and free) parking in front of your rooms. Suites, big beds, big flat-screen TV in each room. Big bath, nicely looking room. Outstanding cost/benefit balance.  The only, but very important nuisance is noise. We arrived at midnight and found the noise from the A/C in the room below just unbearable: had to request to be moved to another room in half an hour. Was moved to an opposite side of the hotel just to find out that the similar though lesser noise existed there as well.   For us, noise killed all the charms. End of story. Won't stayed there again.

Summary Heading: not good looking from the outside - but nice suites
Summary: we went there for 2 nights and it was just ok. the hotel from the outside was looking like more like an old small shopping centre than a hotel (old red bricks). the lobby was not looking that good too...  so, i was quite scared about the room....   But finally got a good surprise. it was pretty nice and comfy. nice king size bed and a sofa in the lounge for the kids. large fride and nice kitchen.  about service: - had to go to the lobby as there were non pool towels (had to wait 15mn to get them) - spa was not working - breakfast was just ok. there were "carton" plates, bowls and plastic forks and knives.    no organization as a guy was cooking some wafles and everyone wanted some but you had to get in the same line to have scramble eggs, etc....    pretty messy  good points :

Booked this hotel on our trip to Disneyland as a stopover for the ball game.  Hotel is easy to find of the freeway.  doesn't really look much like a hotel from the outside.  It is a very short drive to to Angels stadium and does have a shuttle if needed.  The day we wanted to use it it was running way behind so the friendly front dea staff gave us our money back and we spent $10 to park at a private parking lot.  The hotel is basic and the breakfast is acceptable.  I found the hotel quiet and the beds fairly comfortable.  Our room was a little dated and could have used some upgrading but it was clean and we were only there one evening.

Summary Heading: Check Your Bed Before Getting In... It May Not Be Clean
Summary: Let me just start by saying that this place is a step below other hotels in the same area.  Even though it's close to the Block of Orange, it's better if you just drive the extra block or two and get a better room.  First off, let it be known that we were relocated here by hotels.com, due to a problem with the room we originally booked.  It wasn't our original choice, so we weren't expecting much.  Needless to say, we arrive at this hotel and are told that the room that was booked for us was not available.  Immediately the upselling began.  Of course they could accomodate us in a better room for an additional charge.  They wanted us to cancel our reservation w/ hotels.com, and rebook the room directly with them for an outragous rate.  To which I refused and decided to await the

Summary Heading: Not the cleanest but staff very friendly
Summary: We had an easy and quick check-in. The reception and breakfast staff were very pleasant and helpful. The room itself was updated, clean but is older. It was nice to have a two room suite since we were traveling with our two teen girls. The pool area looked well kept though we did not use it. I found the breakfast selection offered variety though the quality could have been better. I did like that fruit was offered. The thing I liked the least was that hotel's common areas were not clean. The front door glass was dirty with fingerprints as was the elevator. Free parking and wi-fi was convenient also. The hotel is located a few miles from Disneyland. I think the website says 3 miles but it seemed like more. It is an easy drive though if you have a vehicle.

I was travelling with a couple so the 2 room layout was perfect for us. The location was a distance from Disneyland and we were without a car. We used the Orange buses to get to Knots Berry Farm, and Long Beach ($4 for a 24 hour pass) and the local ART shuttles for Disneyland ($4 for a 24 hour pass)  On two nights we were told by the shuttle driver the shuttles would be returning on the hour from 10 p.m instead of 40 minutes past the hour. Both nights we had been given the wrong information. On the 2nd night, the shuttle left 10 minutes early. Luckily, another shuttle driver took pity on us and took us to the Meridian. Taxi fares from D/L to Meridian varied from $12 to $15  We found the rooms spacious and beautifully appointed, and clean. The pullout sofa bed was very

Summary Heading: will stay at a different hotel next time
Summary: Room size is a plus, but distance from the park is not. The hotel staff was friendly enough. Housekeeping was not good, small things like not being left enough towels after the second day, not being left bars of soap and dirty mirrors make the $ that I saved by staying here not worth it. Breakfast was o.k. but the room that it is served in doesn't have air conditioning and is very hot. It seemed dirty and you could see the staff microwaving the sausages ( without gloves )before putting them out to be served. I visit disneyland about every two years and will choose a different hotel next time.

The room and location were great. Everyone very friendly. The only problem we had which wasn't really a problem is the hotel wasn't very clean.Clean enough but little things missed. Some food on the ground not picked up,etc. the maid came each day to tidy up which literally  was make the beds unless you chose for her to change the linen.She came really late too where I actually called because it was just about 3pm and the room was still undone. Never cleaned the glasses or the coffee mugs. I purposely left them in the sink and they still were there when we returned untouched. The breakfast was great. Just enough to get your day started.The gentleman who took care of that very friendly. A little more fruit variety would have been nice and maybe yogurt. The pool was great although

Summary Heading: Hated it and will never go back!
Summary: When we entered the room, it was dark, with curtains drawn, so we couldn't find the wall switch. Opened the drapes to find mini-windows and the door facing a wall. We happened to be there during a time when typically June Gloom weather prevailed and the rooms were cold, but when I tried to use the heater it would only blow COLD air! Reported it and a snippy reply was: "Just give it time."  No extra blanket.  etc. etc. etc.! Worst place I've ever stayed! In 1982 I stayed in a hotel in the Australian outback that was better!

Nice hotel.  Loved the suite.  It worked very well for us, a family of three. We had privacy while sharing the same room with our daughter of seven.  I researched for a couple of day before choosing the Meridian. The deciding factors were free parking, hot breakfast, pool and hot tub, plus the two room suite all at an affordable price.  I am most pleased that the room  was actually nicer than the photo's I saw online. The shuttle to the parks was on time and convenient. I was a little concerned the first night with the noise from the pool as we were poolside on the second floor but the Meridian apparently enforces their pool hours and it soon became quiet. While it is not within walking distance to the parks it is also not a great distance and provided a quieter atmosphere.

My buddy and I stayed here for U2 concert at Angel Stadium. Most inexpensive suite in area which is about the only thing that makes this place worthwhile.  Negatives: The Gym: It's the size of a closet with 3 very old cardio machines and a Universal machine. That's It! I mean c'mon if ur gonna have such a small gym at least have some new equipment. Customer Service: Depends who you talk to. When we first arrived on Friday the front desk agent told us that walking to the stadium was basically impossible (its only 2 miles).Well we walked one night. Yeah it was long but not so impossible. Then when the couple ahead of us asked if there was any other transportation he suggested driving or a taxi. What he failed to mention was the shuttle that was sitting right outside the door. When

We enjoyed the Best Western Plus Meridian and think it was a good value for the money.  The hotel is about 2 miles from Disney, so the area is not as crowded and noisy, which was fine with us.  The rate was very reasonable, especially considering that it included free parking, free internet, and free breakfast.  A lot of the hotels near Disney charge for all three.  The hotel had ample parking, and The Block at Orange was around two blocks away, which was an added bonus.  One fhing that I did not care for at the hotel were the pillows.  They gave two regular size pillows and two larger, body-size pillows for each bed.  The standard pillows were good, the body pillows were heavy (maybe 10 lbs) and hard.  Although this is just a minor complaint, I would have preferred 4 regular

I decided to give this place a try based on previous reviews. When I checked in the staff was nice and showed me where the exercise room was because wanted to get a quick workout in. The suite was real big and modern, channel selection on the tv also. The best had to be the bed (very comfortable). Good gym and hot breakfast in the morning. Nice hotel

Stayed here in June 2011.  This hotel is a good value for your money but has pros and cons. Pros: nice suite layout with plenty of room.  One room living room with sofabed and chair, plus large kitchenette with cabinets, microwave, small refig, coffee maker.  Bedroom is a little small with 2 queens but adequate. Nice pool area. It was very quiet when we were there.  Free breakfast, free parking.  Cons: Very small bathroom with outside double sinks.  Pillows are horrible unless you like very hard pillows.
