Towels are very rough.  The rooms are a little warn and could use a little more maintenance but still ok.  The free breakfast, although free, was very lacking; scrambled eggs, sausage. Small waffles, very crisp. Instant oatmeal, cereal, some pastries, toast. OJ was very watered

Recently stayed one night here and fled the next morning to the Hampton Inn. In my opinion, this place is several levels below a Motel 6. As you can see by my photos, it is VERY poorly maintained. This place is scuzzy, like a spring break hotel. The rooms themselves weren't horrible, but the air conditioning is loud, the walls are paper thin and the windows face the exterior hallway so you have no privacy. The small pool looked clean, but the other common areas are worn and dirty, definitely not maintained at the standard you'd expect from this chain. Also, when we got to our room, we picked up the phone to call the front desk with a question, but there was no dial tone. Then tried the hotel on our cell and no one answered, so we had to go to the lobby in person, where we were

This was our second stay at this hotel and it is AWESOME! I almost hesitate to say it so that no one else finds out about our little gem, but we will def return in the future!  Check in and out is a breeze, staff is super helpful and accommodating, the rooms super clean, comfy bed, and best of all quiet.  Breakfast is just dandy considering it's included in the room rate, so no complaints!  Would HIGHLY recommend.

The front desk staff is always awesome. Each room we have stayed in has always TOP NOTCH!  Prime location to local attractions and freeway close to start travelling to the ones further away. Pool, Jacuzzi, for the water lovers. Exercise room for the workout crew. Krispy Kreme doughnuts about 500 yards away for the rest of us.

Summary Heading: Aussie Family says Close enough Disney and Good Value
Summary: We stayed at BW Meridian Anaheim and as a family we were happy with our stay and would recommend this Hotel to any one wanting to visit Disney or go to an Angels game. The only issue we had was the wireless internet roaming as it really poor in conection even after we let front desk know of the issue. The Pool and spa was a big hit with the kids and shopping in Orange square was just down the road. Eating out and access to Disney was great, Rooms were spacous with facilities for cooking etc are avaiable. The savings you get from staying here can go on to provide other activities for the family in all we recommend this property.

Summary Heading: I loved it and I will be back!
Summary: Everything was outstanding--service, food, cleanliness, comfort and accomodations both inside and ouitside the room.  In particular, I'd like to mention that I'm in a wheelchair and roomed alone in one of their handicapped rooms.  Overall,  the room--especially the bathroom--accomodated my special needs well, though a few modifications were necessary since my husband wasn't with me to help me out.  But I called for assistance and received an immediate response for help and adjustments.  For example, they lowered the bed height for me, and rearranged a few things so they were within my reach.  (lamps, phones...)  Most other things however were within my reach--hairdryer, thermostat, microwave, towels, door peephole...  The room was very spacious and quiet.  Staff in the dining

This was a great hotel near Disneyland.  We had a suite with two queen beds and a sitting area.  The hotel was nice, clean, and comfortable.  We loved driving "home" from Disneyland at night to a place removed from all of the crazieness of Disney.    The Positives of the hotel were Close to Disney Clean Rooms Large Rooms Free Razor Free Breakfast Nice Beds  Nice TV's Nice Pool and Hot Tub  The Negatives were: Getting grilled by the front desk when we asked for more towels, only three were provided in room. Having the breakfast man freak out on us when we touched his waffle maker Not being able to take breakfast food back to room Having to take oour own trash out when the cleaning crew skipped us for a day.  Overall decent hotel with nice beds and larger rooms for the money.
Friendly staff, clean and spacious room. Good breakfast and great freeway access.
Our family got a couple of suites during Chapman graduation weekend. It's a nice place and close to the campus. We used to stay at Doubletree, but this is so much cheaper!

Summary Heading: Beautify Property Conveniently Located-Loved the Bed!
Summary: Drove in from Las  Vegas via Canyon Country to our final destination, Orange, CA.  Upon arrival we were beat and ready to relax from the long drive.  We were greeted by the friendly, smiling staff behind the counter who were most helpful in giving us directions and recommendations for dinner...we were starving!  What a beautiful and inviting pool area.  I longed to enjoy the sun and hear the waterfall while seated under the umbrellas. A quiet family sat munching fruit in the shade. Our beautiful room was inviting and I was happy to see our queen bed waiting for us after dinner.  I must say that Best Western has the best, most comfortable beds and pillows. Our suite was beautifully decorated and offered a coffee maker, refrigerator, microwave, and an interesting mechanism to save

Appon arriving at the hotel and finding we had booked our stay a week later, the front desk clerk Ray helped us contact Orbitz to see if they could fix the error we made. All they could do was refund the charges with no hotel rooms available. Ray checked and said he did have a room and even offerd an up grade to the VIP room for a mear extra $15. We thought this was great service and help from your staff. The room was very nice and clean, and we noticed how well maintained the whole hotel was kept. Staff was always polite and neatly derssed.   On Orbitz this hotel is rated at 3 stars, but I think it a 4 star hotel without the overpricing.

Best value I found through Southwest.com. I stayed twice and is my first choice in the future as long as I can get the online rate. Centrally located in Safe, clean area.  Booked online and got the best rate. Be sure to confirm reservation if using 3rd party because one reservation was not received.  However, manager took care of problem and called 3rd party herself to fix the problem.  Most places make you fix it yourself.  Excellent breakfast! Very clean, friendly, and safe. Love the king suites!

I have stayed at this hotel personally, as well as many of our business associates and fellow employee. The rates are reasonable and the rooms are very nicely furnished. They have an excellent breakfast room, which includes eggs, sausage, and real waffles. Beats your average continental donuts any day. The service is excellent, and whenever I am in a pinch, they are always willing to go that extra mile for me. I have yet to encounter any of their staff as being less than pleasant. We have also used their conference room for small attendance meetings and their staff makes planning these events much easier and the catering food was great. Thank you

Summary Heading: Nice hotel, great location, super friendly & helpful staff
Summary: We stayed at the Best Western Meridian May 12th - 14th, 2011.  Our primary purpose was to visit Disneyland and California Adventure.  The hotel is located about 7 miles away from Disneyland, but it is an easy drive from the hotel to the parks and back.  Our hotel room was spacious, very nice, clean, and well appointed.  The bed was super comfortable.  The hotel has a nice pool area and hot tub.  The continental breakfast wasn't spectacular, but hit the spot and sent us out fueled for the morning.  The only real negative about the breakfast is the hotel's use of Styrofoam cups; they really should switch to something that will breakdown in a landfill.  We would definitely stay here again.

Summary Heading: nice hotel, awsome managment and staff
Summary: i stayed at this hotel many many times and loved it, It is a hidden gem,the breakfast was plenty and delicious, the staff were great and helpful i think it should be a 5 star hotel, i met the owners and they are super friendly and great.  it is definatly the type of hotel you stay at when you are in the area.  hi KEV, SHR, RAN, HEC, LP, GEO, MIG

The hotel overall was good. Good room size and the staff was always very helpful. However the room cleaning wasnt good at all, we stayed for a week and they only swept the room twice, we even found a dirty sock (wasnt ours!) next to the bed. Nice hotel but wont come back...

I had a great experience at this Best Western location. My room was much larger than I expected with a separate living room and kitchen area. The bathroom was bright and clean and this Best Western has installed eco-friendly shampoo and soap dispensers in their showers to cut down on unnecessary waste that would otherwise come from the little bottles of toiletries you're used to seeing in most hotels, which I appreciated. And the beds were incredibly comfortable! The complimentary breakfast was a nice touch and I found the staff to be polite and helpful. Convenient access to freeways and great shopping. All in all it was a great place to stay at an even better value. I'd definitely stay here again!

Not luxury, but good bang for your buck!! I have stayed here twice when visiting my daughter at a local University. Location is good; rooms are updated and very comfortable. So nice to have the extra room and wifi (plus free parking). The building is old, but don't let that deter you. The workout room is small and barely functional and the breakfast is marginal.  But again, it is a GREAT value for the price and will stay here again.

Summary Heading: Spacious, updated rooms, nice pool area, unreliable bus service to Disney.
Summary: My family of four stayed at the Meridan Inn and Suites over Spring Break.  We stayed 5 nights, and were pleasantly surprised by the nice, updated rooms and decor.  We slept well and the kids loved the pool and courtyard area.  2 flat screen TV's, microwave and fridge added a nice touch.  The only thing that seemed outdated was the elevator, which had a horrible smell and was in need of some TLC.  The hot breakfast was nice, but it would have been nice if they changed it up some.  After 5 mornings of the same thing, it was getting monotonous.  A small gripe, but it wouldn't keep me from staying here again.  Overall, a nice place to stay, off the beaten path, where you're not in the middle of the hustle and bustle of Disney.    Our main problem at this hotel (and it has nothing to

Came to visit the Vans skatepark with two young children and needed a hotel in a safe area nearby.  The hotel looked clean and nice from the outside, but more or less like a "business building"  The gal who checked us in was so friendly...the way it should be, but unfortunately not what you generally encounter these days.  We got a courtyard room, king with a pull out couch.  I wasn't too excited based on the description, but the two queen room was more expensive.  When we opened the door my kids flipped out!  full living room with large table and kitchen space.  The bedroom with the king bed was beautiful.  The bedding was so comfortable.  By far the best econ hotel we've ever stayed in....and UNDER $100.

I orginally stayed at the Double Tree Hotel and was rather suprised when I was charged $13.00 to park.  After checking-in, I viewed all the services provided and no breakfast provided.  I couldn't believe they charged $13.00 per day.  That's crazy!  Even though the hotel was beautiful, Best Western was the same price, larger room with kitchen and living room, swimming pool, two televisons etc...... I thought well this is great! I paid the same price as Double Tree and received more services and room .

Summary Heading: Terrible service a rat was in our room
Summary: The staff is not friendly, the rooms are roomy but not that clean. Spots on the carpet, rips in some of the couches. Breakfast was not great as well

Summary Heading: We love staying staying here, the service is great and the location is perfect to the freeway.
Summary: The rooms are clean, the staff is friendly and helpful and the location is perfect for us.  We would highly recommend anyone to stay here.

Hotel was in a great location as it was only about 10 minutes to Disney.  The furnishings in the room were very nice and the beds were very comfortable.  The pool area was nice as well.  The downside to this hotel is that the walls between rooms were very, very thin and we could hear neighbors from all sides conversations as well as loud footsteps above us late at night.   We also chose to keep the curtains shut since the windows faced an open hallway where people walking by could see right inside.  The lights in the room were very dim so it made the place seem a little dismal.  Room was clean except for some hairs stuck to the walls in the shower.  Skip the breakfast and eat out, the food was not appetizing unless you want to stick to cereal or the fresh made mini waffles, and

Summary Heading: Not as nice as I expected but would still stay here again.
Summary: When we first arrived at Meridian, I walked around inspecting the room as I always do when we stay somewhere new. The perfumed disinfectant smell was overwhelming when we first walked in which had me alarmed. Once that smell settled, would there be an unwelcome smell replacing it? What were they trying to cover up? Luckily, it must have just  been a housekeeper that likes to go heavy on the spray. I opened the windows to air it out. The room was roomy but a bit dark due to the "green" lighting. Sometimes I wonder if a hotel's true inspiration for going "green" is really just to get away with being a bit cheap. The only other issue with the room was that it was quite humid. I know that California is not known for it's humidity and did notice a slight dampness to the carpet so

We really enjoyed staying at this hotel.  Convenient shuttle bus for Disneyland   Breakfast was very good including scrambled eggs and sausages.  Lots for everyone   The rooms are very spacious and clean.  Heated swimming pool and hot tub were great  We will definitely stay there again on our next trip to Disneyland  Very nicely laid out and landscaped courtyard

Summary Heading: The breakfast room is much too cold. They insist on keeping door open.
Summary: The breakfast room is too cold and they insist on keeping the ourside doors open so it is freezing in the eating area.  There you sit eating off of paper plates in  your coat trying to eat.  Even though the food is free it is not worth it. I think they want you to freeze so you will hurry and leave quickly to make room in the too small a room for the hoard of guests to gobble down their breakfast.

Summary Heading: Made for a happy 80th birthday for my mom!
Summary: My husband and I were taking my 80-year-old mom to Disneyland for her birthday - at her request.  We needed a hotel with a roll-in shower, as Mom has mobility issues, and a suite, to accommodate all 3 of us in one room, because Mom needs some care.  I booked on-line, requesting a 2-queen bed suite with roll-in shower, and was assured by Best Western's corporate reservations representative that this is what we would get.  The room rate, at $99 per night, was a bargain.  We arrived and found out the room type we needed was not available at this property.  Ronya, the front desk manager, offered us a king bed, 2-room suite, with roll-in shower and a sofa bed.  Everything in the suite was brand new.  I didn't want my mom on a sofa bed, so Ronya had the sofa bed mattress removed, and

Summary Heading: Found my go-to hotel in Orange! - Nice hotel with friendly staff.
Summary: This was my 3rd trip out to the city of Orange and how I wish I would've stayed here the first 2 times I went there. Not only does this hotel have really nice rooms perfect for someone who hates going on business trips, the attitude of the staff members couldn't be better.   The rooms are pretty roomy and the beds were incredibly comfortable. That's typically what I hope for when I check into a hotel, and needless to say I fell asleep a happy guy.  I highly recommend this hotel to anyone staying in the Anaheim-Orange area.

We traveled to Disney from the mid-west to get out of the cold for spring break.  First trip to California so we utilized TripAdvisor to help pick a place to stay.  I have to say the room, pool and staff were great.  The breakfast area was busy but well staffed with a good selection for a hotel.   Will definite stay here again.

The walls are paper thin and we could hear every word that was being said down at the pool.  Jacuzzi was ice cold, power went out in entire hotel for hours, no DVD player, hotel service was horrible!  Requested five towles and they said we could only have four a day.  Requested a bunk bed and got nothing after three calls and over an hour later.  When we left we forgot a very expensive pair of earings as well as a very expensive pillow, when i called the hotel after we had been checked out for one hour they said there was nothing found.  Clearly their staff are thieves, rude and liars.  Very disapointingthat they would steel things that are not theirs, the earings were irriplacible.  Bottom line, there are many more places to stay for the same price that have ethics

Decent rooms, decent pool area, breakfast is pretty good. Standard hotel food. Busy at times. Front desk nice and helpful. Hallways a little dirty, kids running around on the weekend and kinda loud. Close to Block at Orange, short drive to Disney. Free parking is a bonus. I would stay again.

Summary Heading: Would come back again - Loved the room and breakfast.
Summary: Brought dad for his 70th bday to Disneyland - stayed 3 nights here - decided to try after reviewing hotels and prices closer to Disneyland that appeared to be over priced and rooms that sounded "worn-out".    *Room was great...lots of space, beds were super, nicely painted rooms. *Everything was very clean including the pool *2 flat panel tv's nice touch and allows folks to watch different things *Our room overlooked pool area *Family's with kids were all well behaved and parents really watched them *Nice coverings over windows if you wish to darken the room and sleep  *Breakfast was busy but good - small fresh, hot waffles were great, hot scrambled eggs, etc......could use one more person managing the front dining room to re-stock things and help wipe down tables as the volume

Summary Heading: Great option if you need some privacy and want a hot breakfast
Summary: We stayed at this Best Western based on other reviews for our recent trip to Disneyland.  The complimentary breakfast saved us at least $20/day and had a great variety, including several hot items (scrambled eggs with and without cheese, sausage and waffles), cereals, pastries, toast, fruit, juices, etc.  It was great having a private bedroom while the kids slept on the sofa sleeper - which they said was very comfortable.  Even though it was over five miles from Disneyland it was an easy drive with quick freeway access.  And three of us used the free wireless high-speed internet - another budget plus.  The breakfast room could get crowded and noisy but it wasn't a big deal.  And even though our room was right by the pool the noise wasn't that bad, especially since they closed at

Wow what a dump this place is. After reading quite a few reviews here on tripadvisor, we decided to stay at this hotel for part of our california holiday. Upon arrival to our suite, there was a huge puddle starting to form in the hallway in front of our door, which was getting bigger as the hours went on. Nothing was done by the management about this. Don't expect to be able to get any extra towels from the front desk either, apparently hotel guests are on towel rations. Absolutely ridiculous. Also, only 1 washer/dryer for the entire hotel. The condition of the bathroom was quite shoddy, poorly maintained and cheap looking. If you don't care about getting good customer service or any value  for your money, and just want to be close to Disneyland, stay at this hotel.

Very beautiful and comfortable rooms. Plenty of room for our family of four. The price was very affordable as well. Right in the middle of everything as well. Very convienent. Highly recommend it!!!! Oh and the beds were heaven! Soooo comfortable!

Summary Heading: A very comfortable, friendly, and convienient hotel.
Summary: I have stayed at this property seven times, and I have never yet been disappointed with the service that is offered. For anyone looking for a place to be for an Orange County vacation, I would recommend the Best Western Plus Meridian Inn & Suites. The staff is very friendly and accommodating towards the guests, the rooms are quite comfortable, and you will be within minutes of all the major attractions and airports in Southern California. This has become the one hotel I have chosen when returning to my hometown area for my visits.

Upon arrival the front desk was very helpful with a glitch that I had, and they continued to offer helpful advice throughout our stay. The rooms are very clean and the bed is very comfortable. The amenities are plentiful and the hotel is the "greenest" I have ever stayed in. For example, the soap, shampoo, and lotion are all in dispensers. The only thing that drove me a bit nuts was the plethora of light switches and trying to figure out which one was for what and some lights were not connected to any of them. The courtyard is beautiful and the breakfast is okay. There is a Mexican restaurant and a small coffee shop across the campus. I look forward to staying there again next year. On small note, bear in mind that there is a hefty room deposit when you arrive.

I was traveling for business and stayed for two nights. The suite were nicely decorated, spacious and the bed is very comfortable. The front desk were helpful and friendly. The complimentary breakfast are good with a great variety of items to pick. Overall, it's an excellent option for business trips.

Overall, I was satisifed with my stay.  The highlights/perks of the hotel are: free WiFi, free parking, spacious rooms, WONDERFUL mattresses, delicious breakfast.  The downfalls are that it is an old hotel that has been cosmetically modernized, carpets are in need of a deep clean (or replacement), there are no utensils/plates/etc. so I had to go out and buy a cutting board, cutlery, etc. so we could save $$ by prepping meals at the hotel, a/c or heat blows directly on one of the beds, and it is very musty smelling.  Also, I did not dare use the glasses or mugs because they were visibly dirty, nevermind (un)sanitized.  It wasn't an unpleasant stay, but I think there are some cleanliness issues.  I am not overly upset about it because the mattresses seem quite new and are very

Summary Heading: Great rooms with a world class staff to match.
Summary: The staff is wonderful, polite, and very professional.  The rooms are well equipped and spacious.  The location is great, and I will continue to stay here in years to come.

Upon arriving, check-in was efficient and quick. The facility seemed to be maintained and updated. Our room was just as the picture had shown. It was nice to be greeted with a welcome pacakge consisting of face wash, shaver, toothpaste, perfume, etc. House cleaning was done daily in a good manner. The electronics were up to date as well as the facilities. The free parking, Wi-Fi and full breakfast was the best perks as it helped us saved. During the duration of our stay, the clerks were very helpful in helping us find directions or inquiries we had.   The highlights would be the luxurious pillows and the decent size of the room. The downturns would be the walls are a bit thin and I found 1 silverfish in the bathroom and the elevator smelled musty. Other than that I would

Did you know that Best Western franchises their hotels? I made a reservation that I had to cancel because of a change in a court date(not under my control) Although I gave nearly a days notice, Rania the GM absolutely refused me a refund. I called Corporate and they agreed with me but said the GM (or owner has the final word) .So far she will not budge. I feel she should not represent the Best Western name.Choose another place to stay because if you have a problem you will probably be out of luck.

This was a lovely place to stay and having its own kitchenette we thought we could do some cooking ourselves. Not the case. There are kitchen cupboards, fridge, sink, coffee maker but no cutlery, utensils, plates. etc. Only glasses and coffee mugs. The remainer was nice and buffet breakfast was outstanding. But not having anything in the cupboards was very disappointing. Close to Disney and The Block which has good factory outlets and TGI Fridays has wonderful food. Even though it was on a busy road it was still remarkably quiet.
Manager Response: Let me start by thanking you for taking the time to write a review regarding your recent stay at our property. Your feedback is very much appreciated and I can assure you that my staff and I use this information to do everything possible to create an enjoyable experience for each of our guests. I agree that all Kitchenettes should have utensils within the room to allow food preparation and serving; however, the suite you reserved was not a Kitchenette suite. We received your booking  for a King Wetbar Suite that doesn't have a stove or a full size refrigerator... I'm not sure if you booked your reservation online or if you spoke to one of Best Western International reservation agents and I sincerely apologize if they didn't explain the difference between the two different types of suites. I also wish you had given us the opportunity to explain the difference during your stay and maybe we could have offered you a discount on an upgrade/Kitchenette suite. Please feel free to contact us if you have questions. Again, thanks for taking the time and have a great day!  Rania

Summary Heading: I booked this for hubby and his boss--they RAVED about it!
Summary: I am the volunteer travel agent for the small company my husband manages.  My requirements for any hotel I book for them are cleanliness and value and this place was a homerun on both requirements.  They were super impressed with the staff, the "green" efforts of the hotel, and the little touches like dimmer switches.  They have already requested to stay there again next year--that has only happened one other time.

Summary Heading: 2 room suite & hot breakfast at a great price
Summary: We were here to visit family and this was the perfect location - also so roomy and quiet (we got a room overlooking the pool and garden area) - with a separate bedroom and very comfortable king sized bed.      A hot breakfast was included at a very reasonable price.

We stayed at the Meridian with our daughters traveling softball team. We have stayed in a lot of hotels thoughout the OC, and found that the Meridian was by far the best value and what amazing rooms! They are an all suite hotel, the rooms have sooo space for your family to move and enjoy with room without being on top of one another. They were soooo clean! Felt soo nice. Not what you expect when you drive up, but soooo worth it! The breakfast in the morning had something for everyone!  We will for sure be using this hotel again for any of our OC area tournaments!  Thank you Rania and your staff!

We would always recommend this hotel.  It is like home away from home.  For us, we can visit all our family and friends, see special places, and all within an easy drive.  We come down from Las Vegas, and once in OC, this is the best place to make your home.  Thank you to all the staff!

I was in town for business and decided to stay hear based on past reviews and I am glad I did. I was given a King Suite which was very big and had a fridge and also a safe (which my computer fits in) in the room which I like. They could use a little more lighting in the room as it took a fews minutes for the energy bulbs to warm up. The first night I was there the fire alarm went off, I also was relocated. The front desk staff informed me that someone had set off the sprinkler system in their room and they would need to relocate me. Did I feel like moving? not really, Do I blame the hotel for some idiot smoking or whatever they did to set the alarm? No. There is a strip center with a few restuarants in it but it is worth the walk (4 blocks) to go to the block of Orange because
This place is great! free breakfast, huge rooms, and a very friendly staff. We have stayed here 2 times now, and never had an issue. we are going to stay here again in March!

Summary Heading: Incompetent staff in face of emergency
Summary: We've stayed at this hotel over 20 times the past 2 years, but can no longer recommend it. A  fire alarm event happened late in the evening, causing flooding to a room near us. The staff appeared confused and unable to determine the cause, initially. Then, after asking to be moved in order to get away from the noise of the cleanup, we were lied to by the staff as to availability of rooms. The staff finally relented and moved us only after we demanded it. There has been a considerable decline in the service and efficiency of this establishment and we recommend you look elsewhere--what a disappointment.
Manager Response: Let me start by saying safety is our first concern. When the fire alarm went off we did call the fire department and were asked where the fire was or was it a false alarm? We were checking the cameras and also the staff ran through the property. The guest who set the sprinkler off, was trying to conceal/fix the fact that they set it off. Unfortunately by them trying to conceal what they had done the sprinkler system was pumping 600 gallons of water per minute into their 3rd floor room. When the fire department was there they told us that they could not leave the water supply (for the sprinkler system) off over the night. We would have to relocate all 3rd floor guests, our only option was to try and get a licensed sprinkler company to come out to replace and fix the sprinkler system that night. Again, safety is our primary concern, but it took time to get a hold of a licensed tech and get them out there in a very short amount of time. Afterwards we got permission from the Fire Department and were allowed to have guests on the 3rd floor and at that point my staff should have put you in the room you requested which was available, I am sorry to say we Failed, since at that point the safety concerned had been addressed and now customer satisfaction was our priority. Your wife and you have been valued guests and we strive to give great customer service.

Summary: We stayed for new year's eve after a long day at California Adventure Park. The staff was friendly. It  is only 1 exit south on the I-5 from Disney. The rooms are clean and spacious with flat TV's. They have a nice fountain and patio area where you can have breakfast.   The breakfast is good and included in the room rate, they have cereal, scrambled eggs, juices, muffins, toast.  I specially liked the waffles. Free parking.  There is a gas station and Starbucks around the block. I will be back and have recommended this hotel to my friends and family.

This hidden gem is tucked away on the south side of Anaheim. I had a great time there and after I noticed their Trip Advisor sticker on their front door I decided to write a review of my recent stay. The front desk was very helpful the second I checked in. The standard room I booked was cozy enough, but I decided to get an upgrade to a suite at a small fee. The suite is much roomier and has a living room and a separate bedroom. I didn't get to use their heated pool and spa, or gym cause I was busy shopping at The Block. There is also plenty of parking. There's free wifi and breakfast. Their rates were competitive but cheaper than the Double Tree or Ayres. I also booked with them directly after I found out the fees that are not disclosed on Expedia and other sites. I would

Starting out, the frontdesk was very helpful and friendly. Upon entering the room, it was a breath of fresh air to walk into a place of quiet, warmth, and cleanliness. It was a nice homey environment with a classy decor, without the pretentiousness and not to mention the cost of an extremely overdone hotel. I really appreciated the two flat screen tvs in each room as well and the furniture was placed strategically so that it could be viewed at all angles-which unfortunately for me, is a top priority. I also appreciated the efforts to conserve with convenient soap dispensers and keycard activated heaters. It'd be a great plus to have automatic dispensers as well! The beds were extremely comfortable with big fluffy pillows-it would be nice to have flat pillows as well for those

Summary Heading: Clean modern living space that made my business trip much more efficient and enjoyable,
Summary: Meridian Inn & Suites was a fantastic choice for my business trip. I'd heard through the grapevine that the hotel was a great place to stay. After my stay this past week I would say that the claim is well deserved.   The hotel is near all the local highways with easy access to restaurants, shopping, and entertainment. The staff is friendly and helpful when we had questions. Every room is nicely furnished and exceptionally clean.   It is with ultimate confidence that I would recommend this location for individuals on business trips as well as those on vacation. After speaking with the individuals I was traveling with I know that they would concur.

Summary Heading: Comfortable, Clean, Great Value. Highly Recommended.
Summary: I stayed at the BW Meridian for two nights while I was in Orange County on business. The hotel is in a great location (near the freeway, close to lots of food spots, and across the street from a mall), and they definitely give you a high quality stay for an extremely affordable price! The Wifi connection was excellent, and the suite style rooms were spacious for doing work. Not only that, but the bed was super comfortable, and it was nice to get a great night's sleep after a long day of work. I'll definitely stay here again when I'm in the area.

Summary Heading: You get what you pay for
Summary: If your like me you are cheap and look for the cheapest hotel with the highest rating. Well I did that and got burned at this place. First night we got a room on the 1st floor and had to listen to the entry doors slamming all night long over and over. they did not have a slow closer on the entry doors so they just slam close. Then in the morning go to take a shower and no hot water. 45min later they fixed it. I asked for a new room they gave us a new room on the 3rd floor only to get a room with a toilet that didn't work. Called the front desk they moved us again to another room.  throughout the night in both rooms you are constantly hearing other peoples water or AC/Heaters running it was rough.on a positive note I will say that the young lady at the front desk was very nice

after Disneyland ,after Knotts we found a clean great priced and nearby hotel next to a shopping and entertainment mall. After many hours with the family out and about this place was fantastic..the staff was great, a little hot breakfast  in the morning and it sets the tone for a great stay..you'd be hard pressed to find even a four star place with the kind of welcome me and my family found here..and we will be doing it again real soon..p.s. its also down next to the crystal cath. I ask you is that fantastic or what...you gotta try it.

Summary Heading: Perfect Hotel for comfort and family for Disneyland Trip
Summary: This hotel was great for a Family.  The One Bedroom Suite had a pull out double bed in the living room couch, and a King Bed in the bedroom.  Perfect size for a family with 2 teenagers.  Also great for business, as with many, I have to take my work with me for leisure trips.  Plenty of outlets to hook up to, free reliable wi-fi, and great breakfast included every morning.  Could not have been better.  Thank you for taking care of me and my family Best Western Meridian Inn!

Summary Heading: Very pleasant we enjoyed our stay
Summary: Great breakfast. Clean rooms. Plenty of parking. Staff was friendly. Restaurants are close by.

TV was broken after we had unpacked and gotten settled. No biggiebut we had to do the moving and even go get the new keys from the front desk. Go to get kids in the tub no hot water...and no call to warn us. Then go to get a washcloth and HUGE cockroach comes out. Call front desk no apology, no offer to clean it up,not even new towels! Talk to GM next day and she lies about issues and only offers to let us out of the next night. Umm 1yr old and 3 yr old and Disneyland tickets so no really helpful. GROSS hotel.

Summary Heading: Meridian Inn & Suites is one of the best hotels of this size that I have stayed in.
Summary: From the beginning the staff was very friendly and helpful.  The suite was very nice and had all that we needed.  The coffee maker and little fridg were an added bonus that we used in our week long stay.  My daughter and I would be up in the wee hours of the morning to go somewhere and the staff was wide awake and could answer our questions on the area.    We were going to Disneyland mostly and found this hotel very convenient but not in the rush of the hotels that are near the gates.  The inner court yard is very nice and the pool looks inviting.  We did not use it because it was raining.  The morning breakfast had a good variety of hot and cold foods and good coffee.  The gentleman that put it together was very helpful.  Will return there again!!!

Was in town for business at  UCI Medical and decided to give this place a try, am I glad I did. From the outside it looks OK but once inside the lobby and the whole hotel seem to transform. The front desk was very helpful and when I opened the door to my suite was I ever impressed. It took a few minutes for the lights to fully turn on but they have done a lot in the hotel to make it a Green Hotel. I am not a tree hugger but I can't stand to see people waste either. Great T.V. selection, but the best was the bed. Half the time I sit at the end of the hotel bed it pops up, this bed was a REAL bed. The breakfast was good and some people eat outside in the courtyard (to cold for me).  After that sleep I got, I will be staying here on all of my furture visits.

Summary Heading: Nice Hotel - Front desk staff could be more helpful/friendly
Summary: We choose this hotel as it was located where we had previously stayed and suited our needs as an affordable and good value-for-money.  Upon arrival we were given our room keys and directions to our room, being a courtyard style hotel (rooms around a central coutyard), we had to make our way to the rear but misjudged where to park, not really a problem, and when we got into the room is was what we expected, although my wife is not a lover of the sinks in the room, and prefers a full bathroom!  Choosing to pay by pre-paid credit card was a bad mistake, as they chose to make a second full payment, and lead me to thinking I had less money that I actually had, the front desk were less than helpful simply repeating that only one payment had been made, and the original internet booking

Really nice staff.  The room was wonderful and exceptionally clean, with a separate bedroom/living area.  A free full breakfast is a huge bonus!  The courtyard was nice with a fountain and well kept pool and spa.  About and exit down the freeway from Disneyland without the touristy image, crowds and congestion.  Well worth the price, will surely stay here again!

Summary Heading: very depressing room, low lighting, small window but cheap!
Summary: Close to stores (still needed car) but a long way to the parks. Cheap and clean but really small, dull room and tiny bathroom.

We had a two room suite (not the full kitchen) and it was far more than I ever expected!  Fabulous bedding, lots of room.  It is close enough to Disneyland that I didn't mind the drive and yet it is away from the craziness and "pay to park" hotels.  GREAT value for the price!  We will definitely be back!!! We have annual passes to Disneyland and travel to Anaheim several times a year.  I have always used Priceline and bid for the cheapest hotel I could find not caring where I stayed.  I have stayed in MANY hotels in the Anaheim area and I have found my "favorite".   Only disappointment was wireless internet.  We had a room towards the back away from the office and couldn't get a connection.  A small issue since we were there for Disneyland anyway.
In addition to the quiet room, there was a full breakfast, washing facilities and a great location.  We would stay there again.

My husband and I stayed at the Meridian so we could visit my sister and her family who live in Santa Ana and spend Thanksgiving with them.  She recommended we stay there and we were a bit concerned because the price was relatively inexpensive and we wondered if the hotel quality would be to our liking.  We have traveled extensively throughout the world and have stayed at the Ritz in Barcelona for $500 a nite and the Hotel Monaco for more than that.  All we can say is - the BW Meridian is absolutely the nicest place we have stayed.  The suite is so very nice - huge rooms; nice kitchen area; the perfect mattress on a king size bed; lovely down comforter.  All in all we loved it and will return.  And the hotel staff was super friendly.

Once again, the same faces (Lorena) greeted my family at check-in, the breakfast "man" was still pumping out waffles and the facilities are always kept well.  This hotel is the HOTEL to stay in when staying in the Anaheim/Disneyland area.  I don't even give it a second thought!  Thanks!

Summary Heading: Excellent choice for families going to Disney
Summary: We needed a two-room suite in a safe area, a clean quiet room in a hotel with a pool and a free breakfast. Although suites are common in the Anaheim resort area, the rates usually start around $150 - pretty steep for this family when you factor in meals and the cost of Disney admission. So this hotel, located in a business park just a few miles from Disneyland, was a great find. The AAA rate for a 2-room suite with full kitchen, sofabed and king-bedded master bedroom, and a free hot breakfast, was less than $80, an incredible deal. The property seems to be 25-30 years old, and the furnishings in our suite were all from that time frame, but in decent condition. No complaints as far as cleanliness or soundproofing. This is a quiet safe area at night - even light sleepers will be

Summary Heading: Followed husband for business - so glad we found this place!
Summary: It was right across the street from my husband's office and only a few miles away from Disneyland.  What more could you ask for?  The service was wonderful - front desk was always incredibly helpful, the breakfast had a nice selection and the maid service was thorough.  Having a separate living room/bedroom was nice with the little ones.  Very surprising for being just a "best western."  Would definitely come again.  Thanks!

Summary Heading: Great Hotel, Great price,Great Room, Great service.
Summary: My hotel room was very spacious, clean, quiet, and exceeded all my expectations.  Staff was very polite, plesant, and helpful to this out of towner. Very close to restaurants. TGIFs restaurant makes great steaks and margaritas. I would stay at this Hotel again in a heartbeat!!  Plus the hotel provides a FULL breakfast every morning till 10am. What more could one ask for!!  Thank-you Best Western Merdian.  Two thumbs up!!

We originally booked two kings but were informed on check in that they didn't have two adjoining rooms of that type. The clerk offered to upgrade one of our prepaid rooms to a king suite for half the rack price.  I was pleasantly surprised to find out that the upgrade would only be $10 a night!  Our price came to $69 (king suite) and $59 (king) dollars a night before tax.   With a king suite and adjoining king, we had plenty of room to stretch out.  The regular kings were a little on the small side, so I'm glad we were able to upgrade and gain the use of the living room.  The beds were extremely comfortable, the rooms were quiet - even facing in toward the swimming pool.  Everything was clean and seemed to have been recently updated. My only complaint about the room, and this is

The room was very nice and roomy,we loved that it had 2 tvs.Breakfast was good but the older man making the waffles was a lil rude.the pool area was nice next time will stay an extra day so kids can take a swim.There are alot of resturants near by.We went to Disneyland and is only about a 5 min. drive.
Our room was very nice & comfortable. The living room area was very comfortable and the breafast provided was great ~!

Summary Heading: Good Service, Big Room, Nice Bed & Pillows
Summary: The staff is very friendly and warm.  Room is huge. Breakfast is good. Location is convenient.  Good quiet neighbor.  Highly recommended!

I took my family to Disney for my daughter's birthday, when I went on tripadvisor they reccommended the Best Western. Just let me tell you that the reviews on this property are correct. The location was a few blocks from the "Block of Orange" which I wish was just a little closer but it is a couple of blocks from the 22 so there was no noise at all. The room was great and well appointed with two flat screens in separate rooms. I liked the fact that they had a frig for our drinks and also a safe for which my computer fit in. We left the car there and just rode the bus back and forth to the park (it was cheaper then parking there). Everything about this stay was great including the staff. If I had one complaint it would have been at breakfast, a liitle boy maybe 6 or 7 loaded his

Stayed in a King standard room.  Only complaint was the room was smaller when compared to most standard hotel rooms.  Seperate vanity area/shower toilet.  The light in the shower was not very bright, yet adequate.  Complimentary breakfast was beyond expectations (eggs, sausage, breads, cereals, waffles, danish, coffee, milk, juice).  Housekeeping did a fine job (we left the room rather late on one day yet still had a clean well stocked room upon our return).  Front desk friendly and helpful.  Clean pool, hot tub, laundry facility.  Nice business neighborhood very close to shopping and highways.  Highly recommend if you're looking for a decent place to stay for a good price.

I stayed her for two nights 10/26-10/28, and paid $59/night. This was money very well spent. I found this hotel to be a lot nicer compared to similar properties in the area.  The rooms have all been recently updated.  Not only did I pay such a low nightly rate, the hotel also provides free breakfast, free internet access, and free parking.  I would definitely stay here again. This is a good choice if you are visiting Disneyland and don't mind a short drive. The value is much better than hotels that are closer Disneyland.

We had a wonderful stay at this hotel.  We were there for 9 nights.  The room was clean and comfortable.  The staff was very helpful and friendly.  The breakfast was great.  The location was super - close enough to Disneyland but not too close, and close enough to everything else we wanted to do.  The price was very reasonable.   We will definitely stay at this hotel again.

Made reservation day of trial was never told while on the phone with reservation representative that there was a 72 hour cancellation policy.  This would mean the reservation that I made would be non-refundable the moment that it was confirmed.  As a trial lawyer sometimes dates and times change in a moments notice.
Went to Disney with the family. The hotel is approximately 4-5 miles away, no real problem. Room was clean, spacious and the bed was awesome. One of the most comfortable beds I have found in a hotel.

Summary Heading: Great Place and Price, 8 minutes from Disneyland
Summary: I grew up in Orange County, and know the advantage of staying in a hotel at the Disneyland Resort; however, you pay a very pretty penny for it.  This place is 8 minutes away, it's quiet, the rooms are very nice, and I got the nicest room I have every stayed in for less than $100. It is 2 minutes from The Block which has about 4 decent restaurants, an upscale bowling alley, a Dave and Busters, several other convenient eating locations, and a great movie theater. Do the math; spend  300-400% less than a hotel at Disneyland, be a quick car ride away, with plenty to do around you, in a room much nicer than the actual rooms at the Grand Californian or the Disneyland Hotel. You won't have the lobby that you do of the Grand Californian, but save the 300 dollars, and go have a drink

Summary Heading: The search for the perfect hotel is hard
Summary: The room was beautiful. The bed was very comfortable, everything clean and perfect. I admit I picked it because I liked the picture of the king size bed. It didn't have that ugly floweral print bedspread like all other hotels. I rated this hotel very high because everything about it was perfect. A hot meal was included, you can sit on the patio beside a wonderful waterfall and eat! And the staff is very helpful and friendly. Stay here. You won't be disappointed at all.  You'll wake up in the morning and stretch and think "I could definately live here."

Summary Heading: I expected good and received perfect- Wonderful stay
Summary: We found this hotel on the internet.  We were so pleased with our stay (hotel, staff and I suspect the staff even may have arranged for the perfect weather and everything.. ) Other guests we met had nice things to say.  Not far from Disneyland and near a great shopping center and a great value.  We will return

The Best Western Meridian in Orange is clean. We stayed here for 2 nights. It's location is not so near disneyland (maybe about 5-8 minutes drive) but it was quiet and the near the Block at Orange (should you decide to skip disney for a day and  go shopping). The breakfast which was included was fiiling.They served cereals, bread, eggs, sausages, waffles and juices and coffee. A great way to start the day before heading to Disney. The bed and pillows were very comfortable. After a long day at Disney,wewere so tired and slept so well. We will go back again the next time we're in OC :)

Summary Heading: For the Value and Location a great place to stay.
Summary: The only problem we had with the stay was in the room itself. We must have gotten the last room of its kind do to our late arrival. The air conditioning unit and refrigerator in the room both had loose fan mounts as they rattled during the night and required ear plugs to drown it out so you could sleep. Otherwise we loved the complimentary breafast, pool, spa and excercise room. Couldn't be in a better location to get to all the attractions in the area within a quick timeframe.

Just got back from Disneyland.  Myself, husband and two young children stayed here.  The first night was incredibly quiet.  I thought we were the only ones there!  But the next night was just as quiet.  Rooms are very spacious.  Clean hotel.  Good breakfast in the AM for being free and each staff person we had contact with was exceptionally nice.  We even got to use the hotels computer for printing out boarding passes which made it much easier once we got to the airport.  definitely will stay here again.  its not far from disneyland and worth every quiet moment!  Loved it!

My co-worker convinced me to stay here instead of the doubletree, I am glad they did. The place is OK from the outside, but inside I got a HUGE Suite. It came with plasma tv's, frig, microwave and even a safe. The best part on my stay had to be the bed, I slept like a baby. I didn't use the pool but the gym has a good amount of equipment (squeezed in). Each machine has it's own tv. Breakfast was good and the staff was nice. I will be coming back.

Don't let the facade fool you.  Best Western in Orange offers a very comfortable stay.  We had a comfy king sized bed in its own room.  We had two large LCD TV's (one in the bedroom and the living space), as well as a microwave and mini-fridge.  Breakfast had a decent selection of juices, fruit, eggs, cereals and sausages.  Pool area is ok.  The water was freezing cold so we didn't swim as much.  Gym is designated to one tiny room.  Location is superb.  It's five minutes away from Disneyland / Anaheim resort area via the I-5 freeway.  The Block at Orange shopping center and cinemas as well as places to eat are just a few steps away.  Highly recommended for anyone looking at alternative locations for a Disneyland vacation.

We stayed in a king suite.  Beds were comfortable.  Shower was good.  We did not use the pool.  Breakfast was below my expectations.  No bagels.  Cream cheese only on request..  But overall not bad. The hotel is centrally located, close to freeways.

Just the right distance from Freeway so noise does not intrude..got the best night sleep ever! Had a very nice courtyard with pool and sun loungers. Room was well equipped and clean. Staff very helpful with local Info.

The hotel room was spacious ( 2 room suite), clean and pretty comfortable. Near to Disney Land. The breakfast had a good spread. The reception staff was also very helpful. All in all a very good hotel.

If you need to stay in northern Orange County, but are thoroughly depressed at the prospect of finding a quiet, spacious, well-located, relatively low cost place to stay with quality service - you are not alone!  For years we've tried to find a place to stay away from both the 'amusement park' hotels/motels and the shoreline, both of which can be noisy AND expensive.  During our search, we've stayed in some pretty dumpy places as well as overpriced noise-boxes.  But with the development of west Orange (in the area around UC Irvine's Hospital, Best Western has opened a real Gem in the Meridian on The City Drive.  It's close to everything as a tourist, from the Big A to Disneyland, close to freeway connections, shopping (Main Place and The Block) yet is quiet and spacious.  My

Everything about the hotel was better than expected, from the huge room and ginormous shower head, to the full breakfast every morning and the friendly staff.   The hotel is in a nicer part of town, just down the road from Disney, the Angels stadium and the beach.   If you are looking for a gret place to stay, this is it. Great location, great price.

We chose this hotel as it was outside the big city (LA) and still close to many ammenities in Anaheim. The loctaion made for easy access to the freeways etc when we went on day trips to beaches. The breakfast included a great spread and much variety to choose from. The rooms were always clean and the hotel boasts an eco friendly atmosphere which we appreciated. afordable and rooms have mini fridges so if you want to stock it with food for picnic lunches for beach trips it's ideal!

I decided to stay here with my family as I decided to take them to Disney before school starts next month. i looked at all of the reviews and decided to give it a try. When I pulled up I can't say that I was impressed with the building, though it was very clean. Inside I was greeted by two gentleman a Kevin & Ray who pulled up the reservation and checked us in. They were very helpful in explaining that the bus picks you up infront of the hotel to take you to Disney and it only cost a $1 for the kids. This is the best thing as I didn't have to drive, park and walk a mile to the park. when we checked in our room I have to say that it was great, we had a REAL two room suite. After the kids went swiming we came back to the room and the kids watched cartoons and I got to catch the

Summary Heading: Clean, large room with a convenient location and very firm beds
Summary: We stayed overnight while attending an Angels Game.  Very convenient location for the stadium, less than a 5 minute drive.  Room is very spacious, love the green features and it was very clean.  The kitchen was great but had no utensils and wasn't at all stocked.  We got cup a noodles from the snack machine but then had nothing to eat them, quite a surprise.  some may like the beds however they were very firm as were the dense pillows.   Great value booked through AAA and fine for a night in Orange.
I never got to stay at this hotel due to the terrible customer service I received. Very unsatistied with the insensitivity of the staff and especially the manager of this hotel. BAD!

Great hotel, great location, great staff, great value.    As expected (Orange County in July) expect a lot of kids....so if you want to sleep-in request a room that doesn't face the pool.  I loved the free internet and parking....which is the reason I picked the hotel in the first place.  The free breakfast was also good.    After staying here I have a new found respect for the Best Western brand.

I had business in the area and dicided to stay here because one of my fellow business travlers recommended it to me.  When I got there I was greeted by a young gentleman and he was very good in explaining everything about the hotel. When I got in my room I couldn't beleive how big the King Suite was and it was REALLY two rooms.  What i wasn't sure of first was the lights as this is a  green hotel and the light bulbs take a minute to turn on bright. The shower has the soap,shampoo, and conditioner mounted on the wall which was great, I wish my wife was with me as she using the tiny bottle usually first and doesn't say anything to me until I am in the shower and wet that it is all gone. The room came with free wireless internet, safe, fridge/microwave which is a nice touch as I

My husband and I were extremely satisfied; everything was just as advertised! We were so worried that the hotel web-site description and pictures would not match…but we were pleasantly surprised! Actually….the web-site didn’t do this hotel justice! We are returning in a few months with family and friends…great value, great king suite, great customer service…great location…BEST, BEST, BEST!

Summary Heading: Bargain price for good quality stay
Summary: This hotel is surrounded with busines builidngs, it's quiet.  Ample of free parkings, complimentary breakfast with good clean food, just enough before going to Disneyland. Very comfy bed with good sized pillows (a lot better than Encore hotel in Vegas).  Beddings overall is clean.  The only disadvantage is the AC gets loud periodically.

We chose this hotel after reading several reviews. I was a bit weary, because of a couple of the other reviews. Our room was awesome. It had a king bed, pull out sofa, a kitchen(which we didn't use) and a nice bathroom. The air conditioner worked awesome. The staff at check in were great. Very accomodating. The breakfast was good. Sausage, eggs, waffles, juice, coffee, toast, muffins, and assorted pastries. The swimming pool area was nice and clean. For the price of this hotel it was well worth the stay and will stay here again. Its about 5 miles from disney, but they do have a shuttle to take you to disney, Not sure about the cost of that. They also had internet access which was free.
Close to freeway access and a modest distance to Disneyland. Nice pool, clean spacious room. The breakfast is a great value-add. Staff were the best.

Summary Heading: Better rooms than the one in disney resorts
Summary: First of all, if you out there looking for a better room, this place is an a must...I assure you that you are not going to be disappointed...The staff are great...The place is about 5 miles away from disneyland. There is an outdoor mall nearby...There was one thing that I kind had a first bad impression was the garbage bin. I am suggesting to the management to move that somewhere else because they really smell and its just right next to the outdoor dining table. Overall, it was a great stay. I would definitely comeback and stay. Yeah! Disney resort hotels are just right around the corner, great amenities, but who cares, they are way too abusive with their price, even the theme parks, if it wasn't for the kids, I would have never ever planned to visit the park. I've stayed one of

Summary Heading: Adequate Motel But Service and Sleep Quality Lacking
Summary: I have stayed in three similiar hotel/motels in the past two weeks.  My criteria for a good night sleep is clean, quiet, and comfortable.  The Best Western Mederian Inn and Suites provided one out of three criteria:  the room was large and clean.  Since it's a motel on a busy road near Disneyland, there was road noise at night.  The pillows are memory foam and not comfortable for those of us who enjoy a medium to soft pillow.  Since I have stayed in two other properties prior to this one in the last two weeks, I got used to excellent customer service.  The customer services at the Best Western Meridian Inn and Suites is lacking.  The check-in was long as the desk person kept answering the phone while I was checking in.  Then, I asked for two extra blankets (one for each bed),

Summary Heading: A very friendly, comfortable well priced hotel in a convenient location...loved it!
Summary: I have to say that the staff here were absolutely top notch!!  They made us feel very welcome and nothing at all was too much trouble.  The rooms have great decor, and were spacious and comfortable with a great shower especially in light of the reasonable cost to stay here... the complimentary breakfast was the best free breakfast I have ever tasted with freshly made waffles, scrambled egg and sausage as well as toast, cereals, pastries and muffins.  The pool was a good size and the area was very clean and not at all crowded.  The hotel  was also easy to find and in a very convenient location for us... there was a bus to the parks for a nominal fee too (although we chose to drive for our own convenience).  I would stay here again in a heartbeat!!

The staff was very helfull with information. The room was large with 2 rooms. It had a flat screen tv in living area and on wall in bedroom. Pillow top beds with great pillows. FREE!!! great full breakfast with a very nice older man servicing the room, indoor and outdoor tables. Room was very quiet. Large pool, Spa Great stay, Best in years, very reaonable.
This property is located with easy access to freeways, excellent amenities, friendly staff and quality rooms.

Summary Heading: I loved it so much I didn't want to go home
Summary: The waffles in the morning were delicious. The pool, jacuzzi & fountain in the courtyard were beautiful. All of the employees were polite & accomodating.

We stayed for 4 nights.  The room was comfortable and clean.  We went to Disneyland a couple of times during our stay and the breakfast was a great way to start the day without having to worry about finding a restaurant.  This hotel is very accomodating for families.

This is a very good hotel.  We stayed for 6 nights.  The hotel front desk was very friendly and helpful.  We asked for an extra blankets, and it was delivered to our room in less than 10 minutes.  The room has very comfortable with a king size bed.  The soft bed was a bit used/old to me, but my son had no problem sleeping in it.  The room had a small refrigerator which was very useful for longer stay.  A small microwave was very handy as well.  The hotel provided shower gel, lotion, shampoo and conditioner in dispenser so we didn't need to worry about not having enough for 3 of us.  The air conditioner was central unit so it's not constantly noisy and it's digital setting.  Having a real hot breakfast was definitely a plus.  Every morning, we had hot oatmeal, scrabble eggs,

Summary Heading: Clean, comfortable, quiet, and convenient to Disney
Summary: Was very pleased with this Best Western, especially comfort and cleanliness. The staff is helpful and friendly.  If you plan a trip to Disneyland and don't want to drive to the park yourself,  the Anaheim Resort Transit makes a stop here.

me and my partner stayed at this hotel from 06/27/ 2010- 06/29/2010. we found the hotel was dirty and not well maintaned. the carpet was dirty. and the shower head was broken. we told management two times before they came to fix it.  the guy who fixed it dint do it right and we had to tell the hotel again. they claimed they fix it and gave us a very difficult time.     the management in this hotel is incompetent and inept.

Checked into the hotel and there was two things broken in the bathroom. Brought it up to the front desk to fix and it was not fixed. Asked again and only one thing was partially fixed and was told that the other issue would be taken care of the following day. Again (3 requests) it was not fixed, yet the hotel wrote down it was fixed. Spoke to front desk about issue and the fact that they refused to fix an issue and lied to a guest about when it would be fixed. Staff called me nit-picky and threw me out of the hotel. Worked refused to give name, and refused to let me speak to a manager. A hotel that refuses to fix issues, lies to guests, and make up stories and is a place that no one should stay at. I will never go back to this hotel and would never ever recommend it to anyone.

Summary Heading: Nice hotel but some spiffing up would help
Summary: We stayed one night while visiting the Bowers Museum in Santa Ana.  It is in a great location, close to Disneyland, Angel Stadium, The Pond and other popular Orange County attractions.  The rooms are large and well appointed and we really enjoyed the conveniences therein.   I only have two issues which need improvement.   The primary one is that I thought the grounds were not well attended.  Many of the plants were half dead or needed water and grooming.   The public ashtrays had old dirty sand and were full of cigarette buts.  The external carpets were either dirty of needed to be vacuumed. In general the overall appearance of the grounds seemed shabby and in need of renovation and better maintenance.   The other issue was the breakfast.  They had a hot breakfast which was

Just returned from a two-night stay at the Best Western Meridian.  We chose this hotel based on its location to the Disney parks and other positive reviews - we were not disappointed!  The location was great.  Not within walking distance, but just a short drive.  Room was big enough and king bed was super comfortable.  Free parking and free morning breakfast buffet were included and that is always a plus.  Hotel is also going green which was nice to see.  Would stay here again if in the area.
This hotel was BEAUTIFUL!  The staff was WONDERFUL!  They exceeded my every expectation!  I enjoyed a newly renovated king-room- It was CLEAN. Oh, and the complimentary breakfast was AWESOME!!!

The location is perfect, me and my Boyfriend stayed at this hotel because that night of check in we were going to the Angels baseball game and it was just a 5 minute (if that) cab ride and right down the street from the Orange Block and not far at all from Disneyland which we went the next morning. The room itself was very nice and the staff was friendly.  The only thing that I did NOT like about the room was the pillows. There was two that were way too soft and two that seriously weighed 5 pounds and killed my neck..no joke. And the issue with the AC was rediculious! you have to put your key in the light switch to keep it on, because it is "energy efficient".  We had to get up numerous times through out the night to get the stupid thing to stay on.   Other than that we liked

Summary Heading: Owner needs to loosen the purse strings a bit!
Summary: We stayed at this place 3 nights, and came away with the feeling that owner and staff (all from same family it seemed) were stingy to the point of paranoia. The room was a suite with kitchenette (microwave, fridge, cabinets, coffeemaker, sink/faucet), so I expected dishes and coffee mugs - nope, this was a wet bar, not a kitchenette I was told. But they did send coffee mugs eventually. Breakfast was slim pickings, with no servers, and made more uncomfortable with the elderly owner eying your every move! Laundry room for a 350+ room property was a single washer and dryer pair, that has a line waiting for it! Location is very good, and the surrounding area was convenient for restaurants, mall, Disney, Knotts. Too bad the ownership is not service-oriented and old school thinking of

Good services over all. The suite is spacious and comfortable. Just the noise of bathroom was very annoying. (Bathroom is the only reason that we have to complain about). Good location. Good amenities. Staff are very nice.

Summary Heading: Extremely clean and comfortable, excellent value
Summary: The service was excellent, 2-room suite was clean, quiet, spacious and comfortable, location was perfect, and the free breakfast buffet was delicious.  Very comfortable bed, 2 flat screen TVs, free WI-FI was quick and easy, very close to the Block of Orange, shopping, restaurants and freeways.  Also also got a great gift package of useful items.  Excellent value - we thoroughly enjoyed our stay!!
The rooms were amazing, the staffs were friendly, and the location was perfect. Definitely would go back to this hotel again.

This hotel really made our stay in America wonderful. The staff was very helpful and always friendly. The rooms were wonderful and clean and the beds were very comfy. The location of the hotel was great. It was close to everything but not to busy.  As we are from australia we had many questions and the staff was always more then happy to help us with whatever we needed including mailing things for us.  If we were to stay in orange again this would be the hotel I picked. we really loved staying here.

Summary Heading: Best Value, Service, Location near Disneyland, CA
Summary: This is by far the best value hotel we have stayed at in our numerous visits to Disneyland.   Proximity:  Close enough to Disneyland, yet far away from the hustle and bustle. In a business district, so weekends are quiet  Room: Spacious with all required amenities such as Fridge, Microwave, Iron, Coffee Maker (things that you can actually use). Also very clean and recently renovated so good as new  Service: Courteous and prompt. The supervisor came in to replace battery in the smoke alarm which started beeping.  Value: Best value for money. AT $99 per room for a 2 room suite near DIsneyland is awesome.   Comments: We are definitely staying at this place again.

A great hotel, away from the hussle & bussle of nearby theme parks. Very clean rooms, air-conditioning can be a little noisy at times. Nice place to relax in the jaccussi and pool after a hectic day. Staff could not be more helpful, was informed on departure that if I found a price for a future stay cheaper on another website, they would price match if you booked direct with them. Free breakfast served daily and also free highspeed internet. Near to Orange shopping mall and resturants. Overall a good value for money hotel in a good location that I would recommend.

Summary Heading: Might be the BEST motel we've ever stayed at!
Summary: Months before our vacation, we did a lot of research of motels in the Disneyland area. The Meridian kept coming up as one the favorites. We decided to take a chance on it and were not disappointed. The suite was spacious and clean, especially with a 14 and 10 year old in tow. The location was the best possible for going to Disney, Knott's and the beaches. There was shopping and dining within just a few blocks. And the Breakfast room was kept in order annd well stocked. The staff was extremely friendly and outgoing. Sometimes a motel can determine whether your vacation was fun or not. Well simply, as my son put it, this was the greatest trip of our lives.

We booked this hotel mostly because of the suite.  We have a teen, a twen, and a baby (who sleeps with us) So it was SO nice to have the king suite, and the two older kids sleeping in the living room.  They had their own plasma TV, and loved it. Our room had a fantastic, comfortable bed, and another plasma.   We loved the location.  Very close to disney.  The breakfast was awesome!  Eggs, oatmeal, sausage, waffles, cereal, toast, muffins, and other pastries, along with coffee/juice. Only a couple issues - One, I wish the laundry facilities were open later than 10pm.  Most families are gone late, and it would be perfect to come home and throw a load in, same with the workout room. (love that there is laundry)  Even would be nice if the pool would be open past 10 (maybe midnight?)

Summary Heading: Great and accomodating service, convenient location right off the highway
Summary: When I arrived on property I was greeted with a warm and friendly smile.  I wasn't sure of what to expect as far as the quality of the room, but was pleasantly surprised that it was nice.  I appreciate that they are environmently friendly and have a unique system for energy conservation.  The only complaint was the quality of the towels I had, they seemed thin and worn.   Not a bad stay especially with breakfast included.  Parking was spacious and free.
We booked a suite and it was perfect, the size of the room and decor was excellent. Loved the breakfast and the kids really enjoyed having their own plasma TV.
Close to disneyland...we had a wonderful time...loved our stay...awesome hotel....only downturn is the cellphone reception inside the room...almost non-existent......

The Meridian is beautiful!! It has been remodeled and upgraded.  Very nice furnishings, wonderful bed, clean room.  The pool and jacuzzi are very nice - WARM!  Breakfast was great - more than just continental - eggs, sausage, waffles, and the expected continental fare. Very friendly staff, great location, quiet.  We have been staying here for the last 4 years when visiting our son at Chapman Univ. - from 4 years ago to now - definite improvement!!  Our guests were pleasantly surprised at the quality and price of the rooms.  We will be back!

Summary Heading: Perfect place to rest all our heads after Disneyland
Summary: It was about 8 minutes from Disneyland and there wasn't much to choose from in the way of eating around the hotel. The outside of the building is a little dark But check in and out was fast and easy, the rooms were nicley decorated, clean and spacious. For the $$ this place was a pleasant surprise, we enjoyed the warmed pool in the morning and it had a decent continental breakfast. We would definantley go back to this hotel again.

We stayed here after a trip to Disneyland.  It was a short drive from the park and a super nice hotel at half the price of hotels by Disneyland.  It was a two room suite with a flat screen TV in each room and a kitchenette with micowave, sink, fridge, and small table for four.  The free breakfast was the best I've had.

With the overwhelming good reviews, I figured that the minimal bad reviews were just written by picky travelers. I was impressed that the hotel was "green" and we only stay a smoke-free locations. Unfortunately, the bad reviews were spot on.  Our first impression was good. Very close to our destination, and the exterior was clean. The lobby was a litlle dated, but the young man at the front dest was very nice. Another traveler was right about the corridors and elevators-old. I would classify this hotel as a motel since the corridors are all exterior, but at least that means that you can air out your room if it has been closed up for awhile. The rooms were spacious and nicely furnished. The bad news is that once were were settled in we noticed some brown food sprayed on the wall

Summary Heading: I am extremely picky, but this hotel was great...
Summary: We stayed at the Best Western for 2 nights at the end of April.  From the moment we walked in, the staff was extremely accomodating and friendly (we had a request for a huge band-aid and 2 spoons which they produced right away).  I am extremely picky about hotels and usually spend hours picking out the "perfect" hotel based on guest reviews and photos...  this hotel was fantastic.  We got a great deal on our room (a king bed and a queen sleeper sofa for our 2 year old).  The room had a separate living area, 2 flat-screen tv's and a small kitchen area.  Our bed was super comfortable, except for 2 of the pillows were HUGE and weighed about 10 pounds each...  if you had a pillow fight, you could knock someone out...  but we found additional pillows in the closet.  The only problem

Summary Heading: Nice hotel. We stayed here for three...
Summary: Nice hotel. We stayed here for three nights and we were very satisfied with the accomodaions and service.

Summary Heading: Perfect for our 2nd anniversary disneyland trip
Summary: Good location (close to mall, freeway and disneyland); clean, safe & quiet building; large, clean & well decorated rooms; VERY comfortable mattress; tasty breakfast; helpful staff. Would definitely stay there again!

Summary Heading: Old & Dirty with Bugs as a Bonus
Summary: If you like old, musty, filthy rooms, then stay here.  As a bonus, you might even get free bugs - we had 1 silverfish and another unidentifiable bug.  A new countertop & flatscreen tv, does not make the hotel "newly rennovated," as stated in the hotel's misleading description.  This place is so old, the whole place should be demolished.  The hallways & elevator were old & unmaintained.  We had 1 tiny trash can, so our trash spilled out onto the floor.  Unfortunately, we had to suffer through 3 itchy nights, because there was no cancellation policy.  This was by far the worst hotel in which we've ever stayed.  Stayed here because of the prior glowing reviews, which must have had far lower standards.  Regretted not spending a little more to stay at a cleaner place.  Will never

We choose this hotel because it was quite near from Newport beach and Anaheim. Great value, the bed and blankets were heavenly! Very clean and everything was quite new in our room. There was lot of parking lots and a basic breakfast. Staff was nice and kind. Free wi-fi. Very pleasant stay, I would definitely recommend. There is a big mall near the hotel and it is also near the Disneyland.

We stayed here back in February because the price was right and we were satisfied with our stay. We decided to take another quick trip down to DL last weekend and booked again at the BW Meridian Inn and Suites.  When we look for hotels around Disneyland we are honestly looking for the best value.  We take into consideration the number of stars, amenities included, parking/resort fees, distance from the park, breakfast available, room size, and THE PRICE! When it comes down to it, if you don't mind driving 10-12 minutes to get to DL then I would recommend staying here.  The BW Meridian has large rooms, comfy beds, updated decor, a quite environment, a decent breakfast, no extra fees, right next to The Block at Orange mall,  and the best price.  If this hotel were to charge more

Summary Heading: We really enjoyed our stay and do it again in a future
Summary: Our stay was great.  A quiet athmosphere and rooms very clean.  Close to places where we wanted to go.  For example, Disneyland, Knotts Very Farm, Shopping Mall, and restaurants.

This was a great stay. Loved the fact that they allowed no pets (severe allergies). Staff was always very friendly & helpful.
