One wish though for the breakfast would be to have eggbeaters and more fresh fruit for those on very restrict menus. Great value, had inroom safe (which was very important). Some of the guests were hogging the hot tub for hours so there should be some sort of time restrict.  Hand sanitizers for people going to the breakfast room & mandatory that they use them prior to digging in would be good (we brought our own but we were the only ones).  The parking was very good and loved that it was self parking and free.  Had to use the laundry and the dryers actually did the trick after just one cycle (usually it is not the case in hotels).  Room was always

Summary Heading: Great place to stay near Disneyland
Summary: The rooms are spacious, very clean and comfortable, the breakfast and service in dining room was wonderful and the front desk staff was also very helpful and courteous. We highly recommend this hotel.

The rooms are bigger than other suites out there for less money per night. The upgrades were amazing with "green" features like dispensers for soap, lotion, shampoo and conditioner. The king size bed that we chose was very comfy! The only set back was it became rather humid when showers were on for awhile. Otherwise, great service and rooms!
We had a spacious suite with nice amenities (except the gym).  Great location and great value.

Very clean and well maintained. Enjoy vaiety of hot breakfast items FREE, in the court yard or in the dining area behind the conference room. Perfect place to stay for a family on vacation. Shuttle available to Disneyland. Perhaps, stay upstairs on a busy summer day, away from the pool and hot tub.

Summary Heading: Great stay at a great price!
Summary: I was pleasantly surprised with location to attractions, comfort of room, price of room, friendly staff, and most of all very surprised at the continental breakfast!Wow!!!Eggs, waffles, sausage, good coffee, muffins!!!Great!!!They provided friendly service, free parking, $4 round trip shuttle to Disneyland!!! I would have rated the hotel a 5 but the walls were a little on the thin side. Definitely would recommend or stay again!!!Loved the time in California!!!What a beautiful city and great time!!!Thank you!       Chris Memphis Tn.

Summary Heading: One Annoyance, Otherwise a GREAT FIND
Summary: My stay was very pleasant and I'm planning on returning with my entire family.  My room did have a strong, annoying smell, and there was no way to air it out (windows do not open, I ran the bathroom fan to no effect).  Next time I will be a bit more picky and check the room before settling in.    Other than that, the new decor is very nice, the staff was cheerful and professional, and my room (king suite) was crazy spacious for the price.  I really appreciated the fridge, microwave and sink, free parking, free wifi, clean grounds and landscaping.  Breakfast was okay, but not delicious.  But, like I say, I am planning on staying here on a regular basis now that I've discovered it.    If you are looking for safe and clean with lots of amenities at a fair price, check this place

My wife and I, along with our three young children, stayed at the Best Western Meridian in Orange, CA for seven nights in March of 2010.  We had a wonderful stay!  I would strongly recommend this hotel to any family who wants to go to Disneyland on a limited budget. That was certainly the case for us.  At $87.00 a night, we felt like this hotel and its ammenities were a great value.  The $87.00/night included: A one bedroom suite(with King bed and pull-out sofa bed), Free-parking, Free WiFi internet access, and Free Breakfast(which included: cereal, toast, muffins, pastries, scrambled eggs, sausage, waffles, fruit, juice, milk and coffee.  The breakfast wasn't extravagant, but it was satisfying.  The Hotel itself doesn't look like much from the outside, resembling more of an

We spent four nights at this lovely hotel.  We stayed in a king suite with a pull-out couch.  We had a full fridge and stove that we used every day.  The room was very spacious and beautifully decorated.  The front desk staff was very helpful and very pleasant.  They went out of their way to help make our experience at Disneyland and Universal Studios more pleasurable.  Disneyland is very close and a shuttle comes every hour so you can come and go from Disneyland as many times as you want.  A shuttle for Universal Studios also comes to the hotel so the location is perfect.   The hotel staff is knowledgeable about both shuttles and will book the Universal shuttle for you. Laundry is available and a continental breakfast is offered every morning.  The food is very good and the

I was very pleased with the quality of this hotel. The staff were professional and polite. The rooms were nicely decorated and included amenities that you could actually use! The breakfast was a nice variety of items that included a meat choice which was nice. I would definitely come back again!

The hotel room was great-we had a two room queen suite-and the beds were very comfortable. The breakfasts were very nice, much more there than a typical continental breakfast with eggs, sausage, freshly made waffles, and more. The shuttle that passed through for Disneyland was very convenient and affordable ($3 a day for all day use per adult). We would absolutely stay there again!

Summary Heading: Room was spacious, location was good, great value!
Summary: We stayed here for a trip to Disneyland with our two kids- one teenager and one six year old.  Overall, I give the place a "thumbs up."  Our room was great!  We loved that the living room separated from the bedroom, and it came complete with a refrigerator and microwave.   This way, we were able to spread out, and those who got up early didn't disturb those that were sleeping.  We got the spaciousness of a suite for the price of a hotel room.  The room had dispensers on the wall for shampoo and such, so we didn't have the typical hotel struggle of a family of four sharing one mini-shampoo bottle!   There was some other sample amenities provided, which was an added touch.  It was less than ten minutes from Disney... we liked this.  It was far enough away not to get caught in the

We were pretty disappointed in our stay and we noticed several other guests were disappointed as well.  This is an OK property, but the staff clearly didn't "get it."  The staff seemed unable to think outside of the box when it came to superior customer service.  The beds were not comfortable, and the pillow was as hard as a rock.
Manager Response: Dear LuteSmith,  Thank you for sharing your experience from your recent stay with us at Best Western Meridian Inn and Suites on Tripadvisor.  It was with concern to read about your feedback regarding the issues with your room.  Our property has always had a 99% satisfaction feedback from our guests and many of them have purchased the same beds directly from our vendor.   Also, in each of our rooms we offer two different types of pillows, one of them being soft and the other being hard. This is to ensure that we satisfy the various preferences of all our customers.   Once again, thank you for taking the time to post your review on TripAdvisor. We look forward to welcoming you again at Best Western Meridian Inn and Suites  Sincerely, Rania General Manager

Summary: We stayed at the Meridian because of a medical appointment for my wife at the UCI Medical Center, just a couple of miles north.  The hotel was clean and friendly, and with an internet rate of $59/night, a great value in this area.  The location provides easy access to multiple freeways, making getting around pretty straightforward.     We really enjoyed the hot tub, too.    The only negatives-- 1. We had to request maid service our first day, which wasn't a big deal as we were leaving for a few hours. 2.  We were provided with only 2 bath towels--it would have been nice to have a couple of more.  We did NOT request more, so I assume we'd have gotten them if we did.
Great hotel and convieniently located to Disneyland and shopping but also to my business meetings

I had a wonderful experience with this hotel.  I wanted to save 200 bucks on the room, and this was a perfect place to get a great deal.  For under 500 bucks we had a suite, which was a livingroom and bedroom suite with a wet bar for 2 nights and 2-2 day park hopper passes.  I thought it was an excellent price.  Upon arrival the staff was very friendly and helpful, providing me with all the information I needed for my stay and my way around town.  The shuttle to Disneyland only takes 10-15 minutes to get the park, which is excellent.  Breakfast: we finally tried it at the end of our stay and it was fairly good for being free and continental.  There was sausage (thank god cause I hate those free breakfasts without the meat!) and waffles, among other things.  You can get as much

Summary Heading: Very pleased with room and the fact they are green!
Summary: I was very pleased with the romm and it/s size.  Beds were very comfortable.

The rooms were clean with very comfortable beds; it is in a quiet area, but close to main freeways/shopping/restaurants. The staff was pleasant and an ample breakfast was included in our very reasonable rates.

We spent 4 nights at this hotel. From the outside it's not very impressive. You walk into your room and it is clean with very nice decor. The beds were comfortable, even the sofa bed was without the usual springs and bars poking your back.  The breakfast is just ok, not real flavorful but good selection and plenty of it. Instant coffee though, so I made coffee in the room. We had one rude front desk employee but everyone else was wonderful.  Very close to Disneyland, buy your tickets at the hotel desk and get a discount.
This hotel was a very good price and close to where I had business.

This was a surprisingly good value!  The room was spacious - very comfortable beds with nice linens and excellent pillows - 4 per bed with 2 being the memory foam.  There was a small kitchen with mini fridge and microwave but no dishes or utensils.  2 flat panel tv's were nice.  The bathroom was small but clean - only one sink in our room but it worked out for us.  The free breakfast was pretty mediocre - tastless scrambled eggs, bad "pastry" - awful coffee!  Go with the waffles - they were very good!  We took the ART to Disneyland and even though they really didn't run as often as we thought - they had only 1 per hour on our route, it was still more convenient than driving.  We liked the free parking here.  We didn't use the pool (too cold for us Arizonans!) or spa but they

I wrote a review back in Aug 2009 and gushed about how wonderful BWM Inn was - and they were fantastic...back in Aug.  Since then, we have stayed here a total of 4 different times, and up until this last trip - we wouldn't have stayed anywhere else.  I booked about 1 1/2 months ahead of time, and requested that we have a TOP FLOOR ROOM.  We have always had a top floor room, so didn't know how awful it was to be located anywhere else.  Granted it was a busy time of the year (New Years), we felt that BWM Inn never let us down in 4 previous times we had been loyal to them.  We arrived at about 10pm on a Wednesday and checked in.  When we walked in, there were 2 employees behind the desk; Lorena (whom I don't really care for since she is very indifferent when she provides what I'm

Summary Heading: I had a pleasant stay at the Best Western - Meridian Suites
Summary: I found the staff to be very helpful. My room was impeccably clean each day when I returned to it after work. The heat worked well. It was reasonably quiet. The bed was comfortable. I would stay there again. It was conveniently located for me. Both the Mexican and Asian food places in the small strip across the parking lots were excellent and quick. If you are looking to go out for meals, there is a large shopping area with many restaurants about 2 miles away called the Block at Orange. The King suites are very roomy. Breakfast was very good.

Stayed in location convenient to John Wayne Airport and Garden Grove, Ca.  Room was large with a sitting area connected by double doors to the bedroom.  A TV was in both the sitting area and bedroom.  The sitting area had an adjoining area with a refrigerator and sink.  A desk and chair were also available in the sitting area.  A well prepared buffet breakfast was offered each morning.  Selections at the buffet breakfast included juice, coffee, milk, scrambled eggs, sausage links, fruit, several cereals, a varied assortment of sweet rolls, bread, and made to order belgian waffles.  All staff were very pleasant and helpful when called upon.

Summary Heading: Great place to stay, clean, quiet and close to everything!
Summary: This hotel is located in a very quiet section of town and not very visible, and I like that.  I come to the Anaheim/Orange area for work and have stayed in many hotels.  I like the Meridian because I do not have to tend with vactioners or loud traffic.  The hotel is close to the Block at Orange for dining and entertainment.  It is also close enough for my business needs, but enough off the beaten path to not be overrun by tourists.  The price is very good for the area and the rooms are clean, updated and comfortable.  I had a very nice stay and will come again.

My wife and I travelled alongwith family of my friend who also have 2 kids like mine. I was looking for a good deal for staying close to Disney Resorts and at the same time had tight budget. I found a deal at Best Western Meridian Inn and Suites for staying 2 nights in a kingsize suite along with complimentry breakfast( not continental). The staff was very courteous and friendly and they even allowed us to check-in early as we reached there from Vegas by Van early. There was pool in the backyard which we could not use because of our own hectic schedule.Lots of parking all around the hotel and elevator as well. The deal was 433 usd which also included price of two 2 days adult hopper tickets to disney land and California Adventure Park. Also they arranged 2 tickets for our kids

The room was very spacious. It felt like a 1 bedroom apartment. The decor was up to date. We loved having 2 tv's so both the kids and adults could enjoy programs. The drive to Disneyland was only a few minutes away. The breakfast was hot and fresh, better than a continental type.  Very clean.

This is a great hotel, great location, great rooms. On the downside the internet was a bit slow, and the buffet wasnt great.  But the reason Im giving it a bad review is the managements inflexibility when it came to reservations. When I booked online there were 3 rates. Non-refundable, Internet Only Special price, and the Best available rate. I knew we may have to change things around, so I did not select the non-refundable and went with the internet only price. I booked for 7 days.  After 4 days we were invited to a family's place in Nevada, so we needed to leave after 4 days. I let them know 2 days in advance that I was going to go.   The day before the manager contacted me and told me I still have to pay for 3 days as I didnt give them 7 days cancellation notice... I argued
Manager Response: Thank you for your review, however, please allow us to further clarify our stance on the situation.  Other than our non-refundable rate, we have two other options for our customers as shown below:  -The Best Available Rate, is the most flexible rate that gives our guests the right to cancel or change their bookings up to 24 hours prior to arrival.  -The Internet Only Rate is a discounted rate only bookable online and requires a full payment at the time of booking; however you may change or cancel it up to 7 days prior to arrival date for a full refund.  According to your review, you booked our Internet Only Rate, which means you had to cancel 7 days prior to your stay for a full refund. You had already stayed 4 full nights and the 24 hour cancellation policy that you mentioned only applies to our "best available rate" not our "internet only special", as shown above.  General Manager Rania T.

Summary: I stayed at this hotel for a conference at Santa Ana Community College and was pleased to have a room that was right next to my colleagues.  The hotel staff were very pleasant and helpful.  I appreciated all the amenities provided and was impressed with the green efforts - not needing to have the bedding changed if requested, shampoo/conditioner/soap dispensers.  The breakfast was also amazing!  Thank you for a wonderful stay!

Summary Heading: Exceptional value, very clean and comfortable accommodations
Summary: Our first time staying here, we booked for four nights but not knowing the hotel or the area thought we would check it out the first night then decide for sure as we also like the BW in Newport.  This was very nice, clean and convenient location in a good neighborhood (that was our biggest concern).  Room was very large with 2 very comforatable queen beds in the bedroom and a sofa, table and a 2nd flat screen tv in the living room area.  Also less expensive than some of the Newport one which smells very musty.  Next time we will return here.  I just wish that the hot breakfast would change a bit from day to day.  After 3 days of the same scrambled eggs and sausages that had a very bread like texture (filler?) we decided to go out for our last morning.  Newport BW changed it up a

The worst hotel I've ever stayed at.  It is run by children.  Filthy, discusting, and sickening. Stay away whatever you do.  It should be called WORST WESTERN. Avoid at all costs. Rates zero out of 5.  Sickening!

We stayed here for our trip to Disneyland and found it to be an excellent hotel.  From the outside the hotel looks older, but our room was incredible.  I don't know if they recently went through a reno, but we were completely impressed.  We had a king suite, which was more than what we imagined.  The queen pullout was great.  Most pullout mattresses are horrible, this one was actually very good and are two young kids slept on it very well.  Our king bed in the other room was amazing.  I wish I could have taken it home.  I can't believe we didn't have to pay more for the room than what we did, less than $100/night.  The staff was friendly and helpful.  With going to Disney the shuttle came every hour and even with having to pay $10 for the 4 of us, was still worth it.    The

Summary Heading: This is the nicest hotel near the Block of Orange
Summary: I love the king suite. The 2 flat screens in each room was great and so is the floor plan. Free breakfast in the morning was delicious.

Summary Heading: Great place to stay with small children!
Summary: This hotel is an all suite hotel, so you get two fairly large rooms...one is a bedroom and bath and the other is a combination living room/kitchen.  There is a flat screen TV in each room with a door seperating them.  So once you get the kids settled down for the night you can relax on the living room couch and catch the news.  It was great for us because we had 3 kids ages 3,6 & 8.  We actually rented two suites and the grandparents stayed in one with one of the kids and the parents stayed in the other with the other two kids. Of course the kids were running down the hall between the two rooms, but hey....they're kids.  After a day at Disney they would all fall asleep in the car and we would just put them to bed when we got home.  There is free parking at this hotel and it is

My wife, 9 year old son, and 4 year old daughter stayed at the Meridian from 12/29 to 1/3 and had very little complaints.  We arrived around 4:00 or so and it was pretty quiet.  Check in was quick and the man on duty offered local eating advice.  We settled in our room and headed out to get food to stack the mini fridge.  We also had a microwave that came in handy a few times when we had leftovers from meals out.  The mini kitchen doesn't have place settings or utencils, so plan accordingly if you're thinking about eating in to some degree.  All the furnishings seemed quite new and in good shape.  The bathroom shower remodel work was not the best looking job, but it was certainly clean.  The water pressure was great and we never ran out of hot water.  The kids and I took

Stayed here from Wednesday night through Saturday, to celebrate New Year's Eve with friends. Since we drove here and had free parking passes with our AAA 2-day Disneyland passes, it was actually quite convenient. It's about 2 miles (two or three exits down) away from DL, down the road from the I-5, and a lengthy block down from a shopping center with various chain restaurants.   Pros: The suite itself was very nice for the price ($80 per night average for a King two-room suite, including a small kitchen area, Queen fold-out couch, two flat screens, and a comfortable California King). The parking and wi-fi was free, which you will not get at most of the hotels within walking distance of Disneyland. Breakfast was free (but I would stay away from the re-constituted eggs!). It's a

Stayed here for New Years Eve with friends.  Had a King suite.  Was greeted with a very helpful and friendly staff. Check in was smooth.  The rooms were great! beds are fantastic! So much so that I am buying one from the manufacterer! Had a great night sleep. Breakfast was also great - sausage, scrambled eggs, waffles - all hot and fresh, also a good selection of fruit, cerial pastries etc.  I would not hesitate to reccomend this hotel . Also the price was VERY good. definately well worth the money.  It was refreshing to stay in such a gereat place.

Excellant check-in experience even though we got in after 11pm on 12/18.  2 Queen suite was exactly as requested, 1st floor and close to laundry.  Rm 130 is very convenient: footsteps from vending machines, dining room, pool w/ jacuzzi, gym and front desk. Room is modern and clean.  Everything works fine. Beds are very comfortable.  Lights could be located more conveniently throughout suite. Could hear running from upstairs, but probably just a young child, expect that being so close to Disneyland. Location is excellant, got to Knotts Berry Farm in less than 15 mins. and Disneyland is about 10 mins. away.  Block at Orange mall is 3 blocks down the street. Eateries right next to hotel.  Housekeeping is excellant, complimentary breakfast is convenient, satisfying, and really saves

Only there for two nights but the room (suite) was just grand, breakfast is simple and yummy. Great place to stay if going to Disneyland. They have a shuttle that will take you to park and back for nearly peanuts! The desk staff was friendly and helpful on dining recommendations. You will not be disappointed! - B&K Tucson, AZ

Summary Heading: A good value and ideal location
Summary: This Best Western Inn/hotel is one of the better Best Westerns that I have stayed in recent years.  Hotel is ideally situated near a big shopping mall, the Angels baseball stadium, the local freeways, and a few miles from major attractions, such as Disneyland, California Adventure, Downtown Disney, and major restaurants.  Hotel has been recently remodeled with free Wi-Fi, which is not what I can say about other Best Westerns that I have stayed at.  The staff was friendly, courteous, and very helpful. The complimentary breakfast was better than the usual pastry, fruits, and coffee fare at other Best Westerns or other hotels.  If I had to complain about anything it is the new heating system, the lack of trash recepticles, and the in room clock/radio did not work, even though it

Summary Heading: Great Staff - Great layout - Great Hotel
Summary: We have stayed at this hotel on numerous times and each time we are thrilled that we have decided to stay there.  The hotel staff are great - the breakfast is better than expected - the room are spacious and well laid out.  It is a great hotel for a great price.  I would stay there again without even thinking about it.

We had to find a hotel quickly and close to a certain business. Looking on the web I found the Meridian Inn & Suites. Their prices were good, in fact great for the amenities that were promised. We arrived slightly early for check-in and were immediately allowed to check in. The person who checked us in was charming and accommodating to our every need. We had a room on the 3rd floor that was clean, quiet and with a great TV.  The hotel has gone green and a great job they've done. I would not hesitate staying here again in fact we'll be back in January.

The service was excellent. I was inpressed by the room because the price was cheap but i felt like if i was in a 5 star hotel. I enjoyed the privacy in the room.  I felt like if I was at home. I will be back....

We frequently stay overnight in the Anaheim area, for both business and leisure. For three years, now we searched for a clean, affordable, convenient place for a good night's rest in the midst of this mecca for vacationers. We finally found it at the Best Western Meridian Inn & Suites, in Orange. The charm of this location lies in the friendly staff, the recently remodeled suites, energy-efficient equipment and its location–far enough from Disneyland (about 10 minutes on city streets) to assure a good night's rest, but near enough to make it convenient to both the Resort and the Anaheim Convention Center. There's a complimentary breakfast with real food, (not just cereal, toast and prepackaged sweet rolls), served in a meticulously maintained dining area. For price, value and a

This hotel met all expectations and then some. The staff was very friendly and helpful and took care of all our needs and provided us with an excellent stay. Rooms were nice - we had a king suite. The breakfast was very good. My 2 year old daughter loved to play near the fountain by the swimming pool while we had our breakfast. Location is perfect if you want to visit Disneyland which is only a 5 minute drive.

Stayed here with 3 kids and my wife for 3 nights at Disneyland.  I can not believe the value of this hotel.  Included in the rate is breakfast, parking and free wifi and computer in the lobby.  The breakfast was adequate; certainly more than expected from a free breakfast and kept the edge off for a few hours until we had lunch at Disneyland.  Disneyland is only a few minutes up the road.  I had wanted to stay somewhere within walking distance but for the value of the hotel and the freebies I was quite happy to pay the daily parking fee at the park.  The hotel has been recently updated and have TVs in both the bed room and .  The rooms were fantastic and very large.  We were able to put the kids to bed and enjoy a couple hours or relaxing in the living room.  The rooms were

This was my first time in the Santa Ana area.  On the drive from LAX I was accompanied by more cars than perhaps should have been on the freeways.  I was exausted.  I was met at the counter with a smile and chearful voice.  What a relief!  I was quickly checked in and in my room.  Being late evening, I was hungry, so I asked for directions to some good food.  The front desk instructed me to go just down the street to the mall area and take my pick.  I enjoyed a wonderful meal.  The night was very restfull.  The wakeup call and a confirming call got me up and going the next morning.  That confirming call was great and needed.  The breakfast provided was well presented, tasted great and with a great selection, I was satisified and ready to attack the day ahead.  Checkout was fast

My family and I travel to So. Cal several times a year to visit the amusement parks and hang out in Huntington Beach. I have high expectations for the hotels we stay at and in the past, I've always booked our stays at the Hyatt in Huntington. For those of you not familiar with the area, it's one of the nicest hotels in the area. The economy hasn't helped our financial situation, so I researched bargain hotels in the area. This hotel received awesome reviews and although it's not located in Huntington Beach, it was only a short drive to our favorite destinations (2 miles from Disneyland and 15-20 minutes to HB). I took a chance and made reservations. From the outside, the hotel is just ok. The lobby is very clean and the staff was genuinely happy to see us. I was very impressed

Summary Heading: Comfortable room and a great value
Summary: The room was clean, appeared to have new furnishings, and quiet.  The suite is large and the pull-out sofa bed was comfortable for our pre-teen. The hot breakfast was an added bonus and the staff was very helpful. A great value that we would recommend to friends and family!

Wished I could've stayed longer!  This was the last hotel on our SoCal trip (our 6th hotel) and we definately saved the best till last. Rooms were lovely, decent shower, fridge, micro, sitting room, pool and hot tub and a gym (didnt use).  There was also one PC for general use - could've done with 2 available. The breakfast was disappointing but this seemed standard with the other BW we stayed at.  Theres a lovely donut shop opposite though! Close to the Block at Orange mall with a cinema, bowling, restaurants and shops. Staff are lovely and friendly - keep that up, well done! Cant fault anything. Will definately think of BW first when booking in the US in the future after our experiences this year.

I did quite a bit of research before selecting this hotel. Our family of 4 (2 adults, 2 kids) was looking for a suite with a kitchen that was close to Disneyland but not necessarily right next to the park. This place fit the bill perfectly and for the price, it can't be beat. The rooms are very nicely appointed (recently renovated), the beds (as mentioned by other reviewers) are VERY comfortable, and the living areas of the suites are spacious with a small microwave, large wetbar and a 3ft refrigerator. We asked for a suite facing the courtyard, which I think, offers a more relaxing ambiance than the suites facing the parking lot. The pool was not used at night while we were there so I can't say whether the courtyard gets noisy at night. The hot breakfast was as expected -

This hotel was beyond my expectations.  The staff was very friendly.  The room was very nice and extremely clean.  The bed was the most comfortable I have ever experienced in a hotel. The breakfast was listed as continental.  However it was a full breakfast with eggs, pancakes, muffins, oj, coffee etc. The location was near a very nice outdoor mall and easily accesible to the highway.  I will definately stay at this hotel again if in the area.  Absolutley no cons, all pros.

Summary Heading: We enjoyed the accommodations so much, we extended our stay.
Summary: Traveling all around the LA area (checking out colleges!) we extended our stay at the Meridian Inn & Suites. It had everything we could possibly want: spacious room, pleasant personnel, and a great breakfast. The location was convenient to many of our stops. We definitely will stay there again.

Given the amount we paid, this hotel gave us much more than we expected. We stayed in one of the suites, and the room is very spacious. One thing that impressed us was the extend to which they go with making the hotel green, while still making us staying comfortably. They don't provide those individual shampoo/conditioner packs, but rather they have dispenser installed at the places where you normally use them.  Their breakfast is ok, what you would expect from hotels like this. However, I have to point out, this is one of the few hotels in the area that provide free internet, breakfast, and parking.  Now on to the not-so-perfect things- Their pool's heater was out of service, so it was super cold to swim there, even during the day time. Also, their hotel map that was handed out

We had planned to stay 3 nights, however we were delayed arriving in Anahiem, so ended up staying only 1 night. The room was great, with two rooms our teenagers were able to hang out and watch their own t.v. The room also had a small kitchen set up, fridge and microwave with cabinets, so again would have worked out well for multiple nights. Breakfast worked well for us, fruit, cereal, toast and muffins, as well as fresh waffles - had breakfast by the pool - nice atmosphere. We would recommend this hotel, a car would be helpful to get around, The Block at Orange (outside retail plaza) and offered lots to see and do. Good access to the highways - Disneyland is about 10 minutes by car.

Other hotels managers should stay at this BW to see what customer service really mean. This group of Taiwanese investors have brought value and the level of service that is found throughout Asia. The complete facility has been renovated. The rooms are clean and well appointed. The continnental breakfast was beyond expectations with hot as well as cold selections. I highly recommend this hotel.

Summary Heading: Great Value - clean, spacious, gym and pool, courteous staff
Summary: Quiet, very spacious rooms - clean with multiple TV screens to keep everyone happy. Shower and tub, gym and pool. Breakfast included. Ample free parking and easy highway access. Staff was efficient and courteous. Rooms were spotless. A terrific value

Summary Heading: A great value for a reasonable price!
Summary: Excellent place to stay. Pool, hot tub and courtyard with fountain are enclosed by building, making the area private, safe and very cozy. Quiet, clean and friendly. Complementary breakfast was terrific. On site parking was convenient and secure. Easy access from freeway and close to huge shopping/dining plaza. Will recommend to friends and will use for business colleagues.

Great rooms, with large screen TVs. Great beds, sofa's were comfortable. Complimentary breakfast was acceptable (BUT eggs were not very good nor were the muffins), but coffee juice and waffles were good.  Pool was good, laundry was convenient. The hotel is a 2 minute walk to THE BLOCK shopping centre which was convenient. The shuttle comes to the front door which is good. There is a 'wet bar' but no plates or cooking utensiles so be prepared for that. Overall it is great value for money, good sized rooms, comfortable beds.  Would recommend this hotel. BEST thing for my teenage child was teh FREE wifi and free computer with internet. No other hotel was stayed at offered this.

We stayed at this hotel from Oct 1 thru the 4th and we really enjoyed it.  We decided to stay at this hotel because we got it for a really good price if you book through their website.  Room was big, super clean and comfortable.  The only complain we have is that the shower plumbing was making a loud noise and tub was plugged we didn't really mind the noise and the plugging happened the last day.  Hotel was about 10 min from Disney so it's ok if you are thinking about parking there.  Overall we really enjoyed our stay,  the free breakfast, free parking, free internet service all this helped a lot ! we will definately stay here again.

Summary Heading: Great stay until we were charged for something we didn't take
Summary: We had a great week at this Best Western.  The price was right especially for a suite, the room was clean, and the breakfast was good every day (especially the waffles!).  Very close to Disneyland by shuttle, and we really couldn't ask for anything more.  We thought we would definitely be back here all future trips to Disneyland and recommend the place to everyone we know.  The place was really excellent.  However the tide turned after we got home...   When we got home after we checked out we were told a memory foam pillow was missing from our room and we would be charged $50.00.  I couldn't believe it!  We did not take the pillow.  I'm not sure if this was just a one-time mix up or a revenue enhancement process that they occasionally scam to someone who stays here.  I tried to

Summary Heading: Great place to stay for a good price!
Summary: The room was just as nice as a Marriott for a lot less money and the location was just off a major freeway and close to everything we needed or wanted to do. The staff was very friendly and helpful and the free breakfast that came with it was awesome. Loved the mini waffles! This is now a "green" hotel and was great.  Saving energy but still was everything you want. I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone.  We will be staying here again!!!!

Summary Heading: Phenomenal Service..great bang for the buck!
Summary: The service was exceptional. The staff was extremely attentive, and really put the effort forth to make the stay as comfortable as possible. At one point, the owner/manager noted we were standing by the local transit stop, and advised the shuttles ran on the hour. After stating we had been standing there for 15 minutes, she went inside and called the shuttle service, came back outside to advise they were running late and would be arriving shortly. This level of service is above and beyond expectations. One point to note on other posts that have stated the breakfast was lacklustre....IT'S FREE!! The options included, scrambled eggs, waffles, cereals, hot cereals, coffee, juices, muffins, bagels, toast, sausages etc....not sure what they are talking about and I found it absolutely

This motel (outside corridors) has a very good curb appeal.  Brick 3-story fits in well with neighboring business park and is a quiet setting.  Suite configuration is good.  Center courtyard with inviting pool and water feature.  This is an old property that seems to have had several make-overs through the years.  Granite-looking floor and countertops in bathrooms.  The negatives: breakfast is only fair.  Odd configuration of on & off switches in rooms--they are hard to find.  Two big drawbacks: lots of plumbing noise from adjoining rooms!  They have replaced a/c units with fans that are very distracting.  If you run A/C through the night they constantly wake you up.  Maintenance guy tried to turn down the motor speed but was not much improved.  All in all this motel looks good

We were very pleased with the entire experience. We found the three mile drive to disneyland very convenient and the value of the rooms was on par with that of a hyatt or marriott suites. The room was clean and comfortable.

Great service. Nice clean & large rooms. Nice location near the Block @ Orange. Recieved a Free upgrade to the suite and I couldn't complain. Room was roomy and comfortable adn will recommend for anyone to stay

Summary Heading: Very comfortable and accomodating.  The suite was a plus!!
Summary: We were staying in Orange for an event, and had 4 adults and one child.  I had a hard time finding one room that we could all fit in.  The room that we got at the BW Meridian was absolutely perfect.  It was a two room suite, with a half refrigerator, full kitchen sink and counter, dining table, and microwave.  The beds were extremely comfortable with down comforters covered in duvets and very soft sheets.  Definitely not regular scratchy hotel sheets.  The pillows were fantastic.  The four adults slept in the two beds and our 6-year-old slept on the comfy couch.  Extra blankets were already in the room.  The plus was the free breakfast buffet in the morning.  This consisted of scrambled eggs, waffles, bacon and sausage, muffins, bagels, cereal and milk, coffee and tea, and a

Summary Heading: Very Impressed, not at all what I had expected!
Summary: I went to this Best Western because Me and my boyfriend needed to be to court at 8 the next morning. The hotel was located on the same street as the court house and very easy to locate. I stay at Best Westerns often because I enjoy the free breakfast and the cheap prices. So when I booked this stay I figured it was going to be just like the others. I got an $80 room rate so i figured it was going to be go in dont touch very much sleep and get out. I was dead wrong. The room was right in the middle of the court yard by the pool and directly across from breakfast. When I walked in the room the first thing I noticed was the giant comfortable looking bed with very white linens. The mattress was so comfortabe I slept better than I have in a long time! (me and my boyfriend share a

I travel a lot and can be critical of most hotels. I really enjoyed staying here. One of my must haves when I travel is high quality beds, linen and towels. This place had it all and a great staff! I also liked the two flat screen tvs that were in the room. Breakfast was average and it is a drive to Los Angeles and the beach. But it is very close to the stadium.

Have stayed here many times before when it was a Hampton Inn.  It had really gone down hill.  Best Western has taken over and really done a great job.  The rooms are all remodeled and were very clean.  They have made the facility safer.  Breakfast was really good.  And the price could not be beat.  The staff was very nice also.  Only wished they had a junk food machine there!

Having no idea what this place was like prior to their extensive re-model last year, I'd say they did a very good job of turning this property into a facility I'd stay in again, and again. The king suite is quite comfortable, though pricier then I believe it needs to be. I wasn't particularly impressed with the internet connection, though it was free. Proximity to The Block shopping center was helpful. Yes, it's walking  distance, but I believe one is better served driving. Too many busy intersections to negotiate on foot.

We stayed here on our 4 week  trip from Europe to the USA on our first 4 nights, and on the night before returning. A very nice hotel, friendly staff, helpfull. We were of course quite jetlegged on arrival but they were very understanding and helped us in finding a place to eat (good opportunities very near by! Try the simple Mexican accros the parking lot!). Swimming pool is not olympic size but clean and family friendly, large enough to have a good swim. Very nice patio, we loved to breakfast in the open air looking at the humming birds. Even special requests ("can you store this dress untill we return in 3 weeks") were met with a smile and "Yes".
Very quiet and clean.  Everything is new.  Doesn't look like much from the outside but don't be fooled.  The rooms are great.  Close to everything, king suite for under $100.

Summary Heading: Love it, Love it Love it!!!!
Summary: This BW Meridian hotel near disney land was one of the best hotels I've stayed in LA. That is ofcourse for the price range I was willing to pay. I was expecting a not so great hotel for the price we paid but I was surprised. The hotel is in a great location just 10 mins frm DL. The rooms are big and spacious so if you are travelling w/ kids this hotel is for you. It has two flat screen TV sets. One in the bedroom and one in the living area. The beds were amazing very fresh and comfy also the decor is very modern. Breakfast was good as well. Service at this hotel was excellent with friendly staff. There is a pool & hot tub though we never used it. Would come back.

Summary Heading: Definatly a 8 out of 10 experience.  Worth the visit!
Summary: We stayed 3 nights here at this hotel.  To start they were very accommodating on our late check-in.  The night staff was very helpful.  I personally do not like hallways that are open to the outside, but the way they secured the first floor was pretty innovative and make me feel OK with this setup.  We had 2 rooms, 1 (2) Queen bed room, and 1 king bed room.  Each room is a suite and they are very roomy, very clean and very up-2-date.  The decor is VERY nice.  The availability of the microwave and fridge was nice, the lack of plates and silverware (disposable or not) was a bit strange.  There are soap, shampoo and conditioner dispensers in the shower instead of the personal bottles.  This was indicated as a way to save the environment.  I personally was un-sure about the bath

Summary Heading: Our first trip to Disneyland, Meridian made it great, we'll be back :)
Summary: We're a family of 3 from Portland, Oregon -  two parents and one older teen.  Not being very familiar with how to find a good, clean and safe place to stay while traveling, we came here to Trip Advisor, and wondered how we'd know if these reviews were reliable...  Ironically, and thankfully :) while we were trying to decide, one of our favorite radio program hosts, Clark Howard, was talking about just that very dilemma most people face, and his advice was to look at the general, overall rating because of course there will be varying opinions.  It's not easy to decipher accuracy when so many reviews are good, and then you come upon a review that is in complete and total contrast... what to think...  If you're like us, you may wonder also about the sources of the reviews, but we

Summary Heading: This is a great stay for the price-very clean!
Summary: This hotel has recently been remodeled/renovated and is an exceptional location for the price.  Located very close the freeways and malls, which makes it very convenient.  Had a quick and easy check-in and every request was met with a smile.  The room was VERY clean and tidy, and asthetically pleasing to the eye.  The bed was a dream, best night's sleep at a hotel in a long time.  Didn't try the pool, but it looked very inviting.  No complaints about breakfast, especially because it was included in the great rate, and the mini waffles were great!  I highly recommend this hotel for all your travel needs, will return soon :).

THis was a BEAUTIFUL hotel. We very much enjoyed our stay. The rooms were spacious, clean, comfortable, and very modern. We enjoyed our stay so much that we will be returning to this hotel EVERY TIME we visit Disneyland.

Summary Heading: Great price, great complimentary breakfast, friendly staff!
Summary: We stayed here for 6 nights due to the great reviews that I had read prior to our trip..the staff was very nice at check-in.  Breakfast was great!!  We had a king suite, with a small fridge.  I did call the front desk to request a microwave upon arrival, they did say they had some available..however they asked if I could use the one that was down the hallway from our room in the laundry area..so it wasn't too convenient on some nights.. when I needed it at 10:30pm for a bag of popcorn (maybe they only had a limited amount available?)  The computer with free internet access that they had in the lobby, was TONS of help!!  Overall I would stay here again, I just hope they consider letting me have a  microwave in my room next time :)

Summary Heading: Very,very Pleased..."Best Bang For the Buck"
Summary: We have traveled to Anaheim for leisure visits often over the last 15 years.  I can honestly say we have never had such comfortable, pleasing accomodations as we had at this hotel.  We had checked out a couple other hotels/motels in our AAA book before remembering we are members of the Best Western Rewards program, so we clicked on to the Best Western Sight, and found  this one.   From the 1st conversation with the receptionist we were impressed with the customer service.  Then hearing the price of the accomodations, and all the ammenities, we were hooked.  The staff was extremely friendly, courteous and helpful.  The room, king suite (king bed in one room, sofa sleeper in the living area) , was modern, luxurious, eco-friendly, and most importantly, clean.  My husband loved the

Summary Heading: Excellent Value.  Newly renovated and consumer friendly "Green"
Summary: This hotel is near a business park and is conveniently located off the freeway.   The newly renovated hotel and staff were welcoming upon arrival.  We were upgraded to a King Suite from the king standard room that we booked.  The bed and bedding were soft and  wonderful.  The new A/C system shows a real conscience effort regarding energy consumption.  Your key must fit in a switch and stay there in order  for the heat or air to be running.  No more leaving the room and wasting energy.  Also the tub/shower is updated with newly appointed dispensers of soap, shampoo and conditoner. The same is true for the sink area with dispensers of soap and lotion.   No more little bottles of half used product in the land fills.  The breakfast buffet was also excellent with its offerings;

Summary Heading: Very good hotel for a reasonable price
Summary: Very good hotel - its rooms are very spacious, the included breakfast is good , offering much more food than we (brazillians) usually have in the morning.The location is pretty good too, not far from Disneyland and Honda Center, near to The Block at Orange Mall and just one block from the trail that is parallel to the Santa Ana River, excellent for running and biking. We have considered staying in L.A., but the money that would be spent on breakfast, Internet access and parking would be enough to pay the stay in this hotel.

If every Best Western is as nice as this, it could become my favorite hotel chain.  We booked this hotel because of the TripAdvisor reviews we read.  We were so happy that the place was as good as most of the reviews said it was.  We knew it was a 10 minute or so drive to Disney, which was well worth the $$$ we saved by staying at the hotel.  The rooms were spacious, which is great when traveling with 2 little ones, the breakfast was good and the staff was extremely helpful and kind.   This was the last hotel we were staying in during our week and half trip through California, and the only one that already had the crib in the room before we checked in. I would stay here again and would recommend it to anyone who would be traveling to Disneyland.

Summary Heading: Best place we have stayed in years.
Summary: My daughter is on a traveling basketball team and so for the last three summers we have been staying in many different  hotels. This was our favorite of them all. We stayed 3 nights and loved it . The suite was very modern and roomy, we especially liked having the separate living room with a couch and chair. The frig. and sink also came in handy. The breakfast was above average and the pool and courtyard were great. The staff was very friendly and accomodating. It is only about 10 minutes from mater dei high school if you are in a tournament there. It is right down the street from where the angels play baseball and not too far from disneyland. Evan the beach was only about a half an hour away. I hope we get a chance to stay there again.

Summary Heading: Spacious Suite; Friendly and Efficient Staff
Summary: Booked our stay after reading great reviews from previous guests.  We had been to Disney a year  and a half ago and stayed at the Doubletree Suites which we loved, but the Meridian had a great 3 night stay special  we could not resist.  We also were going to an Angels baseball game and thought we would try this convenient location.    We had a two room queen suite with full size fridge, microwave and smooth top range.  Our 7 yr. old son had command of the flat screen TV's in both the bedroom and living room area.  Ten minute drive to Disney, we even came back  to the hotel late in the afternoon and took a snack break and drove back to Disney in the evening with ease.  We had parked in Disney theme park parking in the day (12.00), but our parking was valid the same to day to park

Summary Heading: The Rooms Are Great Very Spacious And Welcoming
Summary: We checked in July 18 and checked out July 24 Front desk was nice and helpful, we asked for a quite room and w/ no problem recieved one. From the moment we walked into the room we were very pleased. Blankets pillows very comfortable especially from a long day out on disney or universal. I loved the safe in the room, you can customize your own pin to get in and out the safe. Breakfast was ok for being included in the room we only ate once due to the fact that the eggs seemed a little funny but cold cereal hot cereal pastries sausage juices I thought it was ok. As far as house keeping some days they would clean good others not so good. I also liked the fact that the alarm deck had an i pod hook up that worked out well.. I would recommend this hotel to others and we will be back.

Summary Heading: Good value for lots of room
Summary: We felt welcome from the minute we entered.  The staff was obviously invested in this hotel b/c they seemed concerned about making a great impression.  The rooms were spacious and nicely decorated.    The beds were comfortable, up--to-date TVs, alarm clock w/Ipod dock, "green" features, and microwave/small fridge (no freezer in our room).   The breakfast was hot, but not top quality.  Good enough for our family to eat before we spent tons of money eating at Disneyland.  Lots of people at breakfast, so be prepared.   I would stay there again, especially for the price we paid.

We scored a deal on this hotel. $90 + tax for a two room suite, with two queens in one room and a couch, chair and kitchen table for 4 in the other room. Not to mention the microwave, sink, hotel size refrig. and 2 flat screen 40" tv's. The 2 queen beds were very comfortable and provided a great nights sleep. They offer a free breakfast until 9:30 each morning, which was enough to get your belly filled for Disneyland. It is a 12 minute drive to Disneyland- DRIVING TIP- Take The City Drive (left out of hotel) to Katella (left) to Disney Way(right). Note-The City Drive changes name to State College, but is the same street. Back to hotel note: Staff was friendly and helpfull. Pool is on the small side but suits your needs. Hot tub is next to pool. We had a room (#320) on the top

I came in with a severe sprained ankle sprain from South Korea during the summer vacation time when the office is very busy.  But, rest assured, one of the manager took two of my biggest luggage and escorted me to my room and provided a service hard to find at big franchise hotels

I stayed in this hotel for 3 nights. I booked a suite. Very large and comfortable. Very clean. Not expensive compared to other hotels in the same area. The hotel is perfect for Disneyland (Anaheim), 15 minutes by car.

Summary Heading: Overall good value and comfortable stay, but u can hear casual converstaions and noise from everywhere
Summary: Check-in went well on 07/07 and the staff met our accomodations and expectations over our 4 day stay. Breakfast food (quanity and quality) was good, incl. the service. Kudo's here!  We requested the sheets to be replaced on our bed (seemed to be older ones) and they did with no question! Everything worked in the room, incl. microwave, refrigator, lights, TV's, phone and WiFi service.  The pool and spa where clean, and were not over chlorined.  I used to maintain a large Apt complex and home 'pool' thus have some experience here ;-)  so it was nice to get into the water that was well maintained!  The grounds were well all kept celan, incl. the sidewalks and patio deck. Heck they even had a service crew working on the entry signs (next to the street and sidewalk) polishing and

We recently stayed at the Best Western Meridian Inn and Suites, July 1 thru July 6, 2009 in Orange, California.  Oh my gosh, I am so glad we did. The hotel was close to shopping, dining, and Disneyland.. The rooms, we had 3 king suites, were huge, so nice and clean. The sofa bed made into queen size.  Luxurious bedding too. The room had a dining set, a sink and refrigerator (small size). The room was all we could ask for and more.  The room cleaning staff were very nice and accommodating. The hot breakfast in the morning was great, it included scrambled eggs, sausage (link and patty) and waffles. You could also select pastries, toast, english muffins, cereal.. What a great selection.. of course, coffee, milk and juices were included. The gentleman that assists you in the

Summary Heading: Probably one of the best hotels you can get in the area if you're on a budget!
Summary: TIP: 1.  Talking with the concierge was easy, ask them all of the questions you need and they will kindly take care of you. 2.  If you ever EVER have any issues with your room, let the concierge know and they'll take care of that promptly. 3.  The pool, mini-gym, and lounge area were beautiful one of the best renovations I've seen!

I was amazed when checked-in while attending a wedding in mid Jun. I used to stay at BW before but it came to be like 8 Motel (1-2 star), smelly and filthy rooms and switched to others.  To my delight, the hotel has been overall remodeled and the best part, no more smoking rooms with that stinky smell.  The room was clean, comfortable, and easy access to parking lot, swimming pool and the eating area.  The best low price for a room that looks like a suite with all commodities included.  I would recommend to my family and friends to stay at BW Meridian Inn & Suites when in Orange County.  I currently lived in Northern California but my next stay will be here during upcoming vacation to Disneyland.  The staff is courteous and knowledgeable. Thank you for making my stay a great one.

Summary Heading: Both the Rooms and the Location are AMAZING!
Summary: The Front Desk was very helpful, courteous, and willing to help.  I was greeted with a smile.  The rooms are simply amazing.  Very clean, large, comfortable, and well kept in terms of maintaining a very elegant and modern room decor.

I booked the BW Meridian for a family vacation through Expedia for the bargain rate of $80 a night for a King Suite.  I've paid twice as much for similar suites on business trips.  The King bed was super comfy and fit my wife and I and a little one in between.  There was also a queen sofa sleeper in the living room area.  We made good use of the fridge and microwave and ultimately, the suite gave us enough room for the little ones to run around and not feel completely cooped up in a hotel room with just beds.    We did have a problem the first night with the tub not draining well, but that was fixed the next day.  I only made it down to breakfast twice out of the 4 days we were there.  For being a free breakfast, it was nice to see some hot food (eggs, sausage).  The pool was

Summary Heading: Perfect for families on a budget going to Disneyland!
Summary: This was the perfect place for families wanting to go to Disneyland on a budget!  The kitchenette allowed us to pack lunches for the park and eat breakfast in the room.  The breakfast that comes complimentary was pretty gross so we ate our own food in the room.  You can have a microwave if you request one which really helps!  We were able to buy food at the store for dinner and microwave it.

We spent 13 days on the road from Kelowna BC Canada on our trip to Disneyland. This hotel was perfect in every way. Nice big room at a great price. Only 5 minutes drive to Disneyland, 45 minute drive to Universal and 2 hour drive to Sea World. The room was always clean for the 5 nights that we were there. The breakfast was excellent. The front desk was helpful with any questions we had. A nice touch was the free computer. I would reccommend this hotel to all my family and friends. The beds are soo comfortable, especially after a long day at Disneyland.

This was the second time we stayed here on our trip and it was just as good as the first. It offers the best value for money in california, and the suites are particularly remarkable. Comfortable, clean, well presented and spacious.   One thing that is worth noting though, is that the hotel is always very busy because it is so good, and probably because of it's proximity to Disneyland, so there were many many familys which led to a free for all at breakfast an by the pool.  The two evening desk staff males were fantastic, welcoming, friendly and exceptionally helpful. They really made the stay very enjoyable for us.

Summary Heading: The place feels like home and comfortable!!!
Summary: After driving 6 hours straight from Northern California, kids wanted to get out from the car and jump into the pool. We were exhausted but the hotel just made it perfect. We had 2 FLAT LCD SCREEN TV's in both rooms. The rooms are updated and felt that we were at home. Beds were fluffy and comfortable that my 4 year old wanted to jump up and down. Hotel is very accessible to many places such as Disneyland, Newport Beach, Outlet shops, and the famous University of Irvine Medical Center hospital. Next year we are planning to come back to this hotel in May 2010 since our daughter will be having a Baton Twirling Competition and be in the parade in Disneyland!!! I highly recommend this hotel to anyone especially with family. Excellent breakfast too every morning!!!

We traveled all the way from Florida to go to Disneyland. This hotel was great! Talk about location! Right off the highway, close to great malls and places to eat, a CVS nearby, about a 5 minute drive to Disneyland. We had a great stay here. Pool & hot tub were nice. Breakfast is the same everyday but it was still pretty good. People at the front desk are really friendly. What more could you ask for??

We stayed 5 days at the Meridian Inn while visiting the theme parks in the area.  The day we checked in we arrived about 6 hours eariler than the  normal check-in time and just wanted to store our luggage before heading off to one of the theme parks but the young lady at the desk allowed us to check into our room at that time which saved us time when we returned from the park.  Our room was very nice, clean, large and well maintained.  The facility appearance while not a 5 star property is definitely very good.  Everything appeares to be kept clean, the breakfast area is nice and quite busy - yes the eggs do taste a little powdery but at least there is a good variety.  The staff was always responsive to our requests and very helpful.  The only thing that could stand a little

Summary Heading: OK, if you can get a deal...
Summary: My family and I recently wanted to try and stayed at this "hotel" and it was just ok. Many reviewers loved this place and I would agree with many of them and recommend this place if you can get a rate of $80/night or less (as we did). The rooms (suites) were very spacious and the beds were comfortable. The 2 separate flat screens, one in the bedroom and one in the living room, were a nice touch. However, we found that the remote in 1 room would also change the channel in the other room while your other party is watching. We also had the TVs change channels without touching the remotes! We assumed it was from the people above or below us, as the TV in the bedroom is mounted near the ceiling. The shower/tub was relatively clean and neat, except that after about 5 min, the shower

Summary Heading: Everything I thought it would be
Summary: This is the first time I have viewed a hotel online only to find that the pictures and all were EXACTLY as they were online.  What a pleasant surprise.  VERY beautiful rooms.

Summary Heading: Elegant, updated decor with manicured pool and courtyard
Summary: The location is convenient to freeways but in a quiet area.  The room was immaculate and tasteful.  Beautiful pool area and courtyard.  The breakfast items were varied and the dining room opens to the courtyard for outdoor seating.  The staff was friendly and helpful. We enjoyed our stay.

We were very happy with this hotel.  It offered us everything we were looking for - extra space, free breakfast, pool, free wifi, refrigerator, great location - all for a great low price.  The hotel staff were very nice and helpful, the rooms were very clean, the beds were comfortable.  My 9-year old daughter slept in one of the beds and my 14 year old son slept in the living room on the sofa.  He had his own TV so he could stay up later and we could all go to sleep.  I would highly recommend this hotel for family vacations.

Summary Heading: Deserves the good reviews it gets!
Summary: I chose this hotel as a direct result of the reviews on Tripadvisor. When we pulled up in the shuttle from LAX, I began to doubt everyone's judgment; it looked old and severe. However, that impression was soon dispelled by the friendly staff. We were upgraded to a suite (thank you) and I can't begin to tell you how impressed we were with the cleanliness of the rooms! Fabulous! There's a Mexican restaurant/takeaway, a Japanese restaurant/takeaway and a sandwich bar right across the car park. There's a major shopping mall ("The Block") within easy walking distance -- but if you want to buy some drinks (beer, wine) for your room, it's a taxi job ... The transit bus for Disneyland and California Adventure stops right at the front door of the hotel. The included breakfast was, by
I enjoyed my stay for several reasons: conveniently located, very affordable, great breakfast, nice swimming pools and the staff is very friendly and helpful.

Summary Heading: Beautiful & open with spacious rooms; great value.
Summary: Our first stay at the BW Meridian Inn and we would certainly stay there again.  Lovely and open with center courtyard; spacious and nicely appointed rooms.  We were very impressed; a lot of value for the room rate.  It would be especially great for a longer stay because of all the amenities offered in the room.
upgraded to a suite at no extra charge. Breakfast was great !

This hotel just SURPRISED me (in a good way LOL), it was just like the website said and looked. The rooms were so spacious, the beds so were DAMN comfortable, the bathroom was clean and they had TWO flat screen TV's. The price was the very very very affordable!!! The pool and spa were wonderful. The FREE breakfast was really good too but get down there early because those people will eat it all from you and it was like 5 min on the 5HWY to DLAND from the hotel. DON'T Ever stay in any hotel on west BALL ST. they have fleas that bite you and leave big red bumps on your skin!!!!!!

Summary Heading: Great place to stay in Anaheim area
Summary: This place is a great value! Less than a 10 minutes drive from Disneyland / Anaheim convention center.  Very nice, clean and comfortable rooms. The bed, sheets and pillows were a delight to sleep on. The breakfast was fine, it is free after all, and good enough to hold you over until lunch. Would stay here again!

Summary Heading: Nice escape from the craziness of Disneyland
Summary: The rooms were clean and comfortable.  The hotel was recently renovated, which is obvious - nice linens, big flat screen TVs, etc.  The breakfast was basically a continental breakfast with a waffle maker, but it's free.  Overall, the staff was helpful and friendly.  This place gets you away from the hustle and bustle of the Disneyland area, but it's easy to get back there by riding the ART shuttle from the hotel.  This hotel also had plenty of parking on the weekend since it's in a business area.

Summary Heading: Most comfortable beds in the universe!!
Summary: All I Can Say Is Wow! Beautifully Remodeled Hotel, Amazing Customer Service, Brand New Flat Screen Tvs, And The Most Comfortable Beds In The Universe!  My Boyfriend And I Were Supposed To Wake Up At 7 To Head To Disneyland, And We Were So Surprised To Awaken At 930! These Beds Are Amazing!  This "Green" Hotel Is So Wonderful, We Are Looking For Any Excuse To Go Back! WE EVEN CALLED TODAY TO GET THE MANUFACTURER OF THE BEDS AND PILLOWS, WE LOVED THEM SO MUCH!

Summary Heading: Excellent Experience - Best Value I Have Found in a Long, Long Time
Summary: I travel almost weekly all over the west and have not found such a business-friendly, comfortable hotel in many years.  I arrived several hours before check-in time, but had to attend a meeting and needed to iron my shirt.  Sheryl, the owner, actually took the time to help me iron my shirt so I was able to make it to my meeting.  I have not seen this level of service at anything less than a Four Seasons.  The hotel is new and in great shape, is a "green" hotel, a beautiful courtyard/pool, very comfortable beds and pillows, immaculately clean, responsive and friendly service/employees, and a good location.  An amazing complimentary breakfast, also.  I cannot recommend this hotel enough - and is the best value I have seen in a long, long time.

I am a returning customer at this hotel.  I was here a couple of months ago.  I was impressed during my first couple of visits, however, this vist really showcased this hotel.  The staff was exceptional including the front desk people.  The housekeeping people went out of their way to help - I guess I'd say above and beyond most hotels.  The breakfast was great - a nice way to start your day with lots of options and everything was so fresh.  The money we saved by eating breakfast helps in the overall cost of the trip.  Also nice the breakfast is right there so you don't have to leave the hotel to get something in the morning.  The pillows were wonderful.  I love the pillows on the bed - nice to see some options rather than just the standard "flat" pillows you typically find at a

This hotel is a gem!  Although it is not directly located from amusement locations, it is located within close proximity to all attractions.  The rooms are spacious, two queen size beds, very clean, and we got a kichenette with a microwave, sink, and refrigerator with a separate living room and dining room area.  We got the best deal of hot breakfast included consisting of freshly made waffles,scrambled eggs, sausage, cereals, breads, fresh fruits, juices, coffee, and especially hot chocolate.  Two large flat screen TV.  Free internet access in your room and free parking also!  The check-in and check-out went very smoothly.  I would normally keep this place a secret, but since I can't travel here everyday, I want to share this excellent hotel to others.  When I travel to LA
Great place for a really good price! Planning on another trip soon...

We had 20 people in our group from Taiwan to the U.S. for a 21 days tour last month. Best Western Meridian was the first hotel for our trip, and I must say everyone was beyond impressed. If only the reminder of our trip had hotels  just like this. Everyone loved Meridian's home feel and sized of the suite, it even had 2 plasma TV. My wife and I sleep in the bedroom and our 2 kids sleep in the leaving room. We travel a lot and this "2 rooms suite" was more like what you can see it at other hotels when you get the presidential suite. It gave us room to relax at the end of a day  as we were tired but the kids still had energy. I thought we got lucky because we were only party of 4 in this group that really needed a 2 rooms suite, but all of our group got suites. The general manager

Our 1 bedroom suite was terrific!  The four of us could all be together in the living room or divide up when the parents needed some quiet time.  The room decor was maybe not quite as nice as a Hampton Inn but pretty close.  It included 2 flat screen TVs, refrigerator, and a microwave once we asked for it.  There is a little highway noise but I never noticed it unless I was listening for it, even at night.  There was no noise from other guests but one morning; that may be due to low occupancy or thick walls  The rest of the hotel is older but clean and well kept.  The pool seemed nice but we didn't try it.  Breakfast included waffles, scrambled eggs, sausage, bagels, pastries, cereal, coffee, milk and juice.  The location provides easy access to a nearby boutique mall,

This hotel has a separate bedroom suite and living room.  Separate sink and mini refrig are a great convenience.  Free wifi access from the rooms.  Two large flat screen TVs with one in bedroom and second in living area..  Free parking.  The exercise room is limited with one elliptical machine, one tread mill and one universal gym.  Breakfast is included (eggs, sausage, danish, cereal, waffles, fruit, etc.).  Located about 5 minutes from Disneyland, so thats probably the reason its still a secret to most travelers.  Located two blocks from the Block at Orange.  Very clean.  Only drawback was that though rooms are nonsmoking, the exterior hallways have ashtrays that allow smokers close to the rooms.

Summary Heading: Close to disney,totally free parking,free real breakfast,plasma tv's YES!
Summary: This hotel is about as real of a gem as you can find in anaheim, its only about 5 minutes from Disney,has free parking even if you have more than one car and offers a very sizeable breakfast with hot items included! The rooms are very large well laid out and both the bedroom and living room area have flat screen plasma tv's! there is a good size fridge much larger than the small minis most hotels have but also note there is no freezer at all in these fridges so youll still need a cooler. no in room microwave but at least there is a comfort station available with a microwave in there as well as vending and washer/dryer. pool is clean and hot tub great as well. Honestly the true gem is that its only 5 minutes from disney but away from the hustle and bustle so you are not hearing

We stayed at the BW Meridian right after they had finished a major remodel.  Everything in the rooms is brand new -- our suite had a kitchen, and two plasma TVs.  The waste-not-want-not mentality means things like: the lights go out when you leave (the light switch uses your card-key).  The soap and shampoo come from stylish dispensers instead of disposable containers, and the bed had something more like a duvet than a true bedspread.  We understand that's because of a desire to always supply clean linens, while the bedspread may not always be cleaned at many other hotels.  The room was impeccably clean and very comfortable.  The staff were friendly and very helpful without being obtrusive.

Summary Heading: Hotel has quality, value and service - New Owners Hit the Mark
Summary: We booked a king suite and a queen suite.  The rooms exceeded our expectations.  The hotel had recently gone through a complete remodel and it showed.  Everything was new and well thought out.  The lobby was welcoming and the staff was excellent.  I would recommend the hotel to anyone.  I ran into another guest at breakfast that had stayed at the hotel (called Hawthorne then) before the remodel.  He told me that he hadn't planned on coming back, but had heard of the change and was glad that he did.  I've stayed at several hotels in the area over the years and I don't know any that offer what you get at the Meridian unless you spend much more.  You will appreciate the hotel If you are in the area for business or Disneyland, etc.  I know we did after trying to keep up with our

I stayed here for 2 quick nights on business. Very comfy beds and great breakfast! The room is spacious and clean. I didn't use the pool, but it looked quite nice. I would definately go back here again. It is quite far from Disney, but the ART shuttle runs from right outside the hotel. I wasn't in the area for Disney (wish I was!). I did go to the block at orange one evening and its a 15 min slow walk.

This hotel is so clean, spacy  and modern. I love the modern touch to the rooms. We stayed in the suite with two queen beds and there was a cool flat screen tv and in the living room area where the couch was there was also a cool tv. The decorations, curtains and bedding are all so modern and nicely decorated.  Everything was so nice and so is the staff .  I would recommend this hotel to anyone its so affordable too. I would definitley go there again :)
Fantastic and clean pool and spa, room, gym.  Price is the best part; Nice and quiet, friendly staff.  Very close to Disneyland and grat room.

This hotel is awsome, "Clean", "Comfortable", "Homey".  It's more than what I expected.  Flat screen TVs are available in both bedroom and living room.   Friendly stuffs, comfortable beds and their decaroation let me feel like home.  Clean towels are always available at pool side.   Moreover this hotel just few miles away from Disneyland. My family had a joy staying in this hotel.   I highly recmmend this hotel for either family vocation or business trip.m

The Hotel is very good in general. The rooms are clean, the breakfast is ok, the bed is very comfortable, but what is really outstanding is the staff. The guys were  so friendly that I felt like home. Everybody. Starting with the General Manager Mr. Moctar to Sinned, Oscar. You know, I Highly recommend this hotel. Me and my family had a great time there!

The hotel has changed ownership since our previous stay, and the rooms are now spotless with new beds, new paint and new furniture.  Very comfortable room, great staff, and I loved the free wireless connectivity.  For those who like it, flat screen TVs are available in both the sitting room and the bedroom.  As always, the location is ideal for reaching any place in Orange County with easy freeway access that's just far enough away so that it's not a noise factor.  We plan to stay here on all our trips to Southern California.

Summary Heading: Very Nice Hotel with Excellent Service
Summary: We stayed at this hotel for six nights from Dec 26th until January 1st and overall were very happy with the hotel and the staff that worked there. The hotel is very clean, provides a good breakfast and the staff who work there are very friendly and accomodating.  We used the hot tub, which was very nice and our girls liked swimming in the pool; however, I found it a bit on the cool side.  The only down side is the distance from DL. Although the hotel is only a five minute drive it takes 20 minutes on the ARC bus system from the hotel to the park and it only runs once an hour. If you want to be able to go back to your hotel room using the ARC that runs only hourly makes it very difficult.  We didn't find this too much of a problem as when we went to the park we planned to stay

We only stayed at this hotel for one night, but had a great stay!  They have recently remodeled the place and the rooms are really nice. They have implemented many environmentally friendly items such as dispensers for all the hair and body products and the products themselves are environmentally safe.  The location is great also.  We were only a short walk from the Block at Orange which has just about everything you could need.  Since it was winter we did not use the pool, but the it looked nice and there was a lot of space around the pool for relaxing.  The wireless internet worked great.  The free breakfast was your standard best western type of items.  Overall, they have done a wonderful job with this place.

I compared a lot of hotels and chose the BW Meridian on price and the Best Western reputation.  We normally stay closer to the Anaheim Resort, but the BW was 40% less, which matters if you want to be able to spend $$$ at Disneyland.  As we approached it, I felt the property was too-out-of-the way, but it really wasn't:  it's 10 min away from the park.  The hotel itself is non-descript. I went in to check-in at 2PM, but was told my room wouldn't be ready until three.  The hotel couldn't have been more than 5% full, but was informed they only had 9 deluxe rooms. No problem, just beware if you are looking for early check-in for certain rooms.  We returned at midnight--the keys were ready, no problem. As I passed the pool en route to room, I noticed how clean it and the spa were,

The El Capitan Girls Water Polo Team came in from San Diego for a weekend tournament.  The hotel was able to suit our every need.  Check in for a large group can sometimes be hectic, but the staff did a great job, even going the extra mile to allow us to use a meeting room for a pre game discussion.  The rooms were clean and elegant and being a chapparone for the event, I felt very safe watching over our group with the secured doors to enter the hotel.  We had an early game on Saturday morning and the ease of having breakfast at hand made getting started a breeze.  We will no doubt book again with this hotel in the near future whether for Team use or personal use.

I have three children and their grandparents are a few minutes away from the hotel.  We have stayed at the Meridian (formerly Hawthorne) Suites two or three times per year  for the past five years or so.  We saw the property change from a nice family-oriented hotel to a dump.    Over the past year, there has been a complete renovation and a change of ownership and management.  We stayed a couple of times durning the renovation and were very impressed with the completed job when we stayed over the Thanksgiving Holiday this year.    My only hesitation in recommending the hotel is that I'm afraid it may become so popular that I won't be able to get reservations.

I used to stay at this property frequently but it had become run down. The new owners must have spent millions to get this property in tip-top shape! Everything is brand new! Cozy colors and new fabrics.

The Meridian Inn has just been remolded and location was great and close to everything. The staff was friendly and helpful, I was surprised the room was so clean and nice with the very fair price, I would definitely stay here next time.

I visit Orange County every 2-3 months and have been staying at this property for about 2 yrs now.  The reason why I would stay there was because it was convinient and so close to The Block.  It wasn't the cleanest hotel ever but it was ok, then they got new owners and started the remodeling process.  I recently stayed with them and they have finished remodeling.....and let me just say....when we walked in it was AMAZING!!!!!  Everything from the massaging shower head, fluffly white towels, super comfortable beds with amazing pillows, granite counter tops, beautiful....just beautiful!  Now I will be staying there for the comfort and convinience.  They did an awesome job with their remodel and highly recommend this hotel.  Lorena, front desk, is awesome and so very helpfull.

We were traveling to San Diego for business.  On our way, we wanted to stop and visit some friends in the City of Orange area.  Our friend recommended the Meridian Inn as it has new owners and was just been remolded.  The staff was very nice and personal.  They made every effort to make our stay enjoyable.  The room was very clean with all white linen.  Something I do not see in a hotel at this price range.   We will be in the area again in a few months to visit Disney Land.  My wife and I will differently be staying at the Meridian Inn again.
